story:
What is TeleRide?

TeleRide is the first in a series of products aimed at introducing a new value added to the racing game market. It's basic competitive advantage is that it combines the skill of driving with strategic thinking. 

TeleRide includes the following features of a traditional racing game:

  • speed and action,

  • physics-based drifts, slips and collisions,

  • full contact competition with other cars,

  • tracks with varied and interactive surroundings,

  • a good selection of cars with diversified attributes,

  • a possibility of choosing an individual driving specialization,

  • plenty of fun provided by winning additional competitive features for cars and working toward more complicated levels,

  • nice-looking graphics based on a customized engine.


In addition to this, a player gets a unique weapon which introduces an additional dimension to the competition.

For more information, news and feedback feel free to visit project website www.teleridegame.com

story:
Hi my names Chris. I am a first year college my local community college. I am one of three kids that are currently in school. So money is tight in my family. My parents a currently divorced and my dad doesn’t pitch in that much money for my siblings and me. And my mom is at a job where she doesn’t make that much money to support all of us all the time. My dad pays her each month a small amount for child support but that is over in a few months when my younger sister turns 18.

My campaign is currently to raise money so I can go buy a gaming desktop for my brother. He love playing video games and wants to study game editing in college. But since money is tight in my family he hasn’t been able to get one. He has been my role model since I was a little boy since my parents got divorced. That is why I have decided to start collecting money so I can buy him one. I feel that this is my way of thanking him for all he has done to help raise me with our mom.

Contributing anything to my campaign will mean a lot to not only to me but also to my brother. And anyone who does contribute will receive a personal thank you from the two of us.

As of right now I need £2000 to buy him a gaming desktop. I have been putting whatever money I have gotten in the 6 months into this fund for him. I didn’t ask a lot for Christmas and my birthday was a few weeks ago and the money I received from relatives has been put into this. If in the time I have set for this campaign that I don’t receive the £2000 I will use whatever money I have collected to buy a different gaming desktop that I can afford to buy him. And if my goal is reached in this time and more is made I will give whatever amount is to my brother.

Having this campaign goal realized will mean that my brother will be able to start his path onward towards a career in the gaming community. He is limited to what he can do because right now he is using our old family laptop from 2006. It is slow and is just an over all poor laptop.

If you read this and know you cant contribute to my campaign that’s okay. But if you know anyone that is able to, let him or her know of my campaign. Every penny will be appreciated.

story:
A Quick Intro

We have been working on the development of eOur World, a Society Simulation Game. However where we lack is in funding and the development can't go further.

Our game website that you can check out is www.eourworld.com.

We have been fleshing out the idea of this game for a long time.

That is why we have decided to start this project to fund the development for the eOurWorld, and we need your help!

What is eOurWorld?

In short, it is a Society Simulation Game playable in browser with a game story that starts in the near future of earth, roughly in the 2100 year. Based on the evolution of the game story the action of the game take place in our times. Below you can read the story and find out why.

In a distant future humanity evolved so much that was able to transfer human consciousness and knowledge into robotic bodies. The differences between humans and human robots were too big. Not long after that the war started. Both sides used mass destruction weapons. All died in this war. A scientist created in secret a virtual world identical with the destroyed one. The consciousness of all who died in the war was transferred in the virtual world machine. No one remembers who they were in the past. The new world became OUR WORLD.
Will you make the same mistakes?

Our World is a massively multiplayer online game (MMOG) playable in your browser. The game will involve players working together to decide the future of the world they live in. Some will be businessmen, others military and political leaders. They will work together, and use social strategy to decide the fate of Our World.

Why We Need Your Help

Hiring developers is not cheap. There are many costs associated, including getting concept artists, illustrators and more.

We need to raise $20,000 so we can hire better developers. Being able to get good developers, illustrators, stock photos and more within that budget we'll definitely finish a great game.

Check out the video above for more details, and the perks to the right to see what you'll get in return for helping us out.

What Happens If We Surpass Our Goal?

I would love to produce more ingame features and modules, and I would also like to produce a lot more concept and art.

If we do more than $20,000, we will use the excess money to do just that. On average every $1000 - $2000 above our goal will allow us to make and integrate another feature or game module (although it might be more as most of the costs will have already been covered).

Thanks in advance!

If you have any questions, please email Constantin Catalin Stroescu at info@eourworld.com or visit www.eourworld.com.

Our 4GB USB Memory Stick

Claim it with the corresponding perk.

Our Laptop Skin

Claim it with the corresponding perk.

Our T-Shirt

Claim it with the corresponding perk.

Our Shoulder Bag

Claim it with the corresponding perk.

Toshiba Laptop

Claim it with the corresponding perk.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

It’s not just about funding , you can help by spreading the word. We would love to hear from you!

Please visit our website

www.eourworld.com

and join the fanbase:

www.facebook.com/eourworldgame

www.twitter.com/eourworld

http://www.youtube.com/user/eourworld

Thank you so much for getting involved!

story:
IndieGoGo does not allow modification to your pledge and charges you upon pledging. Refunds are only given on projects which do not fund; there is no "oh I changed my mind" mechanism on this site and the campaign organizers (LotFP in this case) have no control or access to such things. "Overflow" from one project cannot be transferred to another. Consider your choice to contribute carefully and be sure you mean it before you hit that payment button.

July 23 Update: $30+ contributions get a 16 page sandbox setting by Rob S Conley (Majestic Wilderlands, Points of Light 1 & 2, etc.) in print + pdf as an added Extra. Not to be released in any form outside these campaigns. Grab Bag contributions get to choose their adventures (up to 6). $160+ get an exclusive 64 page James Edward Raggi IV LotFP adventure. Not offered in this form outside these campaigns.  See the Updates tab for full details.

Lamentations of the Flame Princess presents Broodmother Sky Fortress by Jeff Rients, illustrated by Stuart Robertson

You know what your crapsack campaign world needs? Giants made out of sharks and elephants, lurking in a haunted house in the clouds, ready to jump out of cyclopean shadows and murder your PCs right in their stupid faces.

About the Author
Jeff Rients received the 1981 Basic D&D box for his eighth birthday and he's never been quite right since. A regular contributor to Fight On! magazine, a fixture at his local nerd conventions and a general purpose weirdo, Jeff is perhaps best known for his long running blog, the imaginatively titled Jeff's Gameblog, where his greatest contributions to the hobby may be rules for getting your PC into trouble while drunk or his theory that all RPGs are Retro, Stupid and/or Pretentious.

About the Artist
Stuart Robertson is a game designer and illustrator who has been a fan of weird sci-fi, comic books, monster movies, westerns, roleplaying games and miniatures since the early 1980s. He is the creator of the Weird West RPG and posts artwork at http://stuartrobertson.deviantart.com

About LotFP
LotFP is the publisher of Weird Fantasy Role-Playing, a horror-fantasy tabletop RPG. It is a second-generation retro-clone, which means that adventures compatible with LotFP are also compatible with over a dozen different games. A free no-art PDF version of the LotFP rulebook is available here. For more info hit the LotFP home page or LotFP blog.

This is one of a number of concurrent campaigns underway to get adventures by top talent published for LotFP. The full list:

Escaping Leviathan by Aeron Alfrey
The Seclusium of Orphone by Vincent Baker and Cynthia Sheppard FUNDED
Strange and Sinister Shores by Johnathan Bingham
Towers Two by Dave Brockie
The Unbegotten Citadel by Monte Cook and Eric Lofgren
The House of Bone and Amber by Kevin Crawford and Earl Geier
Of Unknown Provenance by Michael Curtis and Amos Orion Sterns
Machinations of the Space Princess by James Desborough and Satine Phoenix
Horror Among Thieves by Kelvin Green
We Who Are Lost by Anna Kreider
The Land that Exuded Evil by Cynthia Celeste Miller and Rowena Aitken
Pyre by Richard Pett and Michael Syrigos
I Hate Myself For What I Must Do by Mike Pohjola and Joel Sammallahti
Broodmother Sky Fortress by Jeff Rients and Stuart Robertson FUNDED
Normal for Norfolk by Juhani Seppälä and Rich Longmore
Poor Blighters by Jeff & Joel Sparks and Mark Allen
The Depths of Paranoia by Jennifer Steen and Jason Rainville
Red in Beak and Claw by Jukka Särkijärvi and Jason Rainville
The Dreaming Plague by Ville Vuorela and Juha Makkonen

For more information about this series of campaigns, to discuss contribution strategies, ask questions, or to simply comment about this madness, go to the message board for this campaign series here.

About the Campaigns

The "Extras" aka "What I Would Do With This" sheets are each a single A5 sheet written by James Edward Raggi IV advising how he would change an adventure to give it a different sort of twist or fit into his own campaign.

There are risks for choosing bundle options - if the project you chose the bundle options on does not fund, you'd end up with nothing. If fewer than expected adventures fund, you're paying more than you would have by contributing to each adventure individually. Be aware of how you are contributing and what cost/benefit ratio you're willing to risk.

The perks above the single adventure levels are leaps of faith representing a desire to help get things funded and a hope of a better deal - but this is crowdfunding, we cannot guarantee results.

What is the Pembrooktonshire Gardening Society?

That's the LotFP Fan and Discount club. It costs 10€ to join (+23% VAT for EU orders), and you get a 1€ discount on all print products in the LotFP store forever. Sometimes other benefits too, like saving $50 on an exclusive hardcover set in these campaigns. Details on joining the Society here.

Where Does the Money Go?

Two-thirds of the money goes to the talent working on the project: The writer, artist, graphic designer, editor. The rest goes towards printing and shipping (and IndieGoGo's fees). The exact figure varies depending on how many of which perks are chosen, but LotFP will not begin making money on these projects until they hit $7000. LotFP's profits will (hopefully) come after the adventures are released and you all start raving about how cool the adventures are so the non-hardcore supporters go for them.

Other Notes

July 10 Update:
(see the July 10 entry in the Updates tab for more info on these points)
All funded adventures will include a PDF supplement with conversions to the "OGL 3.PF" rules system.
A new funding level has been added: The 3.PF Faithful, with all these conversion notes and stats included in their own booklet
New perks and information for The Faithful and Collecting Faithful levels:

  • If you go in for The Faithful level or above, and that adventure is the only one that funds, you will receive a 100€ coupon for the LotFP store. If only that and one other funds, you will receive a 50€ coupon.
  • An exclusive 64 page adventure by James Edward Raggi IV. This adventure will never again be printed in this format (only an abridged 32 or 48 page version in the future), only those pledging at the Faithful or Collecting Faithful levels on funded adventures will receive it. There will be no PDF version of this adventure. This adventure does not count against the ones mentioned in the previous bullet point. It will be included in your Collecting Faithful package but will not be a hardcover inside the slipcase.
  • A booklet with all of the "How I Would Fit This Into My Campaign" sheets, with cover art by Zak S (Vornheim, Playing D&D With Porn Stars, etc), will be included with these perks (will not be made as a hardcover for the slipcase).

For the Grab Bags, you may choose which adventures you want.
A new perk: "Retail Support" has been added
Three random Collector-level contributors on funded projects will get to have a character of their choice drawn by Jez Gordon in a situation from a funded adventure of their choice, with this art appearing in the Extras booklet.
(end July 10 Update)

It is our intention to go to press in late November/early December. However, with a potential 19 authors and 18 artists involved, someone is likely to be late so the adventures may not ship out until the new year.

Some of the adventures in these campaigns will be for ages 18+ because of (im)mature content, so be aware of that before contributing to any adventures or multi-adventure perks. If you want to double-check whether any individual adventure will be an 18+ affair, leave a note in the comments and we'll get back to you shortly.

Adventure titles are all subject to change although I'll roast the authors' bits if they turn in something ridiculously different than their supplied description.

All prices include first class shipping from Finland, or a tracked parcel if your stuff comes out to over 1kg.

Each adventure is scheduled to be an A5 sized 32 page book and would retail for 10€-13€ ($13.00-$16.00 depending on exchange rates) not including taxes or shipping. The $20 single copy purchase price is the best approximation of the price including first class shipping worldwide but the real amount may or may not match that. Some adventures, depending on the adventure structures, may be more than 32 pages.

Each funded adventure will have a full print run done for distribution.

The author of a funded adventure will get 10% of all money raised above the $7000 mark, and the artist will get 5% of all money raised above that amount, in addition to their agreed-on fees. Additional profits go into the LotFP war chest.

story:
CardFury.com :

Find & swap local MTG trading cards via your phones gps (MVP)


Have you ever shown up to a tournament needing a play set of that one hard to find card? You play tested with it as a proxy and it totally makes the deck, however, you just have been unable to find it before now. You ask everyone you can, but no one has any extra. So you end up having to substitute that second choice card and your deck just does not play as well. Of course during the first break you run into 6 people that have the cards you needed and was looking to trade, but now it is too late!

Wouldn’t it be great if trading physical cards at an event was as easy as it is online? Online you visit the marketplace and everyone lists what they want and what have to trade, you run a search for the card you need, and everyone that has it pops up, you message them and the trade is made!

Our project is a mobile website that does just that. Over your phone or mobile devise you select the cards you have and the cards you are looking for. Then as others who have listed cards they have to trade come within your trade radius, or have listed they are at the same even as you, you can find them just like on MTGO Marketplace. Click trade on their card and they are notified. SMS each other and meet at the judges table or convenient safe location and make the trade!

  Select what you have to trade and what you need....


                   Find the Cards you need!

            (Above images are site mock-ups)



Members earn “CardFury.com TRADE TOKENS” for things like winning tournaments, trading cards with us and especially getting your friends to sign up. These tokens can be traded for MTGO tickets, CardFury.com memberships, cards, SWAG and a whole lot more. We are working on a 'Local MTG Store Membership Program' so you can trade them for in-store credit at your local member store.




Once we reach our goal, don't stop there!

Below is what we will do with the money if we exceed our $5,000 goal and meet these stretch goals:



Team Tournament -> Standard Swiss (MTG TEAMS) -> You’re the leader with 5 team mates -> Battle other teams -> Leaders pair up teams and leaders play each other. Each pair plays a 2 out of 3 match. Team with most game wins - wins the match. 1,000 Card Fury Trade Tokens Prize Pool.



Estimated Release Date : Mid 2014

If we reach our $50,000 we will start to work on our 2nd Generation -> Phone Camera input -> features. How would you like to fill out your MTG tournament Deck lists by just scanning your cards with your phone? Have it auto-populate your Deck list, you review it and then just email it to the head of the tournament for submission?

Main Deck:


 Sideboard:


To Decklist: (Of course we changed it last minute to different cards - which editing it is SOOO much easier then by hand in pen!




If we reach our $100,000 Stretch Goal, we will randomly choose 5 of our contributors for each of the next four MTG Pro Tour events and send them to the event! Qualifying for the event is up to you. We will pay your way and you can always compete in the side events! 


We want to thank all those who have taken their time to provide valuable insight on our mobile site and concepts. We cannot name you all but special thanks go out to these gaming shops who helped us refine everything :


Something2Do

Oxmoor Center
7900 Shelbyville Road
Louisville, Kentucky 40222
Tel: (502)425-5257

Bluegrass Magic

5629 Outer Loop
Louisville, KY, 40219, USA
Tel: (502) 964-1170

Through the Decades

story_txt:
CardFury.com : 

Find & swap local MTG trading cards
via your phones gps (MVP)

Have you ever shown up to a
tournament needing a play set of that one hard to find card? You play tested
with it as a proxy and it totally makes the deck, however, you just have been
unable to find it before now. You ask everyone you can, but no one has any
extra. So you end up having to substitute that second choice card and your deck
just does not play as well. Of course during the first break you run into 6
people that have the cards you needed and was looking to trade, but now it is
too late! 

Wouldn’t it be great if trading
physical cards at an event was as easy as it is online? Online you visit the
marketplace and everyone lists what they want and what have to trade, you run a
search for the card you need, and everyone that has it pops up, you message
them and the trade is made! 
Our project is a mobile website that
does just that. Over your phone or mobile devise you select the cards you have
and the cards you are looking for. Then as others who have listed cards they
have to trade come within your trade radius, or have listed they are at the
same even as you, you can find them just like on MTGO Marketplace. Click trade
on their card and they are notified. SMS each other and meet at the judges
table or convenient safe location and make the trade! 
 
Select what you have to trade and what you need....


                  
Find the Cards you need!
       
    (Above images are site mock-ups)


Members earn “CardFury.com
TRADE TOKENS” for things like winning tournaments, trading cards with us and
especially getting your friends to sign up. These tokens can be traded for MTGO
tickets, CardFury.com
memberships, cards, SWAG and a whole lot more. We are working on a 'Local MTG
Store Membership Program' so you can trade them for in-store credit at your
local member store. 




Once we reach our goal, don't stop there!

Below is what we will do with the money if we exceed
our $5,000 goal and meet these stretch goals:





Team Tournament -> Standard Swiss
(MTG TEAMS) -> You’re the leader with 5 team mates -> Battle other teams
-> Leaders pair up teams and leaders play each other. Each pair plays a 2 out
of 3 match. Team with most game wins - wins the match. 1,000 Card Fury Trade
Tokens Prize Pool.



Estimated
Release Date : Mid 2014
If we reach our $50,000 we will
start to work on our 2nd Generation -> Phone Camera input -> features.
How would you like to fill out your MTG tournament Deck lists by just scanning
your cards with your phone? Have it auto-populate your Deck list, you review it
and then just email it to the head of the tournament for submission?
Main Deck:



 Sideboard:


To Decklist: (Of course we changed
it last minute to different cards - which editing it is SOOO much easier then
by hand in pen!







If we reach our $100,000 Stretch
Goal, we will randomly choose 5 of our contributors for each of the next four
MTG Pro Tour events and send them to the event! Qualifying for the event is up
to you. We will pay your way and you can always compete in the side events! 



We want to thank all those who have taken their time to provide valuable insight on our mobile site and concepts. We cannot name you all but special thanks go out to these gaming shops who helped us refine everything :

Something2Do

story:
Foursies is now available on the App Store.  Visit www.foursiesgame.com for more information, or download directly from here: http://4lwg.com/foursies 

 

 

 

WE JUST UPDATED THE VIDEO ABOVE TO SHOW A WALKTHROUGH OF ACTUAL GAMEPLAY!

FOR THE OLDER RULES VIDEO FEATURING AMAZING PLASTIC PROTOTYPE, CLICK HERE!

About the game

We've come up with a fabulous new twist on a classic game.

Remember Connect Four?  Of course you do.  However, we've made a few changes to take this game into the mobile age and make it into a turn-based game with friends that you can play on your iPhone, iPad or iPod touch.

Play four games at the same time, against the same opponent.

Not just one game - four of the blighters!

Starting positions are generated randomly.

Games throw you straight into the action!  Stop wasting time on no-decision moves.

On each turn, you must play in a different column on each game board!

A whole new strategy is required.  This rule will blow your mind!

The first player to get four-in-a-row twice wins.

Avoid long, drawn-out endgames.

 

Why these new rules?

We've played a few turn-based Connect Four games, and they're super dull.  Depending on how fast your opponent reacts, you can spend hours or days waiting for a game to get to an interesting stage.  Then, all too frequently you spend the last twenty turns responding to forced moves, with no real decision to make.  All you can do is block a line so you don't lose.

By picking a random starting position, we remove the tedium of the opening stages.

By making you play in four different columns, we make sure there's a strategic decision to be made on every turn.

By requiring only two lines to win, games are typically decided in 10-15 turns.

Furthermore, Connect Four has been beaten.  There's a perfect strategy that means a skillful player can force a win or draw, depending on which column play begins in.  These variations remove this possibility.

A brand new strategy is required!

About the project

As well as the sweet setup you saw in the video, we already have a fully working prototype app for iPhone and iPad.  We've playtested it and settled on these rules.

We're close to completing this project.  We just need a final push.

The first batch of graphics has been completed, and they look stunning!  However, there's a second batch needed - extra sparkle and polish we've come up with since the original brief.  We really want to get this into the game, although it wasn't in the game's budget.

We also need to commission new sound effects that suit the style of the game.  We'd underestimated this at first.  To complement the gorgeous artwork, we want some top quality, on-theme sound effects as well as some appropriate background music.

Money contributed will go towards these extra costs to help make sure we don't have to cut any corners in order to launch the game.  Anything beyond this will boost our marketing campaign to help us reach as wide an audience as possible.

What about the perks?

Everyone who contributes will get their name in the credits.  Your name in the next big video game! How cool is that?

We're also giving you the opportunity to put your own designs on the game pieces.  Developers - pledge a little more and we'll put your logo on a piece and include some text about your app and a link to download it.

We'll also give you extra in-game coins.  We don't quite know how the game's economy will work yet but your contribution will get you at least four times as many coins as you'd have got if you'd waited to spend the same amount in the game.

If you just can't wait to play it, pledge a little more and get premium beta access.  No waiting, no arguing with us that yes, absolutely, you'll give us feedback after you play the game.  You'll just get early access along with our qualified beta team.  (Of course, we'd still like your feedback!)

Want to meet the team?  Want to meet our lovely cats?  Look out for special limited quantity perks that we'll be adding soon.  We could be taking you out for dinner, or you could be coming round to try to beat us at Rock Band or show off your Kinect dancing skills.  A fun, if somewhat geeky, time is promised!

What about Android / Windows / other platforms?

Maybe.  Watch this space for exciting stretch goals if we make the first target :)

How else can I help?

If you can't pledge money, you can still help!  Please consider doing one of the following:

- Share this campaign on Facebook, or tweet about it.  There are handy Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page.

- Follow @lightwoodgames on Twitter.

- Like us on Facebook.

- Join our mailing list.

- Download and review the game, once it's done.

Thank you.  We will genuinely appreciate every ounce of support you provide!

story: My name is Marshall Breedlove. I am student at Texas State University and I am involved with the Texas State Baptist Student Ministry, Christ Chapel, and St. Mark's Episcopal Church. I recently applied for a production position at Highland Lakes Camp in Austin where I would be running sound for all of the praise and worship services all summer long. However, God has other plans for me this summer. After discovering that I didn't get the position, it has been revealed to me through prayer and thought that I am being called to go with the BSM on their mission trip to Boston. I would be spending a week or two in Boston doing outreaches and spreading the gospel all around Boston. Due to my lack of employment, it is hard for me to raise the money required to go on this trip so I am asking for donations to help me fund this trip. I need to raise 550 dollars to pay for this trip and if donations exceed that goal, the extra money will be donated to the BSM to help others fund their trip to Boston as well as the students of Texas State applying to Go Now Missions and traveling around the world to spread the gospel to other countries. Any amount will help. Thanks and God bless.

story:
Let's do this!

 

Hi guys, we are a team of game developers with more than 30 years combined experience.

  • We have a GREAT project we're working on for a long time, and we would really apreciate some help from you.

     

  • We want to create a free to play game founded by the players ( NOT to be confused with Freemium games, we are not reaching for your wallet or bombard you with silly commercial banners).

     

  • We want our players to "work hard"and have fun and not feel the pressure to pay for anything!(Yes it is possible)

Real prices will be granted(that's right) to all players who achieve certain goals.

About the game

                                      

            

The game will be about the struggle to survive in the harsh post-apocalyptic world left by our ancestors.


One will constantly hunt for resources & technology,weapons & work force.


"No man is an island" so the more friends you have in the game the stronger your community will get.


Strategy is more important than numbers. Players will engage in REAL TIME Strategy battles(single or multiple players can engage in the same time)


This is a social game but it will feature strong, focused single player campaigns as well as multilayer based quests and missions.(No borring repetitive grinding quests)

Technology can be share between players in a community and leaders can be elected trough vote and bribe :)

You will not be forced to return to the game every 30 minutes to "water a plant" or plant you seeds. It is completely up to the player how much time he/she wants to invest widowt affecting the overall progress.

"Allays with you"  The game will be supported on all platforms : Pc, Mac, Mobile(ios&Android devices) so you can play and stay in touch with your buddies.

 

 

The following chart shows the stretch goals we hope to achieve.

 

 


 

 

 What are the funds for ?

 

The founds are going to be used to develop the game, pay for programers,servers and beer for the graphic artists :)

But in all seriousness this game cannot be finished without your help. We have raised almost 9000$ on our own and estimate we will need another 10.000.

We have worked our butts off for the last year and with a little help we are confident we will Finnish developing the game in the next 6 month.

                                           

 Thank you so much guys and we now leave you with some art from the game:

story:
The Ultimate Retro Old School Computer Fantasy Roleplaying Game in Development For More Than 17 Years Is Now Approaching Completion!!!

-> DOWNLOAD GRIMOIRE DEMO V1.31 "EL GRANDE EDJAMAFACASHINAL EDISHUN" NOW!! NOW WITH LESS FATAL BUGS THAN EVER!

COMPLETION NOT SUBJECT TO FUNDING!! THIS GAME WILL SHIP IN MAY 2013 WITH OR WITHOUT ENHANCEMENT!! A PLEDGE HERE WILL BE FULFILLED. THIS CAMPAIGN IS NOT A FUNDING FOR COMPLETION, IT IS A FUNDING FOR ENHANCEMENT!!! COMPLETION IS GUARANTEED HERE! SEE VIDEO FOR DETAILS.

Review Of Grimoire Gameplay On YouTube

Update #1 : Sooper Seekret Teknologee Review

Having self-funded the entire development of the game over the past 17 years out of our own pockets we are now turning to crowdfunding to put the final polish on the game before delivering it to fans worldwide who have been waiting on the game for more than a decade. A pledge to the game will secure you a one-of-a-kind collector's edition of the resulting masterpiece and a guarantee that the completed product will be artistically perfect. Only pledges will get DRM-free copies of Grimoire once it is completed.

Grimoire is a turn-based, 3D, first person perspective roleplaying adventure in 1024x768 256 Color graphics. The 3D step-based engine is pixel perfect and smooth scrolling with zero distortion handcrafted images.

The style of play is very similar to that of CRPGS during the golden age of computer roleplaying before 1992 like Eye of the Beholder, Bane of the Cosmic Forge, Crusaders of the Dark Savant, Might & Magic, The Bard's Tale, Stonekeep and other classic games.

The emphasis in the game is on the story, exploration, discovery, character advancement, puzzle solving, strategic phased combat, treasure hunting, inventory management and interaction with the non-player characters encountered during play.

Noteworthy Features:

  • 600 hours of play possible in a single game
  • 244+ Maps in the game to explore!
  • Turn-Based strategic combat
  • 144 context sensitive magic spells
  • 14 races, 15 professions, 50 skills
  • 64 intelligent NPCs with 8000+ Words in Vocabulary
  • Full Sentence Communication with NPCs
  • 240+ monsters each with special powers and defenses
  • 1000+ items, Carry Containers, Global Party Inventory
  • 30 conditions, from Confusion to Disease & Lycanthropy
  • Automapping, Autowalking, Autohealing
  • Global Map Atlas With Position Marker
  • Quest Journal, Hint Prompting, Help Facility, Mini-Quests
  • Complex LockPicking Interfaces for Doors & Chests
  • Challenging Puzzles and Rich Interactive Dungeons
  • Browsable Character Library for up to 100 characters
  • Up to 12 Commented Postage Stamped Savegames
  • Multi-themed GUI and customizable screen layouts

Enhancements Planned During Next Six Months :

  1. Increase screen resolution to 1024x768 and viewport size to 720x600 (*Done!*)
  2. All new title screen with animated logo
  3. New animated intro, cutscenes and in-game animation sequences
  4. Integration of additional monster and magic spell animations
  5. Improvements to animation engine and transitions
  6. Detailed improvements to user interface and icon presentation

Achievement of Funding Goals :

  1. New music score & sound effects
  2. Additional animation sequences to enhance all aspects of gameplay
  3. Possible ports to IOS, Linux, IPad and Android platforms
  4. Work begins immediately on sequel after release

The Story

The game is set in a world called Hyperborea, which in the early part of its history endured a savage period of unbridled warfare that nearly razed the continent.

There is a reason this state of war existed, a prime mover as it were, a force that promulgated hatred, fear and hostility. We don't find out what it is until much later in the game at the climax, but this force once threatened to destroy all relationships between living creatures in the distant past.

The guardian of the world of Hyperborea, a minor divinity known as the White Owl and also the Winged Exemplar, knew that he had to do something to counteract the unceasing carnage before there was nothing left worth defending. He came up with a solution ... he approached the Goddess of the Moon and asked her to sacrifice the Moon Clock, also called the "Metronome Mysterium," the clock that kept time for the various lunar phases. This clock would juxtapose the balance of chaos and entropy in Hyperborea with a generous measure of order, law and harmony.

After the goddess of the moon showed the White Owl how to wind the clock, he returned to the land below with it and concealed it deep within the earth, far from the eyes of mortals. Almost as soon as the clock began to keep time, the bloody wars of succession began to recede and were replaced by a loose set of peaceful alliances and territorial restrictions amongst the many races that inhabited the land. Even the martial Naga, the snake people, retreated to a distant tower across the waters and initiated no further wars on the mainland.

The White Owl knew that he had not solved the basic problem, merely thwarted it with a sort of cosmic counterweight. He knew that if the Clock of Fate ever wound down, the wars and violence would return. Being a wise old bird but absentminded, he decided to write the secret of the Clock's location on nine stone tablets and then scatter these tablets throughout the land so that no unworthy spirit would ever find them but he could recover them when he needed them again.

The problem that developed is that the Winged Exemplar was even more absentminded than he realized - after a thousand years, he forgot where he put the tablets. Kind of like putting a string on your finger - then forgetting to look at the finger!

When we begin the game, the Clock of Fate is winding down, the harrowing shadow of war hangs over the continent and the many races have cut off contact with one another or begun engaging in skirmishes over territory and resources. There are cutthroats abroad, sinister conspiracies afoot and bizarre religious cults gaining in numbers.

The only hope for Hyperborea of course, is for us to find the nine tablets, discover the secret hiding place of the Metronome Mysterium and wind it once again. The problem is that we are not the only ones seeking the tablets. We are competing with thieves, assassins, spies and well-intentioned busybodies who are also looking for the tablets. If they get the tablets first, we may have to fight everybody and their brother to get them back.

Along the way we'll discover an enormous number of subplots, lessons in Hyperborean history, the underground kingdom of Samhain, demons from another plane of reality, alien bounty hunters, Shelach the Spider Queen and her one-eyed master the Psychopomp, The Ghost City of Gideon, the Soul-Eater Grendel, The Tower of Bahomet and probably have to kill several discount local gods to succeed, as well as a wide array of mythical beasts native to the continent.

 

What was the original design philosophy behind the game?

"CORE PRINCIPLES"

We wrote these down in January 1995 and have referred back to them constantly as the bible in creating the Grimoire universe ...
 
The point of this game is to have fun inside a huge, sprawling fantasy adventure that is so immersive it serves as a completely shameless escape from the real world that lasts a long, long time. It should not try to be an action game, an FPS shooter, a puzzle game or a hidden object game. It should stick to being a turn-based 1st person fantasy roleplaying game. Nothing should be calculated for its appeal, rather the acid test is does it make the game more fun and more interesting. Everything else must go.
 
The game must never look like it was under adult supervision at any point. The world of Grimoire will contain many incongruous elements from different aspects of sci-fi, fantasy and even horror. The purpose of this fantasy is to be fantastic in Grimoire. Nothing should be judged worthwhile because of what people say or whether it conforms to any genre. The only requirement is for this world to be true to itself and to the vision of it's author. Whether or not anybody finds it appealing will be determined by the reaction to the game when it is released.

There must never be anything that can be done at any time during gameplay or anything that can occur that can mess up game logic so badly that the game cannot be completed.

Do not construct linear frames of reference that assume the player has proceeded along one narrow path of events before they arrive at a given cell or generate a particular event. Avoid constructing rails that the player has to follow to advance in the game.

Never enforce solutions of any one puzzle in a predefined way. All puzzles and challenges should have at least one alternative way of being solved. The obstacles to further progression that have only one solution should be in the minority.

The scenario must permit almost any avenue of exploration to be chosen at any time. No challenge should frustrate the player to where they feel obliged to give up. It should be easy to return to any area or puzzle whenever the player desires.

Moral or reasonable behaviour should be encouraged according to the same incentives present in real life but no penalties should ever apply for immoral or destructive behaviour. Each and any style of play should be open and unfettered, restricted only by the natural hazards the player creates for themselves.

A large part of the gameplay and scenario is to be reserved purely for discovery and delight. It should be possible to play the game many times without finding some of the very best treasures, encounters and areas.

The items are to be protected by a lock that forbids their sale if they are critical. An optional configuration should notify the player if they attempt to drop a critical item. Likewise, an item once used for it's intended purpose in a critical regard to completion of the game, if it does not vanish, should then become marked as uncritical and be available to sell for profit or discard at will.

Non-Player opposition characters should not gain access to critical areas and items until the player has opened these routes by exploring those venues. This will keep tensions riding high and make advantages either way seem very marginal. Non-Player characters should not behave in any fashion that indicates that they have any more information than the player about locations, items and solutions to puzzles. The Non-Player AI should operate within the same limitations as the players themselves.

Maps must always be designed with spaces in mind, not merely collections of corridors or tunnels interrupted by rooms. This is the first principle of all good architecture. Think of the way the various spaces relate to each other and what common factors make them all part of the same place.


 

If you're wondering why we claim Grimoire is one of the greatest classic style fantasy roleplaying games ever created, look at this comparison with other classic RPGs and decide for yourself if Grimoire really is the largest, richest, most detailed and complex computer roleplaying game ever made.

CRPG Total Hours Of Play Classes Races Spells NPCs Max Party Size Character Library Combat Recruit NPCs into Party Automap Autoheal Autowalk
Grimoire 600+ 15 14 144 65 8 Yes Turn Based Yes (30+) Y,Y,Y
WizardryVII: Crusaders of the Dark Savant 400+ 14 11 96 30+ 6 Yes Turn Based No Y?,N,N
WizardryVI: Bane of the Cosmic Forge 80+ 14 11 96 30+ 6 Yes Turn Based No N,N,N
Arena 100+ 18 8 N/A N/A 1 No Real Time No Y,N,N

story_txt:
The Ultimate Retro Old School Computer Fantasy Roleplaying Game in Development For More Than 17 Years Is Now Approaching Completion!!!

-> DOWNLOAD GRIMOIRE DEMO V1.31 "EL GRANDE EDJAMAFACASHINAL EDISHUN" NOW!! NOW WITH LESS FATAL BUGS THAN EVER!
COMPLETION NOT SUBJECT TO FUNDING!! THIS GAME WILL SHIP IN MAY 2013 WITH OR WITHOUT ENHANCEMENT!! A PLEDGE HERE WILL BE FULFILLED. THIS CAMPAIGN IS NOT A FUNDING FOR COMPLETION, IT IS A FUNDING FOR ENHANCEMENT!!! COMPLETION IS GUARANTEED HERE! SEE VIDEO FOR DETAILS.
Review Of Grimoire Gameplay On YouTube
Update #1 : Sooper Seekret Teknologee Review
Having self-funded the entire development of the game over the past 17 years out of our own pockets we are now turning to crowdfunding to put the final polish on the game before delivering it to fans worldwide who have been waiting on the game for more than a decade. A pledge to the game will secure you a one-of-a-kind collector's edition of the resulting masterpiece and a guarantee that the completed product will be artistically perfect. Only pledges will get DRM-free copies of Grimoire once it is completed.
Grimoire is a turn-based, 3D, first person perspective roleplaying adventure in 1024x768 256 Color graphics. The 3D step-based engine is pixel perfect and smooth scrolling with zero distortion handcrafted images.
The style of play is very similar to that of CRPGS during the golden age of computer roleplaying before 1992 like Eye of the Beholder, Bane of the Cosmic Forge, Crusaders of the Dark Savant, Might & Magic, The Bard's Tale, Stonekeep and other classic games.
The emphasis in the game is on the story, exploration, discovery, character advancement, puzzle solving, strategic phased combat, treasure hunting, inventory management and interaction with the non-player characters encountered during play.
Noteworthy Features:

600 hours of play possible in a single game
244+ Maps in the game to explore!
Turn-Based strategic combat
144 context sensitive magic spells
14 races, 15 professions, 50 skills
64 intelligent NPCs with 8000+ Words in Vocabulary
Full Sentence Communication with NPCs
240+ monsters each with special powers and defenses
1000+ items, Carry Containers, Global Party Inventory
30 conditions, from Confusion to Disease & Lycanthropy
Automapping, Autowalking, Autohealing
Global Map Atlas With Position Marker
Quest Journal, Hint Prompting, Help Facility, Mini-Quests
Complex LockPicking Interfaces for Doors & Chests
Challenging Puzzles and Rich Interactive Dungeons
Browsable Character Library for up to 100 characters
Up to 12 Commented Postage Stamped Savegames
Multi-themed GUI and customizable screen layouts


Enhancements Planned During Next Six Months :

Increase screen resolution to 1024x768 and viewport size to 720x600 (*Done!*)
All new title screen with animated logo
New animated intro, cutscenes and in-game animation sequences
Integration of additional monster and magic spell animations
Improvements to animation engine and transitions
Detailed improvements to user interface and icon presentation

Achievement of Funding Goals :


New music score & sound effects
Additional animation sequences to enhance all aspects of gameplay
Possible ports to IOS, Linux, IPad and Android platforms
Work begins immediately on sequel after release

The Story


The game is set in a world called Hyperborea, which in the early part of its history endured a savage period of unbridled warfare that nearly razed the continent.
There is a reason this state of war existed, a prime mover as it were, a force that promulgated hatred, fear and hostility. We don't find out what it is until much later in the game at the climax, but this force once threatened to destroy all relationships between living creatures in the distant past.
The guardian of the world of Hyperborea, a minor divinity known as the White Owl and also the Winged Exemplar, knew that he had to do something to counteract the unceasing carnage before there was nothing left worth defending. He came up with a solution ... he approached the Goddess of the Moon and asked her to sacrifice the Moon Clock, also called the "Metronome Mysterium," the clock that kept time for the various lunar phases. This clock would juxtapose the balance of chaos and entropy in Hyperborea with a generous measure of order, law and harmony.
After the goddess of the moon showed the White Owl how to wind the clock, he returned to the land below with it and concealed it deep within the earth, far from the eyes of mortals. Almost as soon as the clock began to keep time, the bloody wars of succession began to recede and were replaced by a loose set of peaceful alliances and territorial restrictions amongst the many races that inhabited the land. Even the martial Naga, the snake people, retreated to a distant tower across the waters and initiated no further wars on the mainland.
The White Owl knew that he had not solved the basic problem, merely thwarted it with a sort of cosmic counterweight. He knew that if the Clock of Fate ever wound down, the wars and violence would return. Being a wise old bird but absentminded, he decided to write the secret of the Clock's location on nine stone tablets and then scatter these tablets throughout the land so that no unworthy spirit would ever find them but he could recover them when he needed them again.
The problem that developed is that the Winged Exemplar was even more absentminded than he realized - after a thousand years, he forgot where he put the tablets. Kind of like putting a string on your finger - then forgetting to look at the finger!
When we begin the game, the Clock of Fate is winding down, the harrowing shadow of war hangs over the continent and the many races have cut off contact with one another or begun engaging in skirmishes over territory and resources. There are cutthroats abroad, sinister conspiracies afoot and bizarre religious cults gaining in numbers.
The only hope for Hyperborea of course, is for us to find the nine tablets, discover the secret hiding place of the Metronome Mysterium and wind it once again. The problem is that we are not the only ones seeking the tablets. We are competing with thieves, assassins, spies and well-intentioned busybodies who are also looking for the tablets. If they get the tablets first, we may have to fight everybody and their brother to get them back.
Along the way we'll discover an enormous number of subplots, lessons in Hyperborean history, the underground kingdom of Samhain, demons from another plane of reality, alien bounty hunters, Shelach the Spider Queen and her one-eyed master the Psychopomp, The Ghost City of Gideon, the Soul-Eater Grendel, The Tower of Bahomet and probably have to kill several discount local gods to succeed, as well as a wide array of mythical beasts native to the continent.

 

What was the original design philosophy behind the game?

"CORE PRINCIPLES"
We wrote these down in January 1995 and have referred back to them constantly as the bible in creating the Grimoire universe ...
 

The point of this game is to have fun inside a huge, sprawling fantasy adventure that is so immersive it serves as a completely shameless escape from the real world that lasts a long, long time. It should not try to be an action game, an FPS shooter, a puzzle game or a hidden object game. It should stick to being a turn-based 1st person fantasy roleplaying game. Nothing should be calculated for its appeal, rather the acid test is does it make the game more fun and more interesting. Everything else must go.
 
The game must never look like it was under adult supervision at any point. The world of Grimoire will contain many incongruous elements from different aspects of sci-fi, fantasy and even horror. The purpose of this fantasy is to be fantastic in Grimoire. Nothing should be judged worthwhile because of what people say or whether it conforms to any genre. The only requirement is for this world to be true to itself and to the vision of it's author. Whether or not anybody finds it appealing will be determined by the reaction to the game when it is released.

There must never be anything that can be done at any time during gameplay or anything that can occur that can mess up game logic so badly that the game cannot be completed.
Do not construct linear frames of reference that assume the player has proceeded along one narrow path of events before they arrive at a given cell or generate a particular event. Avoid constructing rails that the player has to follow to advance in the game.
Never enforce solutions of any one puzzle in a predefined way. All puzzles and challenges should have at least one alternative way of being solved. The obstacles to further progression that have only one solution should be in the minority.
The scenario must permit almost any avenue of exploration to be chosen at any time. No challenge should frustrate the player to where they feel obliged to give up. It should be easy to return to any area or puzzle whenever the player desires.
Moral or reasonable behaviour should be encouraged according to the same incentives present in real life but no penalties should ever apply for immoral or destructive behaviour. Each and any style of play should be open and unfettered, restricted only by the natural hazards the player creates for themselves.
A large part of the gameplay and scenario is to be reserved purely for discovery and delight. It should be possible to play the game many times without finding some of the very best treasures, encounters and areas.
The items are to be protected by a lock that forbids their sale if they are critical. An optional configuration should notify the player if they attempt to drop a critical item. Likewise, an item once used for it's intended purpose in a critical regard to completion of the game, if it does not vanish, should then become marked as uncritical and be available to sell for profit or discard at will.
Non-Player opposition characters should not gain access to critical areas and items until the player has opened these routes by exploring those venues. This will keep tensions riding high and make advantages either way seem very marginal. Non-Player characters should not behave in any fashion that indicates that they have any more information than the player about locations, items and solutions to puzzles. The Non-Player AI should operate within the same limitations as the players themselves.
Maps must always be designed with spaces in mind, not merely collections of corridors or tunnels interrupted by rooms. This is the first principle of all good architecture. Think of the way the various spaces relate to each other and what common factors make them all part of the same place.


 
If you're wondering why we claim Grimoire is one of the greatest classic style fantasy roleplaying games ever created, look at this comparison with other classic RPGs and decide for yourself if Grimoire really is the largest, richest, most detailed and complex computer roleplaying game ever made.

story:
3d anime fans and lovers of post-apocalyptic games.

What I want from the modern game, and I can not find:

deep atmosphere, an expansive world, a good story;

first-class fiction, strong action;

wonderful and very cool character, each of which is personified;
walking robots and military equipment;

 

great graphics, a charming picture, beautiful palette;
cheerful and unusual soundtrack;
In this game postapokalipsis will be 10 times more beautiful than the ones you've seen.
This game takes the best of The Witcher 3, Fallout 1-2, XCom, and become a pioneer in the post-apocalyptic world of RPG games with elements of dystopia.
1. RPG - spiritual self-improvement, meditation. Want the prerogative of the spirit, to know the function of the soul, dare debt of personality, silence - the karma of the body. No limit to perfection.
2. World - not small and low, but endless and detailed, on the basis of the Rubik's Cube and non-random chance. As long as you do one job, the other will certainly fail.
The goal - to know ourselves and the unity of the world (intuitively), and spend it on their own experience, or - to play indefinitely, enjoying the process.
On the collected money, I make the game - which was the dream for 15 years.
The principle of the Rubik's Cube - as long as you choose one side, the other understands. It can collect forever if you do not tell intuition unity process.


Bleeding spirit is vital that the physical parameters of the hero were enough to know how to go on.
And So:

Deep atmosphere, an expansive world, a good story.


first-class fiction, strong action.

story:
^^^we highly recommend watching the trailer full-screen at 1080p resolution!^^^

Our Story

Hi!

Space Bullet was founded by developers who have worked at large game studios and decided it was time to strike out on their own and bring the world truly unique game experiences. We've been working on Signal Ops full time for over a year, but Signal Ops has been a dream of ours for longer than that! Check out our team profiles if you are interested in learning more about the people behind the game.


Signal Ops draws inspiration from classic games such as Commandos, Syndicate, and Deus Ex. We like to call it a multi-perspective shooter. While playing you are able to simultaneously see what your entire squad of agents see. You work for a secretive government agency and lead your field agents from the relative safety of the control room on various espionage missions. Stealing secrets, sabotage, assassination, and all that sort of thing!



This is no corridor shooter. The levels are open and you are free to tackle the objectives in the manner you see fit. The basics of Signal Ops gameplay are:

  • coordinate your agents
  • manage the radios to keep in contact with them
  • try not to cause too much of a ruckus or else things will get very difficult
  • complete your objectives that can be tackled in various ways
  • shoot your way out of tight jams when necessary



Did we mention that you can play with a friend? Signal Ops supports both local and online cooperative play through the full campaign.

Signal Ops will be available for Windows, Mac, and Linux.

You can find high res 1080p screenshots on our website.


The Impact

By supporting Signal Ops, you will not only be helping a great new game reach the level of quality it deserves, but you will also be supporting our ability to continue making great games while remaining independent in future. Are you a gamer who laments the fact that no one makes the type of PC games you used to love? Help us fill that void!


What We Need

Let us break it down for you. Signal Ops has more than a year of work put into it already, and we are deadly determined to finish it. This game will happen funding or not, but without your support we can't afford to put in the extra polish it deserves and make it a truly awesome product.

The funds we raise will be put towards hiring extra help:

  • level artist to ensure all levels are crafted with love
  • vocal talent to bring the characters to life
  • musician to create a unique dynamic layered soundtrack that reacts to the game

This will enable us to finish a quality product while having a few pennies left to eat some potatoes and milk*.

Any extra funds raised will be used to develop engaging competitive multi-player modes.


What You Get

We have some wonderful prizes lined up for you folks! Step into our office.

If you donate at least $5 you will have your name immortalized in the credits of the game and have access to a high resolution wallpaper.

At the $10 level, we'll give you all that and a beautiful downloadable digital art book full of concept art from the game.

You thirst for more? For $30 you will get the above rewards and a copy of the game when it is released.


(all of the levels after $30 include all of the $5, $10, and $30 level rewards)


At $50 there are two choices available:

- An extra copy of the game so you and a friend can play together. How sweet.

OR

- Access to the Signal Ops closed beta before the final game is released and also early access to mod tools.


If you give $100 you will get a printed copy of the art book. This will look great with your other books. Actually you might want to brush some of the other books aside. We will be making a limited run based on the number of donations. This is a mock-up of what it may look like:


At $250, you will receive a 6-inch figure of a character from the game. The images below are mock-ups, but rest assured the real thing will be quite awesome. You will be able to pick between the following agents:


At the $500 level there is an exclusive two-agent figure:


$1000 gets your likeness into the game! You can tell your friends how awesome you are because YOU are in a game and THEY are figments of your imagination!

If you pony up $5000, we will actually create a mission for inclusion in the game based on your design. You will even be credited in the game for your mission design! There is only ONE of these rewards available so if you are on the fence about doing it or not, better be safe and fall on our soft lawn instead of the hard, hard sidewalk.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot support us financially, please help spread the word! Tell your friends who might be interested in Signal Ops. Go out in the streets** and tell the world!




*some developers may not enjoy milk, in this case just potatoes

**be safe, please obey local laws and traffic signals

SC:TAI  Early Alpha footage in the video above.

So – it’s like this: We’re a small group of friends/gamers that work for prominent (Fortune 500) IT companies as their codemonkeys. But we have a dream of breaking free of our grey corporate cages – bananas be damned!

It started with weekly tabletop role playing gaming sessions, complete with our 20-siders and plenty of Cheetos and Mountain Dew. We had an idea of creating our own science fiction RPG – and then, we grew up. Over the years, the world of Second Coming was fleshed out with a full "history" and the list of universal rules. Once the basic rules and story line were in place – the weekly gaming sessions started back up. It was like old times, except with the addition of babies in playpens, and toddlers running amok amongst the rolls of dice and bouts of laughter.

Well now we’ve grown up a little bit more. And Second Coming has evolved from a list of rules and damage formulas to a fully realized and published RPG book.  And with your help, we can bring the game that brought us months-long tabletop campaigns to a new reality as a video game for the masses.



Snapped before proving that yes - damage occurs when you crash into ships.

What is Second Coming – The Annakazi Invasion?

The Annakazi Invasion is the first PC game release based on the capital ship and fleet battles that take place in the Second Coming RPG universe timeline. The game will have both online and offline capabilities. A single-player mode will provide a rich storyline that thrusts you into the action of the Annakazi Invasion, battling for the survival of humanity.  The multi-player pits you against your friends in the “historic” capital ship battles of the Annakazi Invasion timeline. Multi-player mode is as versatile as your team mates. Play as a team to locate, strategically subdue, infiltrate and capture the enemy ship’s command bridge – or utilize the “bury ‘em in bodies” tactic to war and try to annihilate the enemy.


The Player's Role (Single Player)
 The player will go through a minimum of 3 campaigns, each with multiple levels/maps. Each campaign, the player will play at least 1 'historical' figure's life, and in most cases, death, during the Annakazi Invasion. The campaigns are comprised of at least 2 battles as well as a connecting story arc.

Multiplayer
 In multiplayer mode, you will have many, if not all, of the maps in the Single Player version. You will also be able to select which Capital Ships to pit against each other.

The Maps
 Each map has several stellar bodies to help or hinder your team's progress. For example, shields and radar on fighters will be reduced/inactive in a dust cloud. Asteroids will help hide your ships from detection.

 Some maps are going to give Humans Areas of Protection. Titan ships are too massive for the scale we are using, so as a balance to the Annakazi, some maps will include one of the Titan ships in the Human fleet. These will give the fleet extra cover and a slight reload of its complement. If the Annakazi can occupy this area unchallenged by humans, the Titan ship will withdraw.

The Gameplay
 In the Single Player mode, you will play through 'Historic' battles in the Annakazi Invasion. It is in first person point of view,and the action is FPS. You will play different characters throughout the game so your role will vary as you progress.  You will be able to go through the interior of the capital ship, get into a gunner bay, or hop into a fighter and fight the enemy. Some missions will have you as a marine boarding the alien ship, while others will have you shooting down fighters and incoming missiles from a gunner bay on the side of a cruiser.

 

 In the Multiplayer, you will have classes based off of the characters in the single player mode. Each capital ship will have a complement of crew, marines and ships to send into battle. You will fight, die and respawn as long as your ship's complement holds up. If you burn through all of your fighters, you have to fall back to the Cruiser.

The initial feel of the Multiplayer mode will kind of be like hide and seek. Each ships' radar range is relatively small in comparison to the map. But your Team's cruiser links to all radars of its smaller ships. So you send your smaller ships out to find the enemy, and this expands the team's radar range. You will inevitably run into either the enemy cruiser, or a fleet of fighters from the opposing team. The round ends when one team either destroys the other team's cruiser, or they board and capture it.

Ship damage
 If a cruiser takes too much damage, several things start to happen. Systems in the ship can start malfunctioning or can be completely destroyed. Amongst these, engines, gunner bays, shields, artificial gravity, and O2 supply can be knocked offline. If damage occurs near an external wall of the ship, it can cause a hull breach. This will suck anyone in the general vicinity of the breach out in open space. And then back into respawn.

The Mechanics
 The game is being built on the Unity Engine v4. We need to obtain the licensing for Unity Pro and the Mecanim animation suite. We are looking to license the Unity outright for the Team license, as well as the Mecanim. The contingency plan is to go to Month to Month on Mecanim if necessary, because it is either buy a license for a year or pay 20% more to break it down to month-to-month payment, with a minimum of 12 months. The Unity License on the other hand, is an outright purchase, or a month to month, with a 1 year contract. So it would make the most sense to buy it.

Why do we need your support?

Currently, we are 2 full time codemonkeys and a graphic artist working separately for our respective employers. We’ve been developing SC:TAI in our free time for the last 11 months, not counting the countless tweaks to the book. We need your support to help us bring our dream, and our individual sections of the game, into a whole and finished product ready for release.

Building the universe and assets on the Unity engine has quickened the pace of development and allowed all of us to work on the collective from separate networks until now. It also allows for release on multiple platforms later on, without changing the feel of the game or its mechanics too much.  While we are not at a full Alpha release as of yet – the majority of the functionality and assets are already developed. It’s the backend that we need to focus on to integrate these assets. That means taking the leap into full time game development – and spending the next six months building, living, and breathing Second Coming: The Annakazi Invasion. We can’t possibly do this without the help and support of our families, our friends – and IndieGoGo.

We chose to use IndieGoGo over other crowd funding website for its flexible funding. With full funding, the game will include 3 alien races, 3 single player campaigns, 3 multiplayer campaigns, and 8 different ships from 3 classes.  Stretch goals would be 2 additional prequel campaigns, additional maps and weapons – up to a full expansion pack of the Earth occupation that includes ground assault vehicles and mechs.



Where does the money go?

Our budget isn’t grandiose – we’ve dug deep into our own pockets, and have sacrificed sleep and weekends to get SC:TAI this far. We wouldn't go this "balls-to-the-wall" unless we were honing in to the end zone. Your contributions will be used for:

IndieGoGo – Payment Processing Fees
Soundtrack – Professional composition and production
Third Party Software Licensing – This includes licensing for the Unity engine, Unity Pro, and Animation software licensing. (This is a major goal.)
Servers & Hosting – Needed for builds, testing, website. Stretch goal would be official dedicated servers to host the SC:TAI multiplayer.
Hardware/Software – Including a second dev. PC, NAS, and software to help speed production.
Perk Fulfillment – Printing and shipping of physical goods.
Rental Office – One six month lease allows us to work as a dedicated team and to focus on real time communication and troubleshooting during development.
Programmer Support – Subsistence for 3 full time developers for 6 months to cover rent, food, and keeping the lights and internet on. And coffee. Lots and lots of coffee.

 During our buildout, we will be releasing Mini Games based off the scenery/functionality to help fund us a long the way. ALL Contributors will receive the first Minigame as a Thank you for Contributing. The first Minigame is a multiplayer FPS of the interior of a capital ship. It is called 'Second Coming-Tactical Training' and will have Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, and (hopefully) Capture the Flag.


What does your contribution get you?

Look at all those words up there. What you really want to check out, are some of the perks you can claim by contributing to our campaign. Right?

Rewards waiting to be claimed:

Copies of the Game, Digital Concept Art package, Signed Art Prints, or this spiffy swag shirt:



Voice Actor Package – Lets you have your voice be heard – in the game of course. Be given a voice over line, and be given Voice Actor billing in the end credits. (Hello, IMDB listing!)

Hero Packages – Human, Cilonian, and Annakazi level packages give you multiple copies of the game to get your friends playing, too. Plus a PDF copy of Second Coming, the RPG book.

Virtual Immortality – Be a part of the Second Coming Universe! Have a Captain (named after you) created in your image, with your own voice over lines, and billed in the end credits as Captain “YourName”, and credited as a Voice Actor.

What if our goal isn't reached?

We cry. Then we pare down to the basics. We cut down on the music score.  Can we all cram into one of our garages for the summer? Sure. Will it be as effective as an office building with adequate lines and internet hook ups? Probably not - but we have a goal: This game is going to be made no matter what. Not enough funding is distressing - but it can not be the end of the world. Instead - we will focus on polishing smaller campaigns with less levels/maps and fewer weapons/ships to build.


Are there other ways to help?
Spread the word! Help us reach our goal by getting others involved. Tell your friends, your family, that weird neighbor you only see when they grab their mail.

Help us get greenlit on Steam Greenlight. Like us on Facebook. Follow us on Twitter.

story:
IndieGoGo does not allow modification to your pledge and charges you upon pledging. Refunds are only given on projects which do not fund; there is no "oh I changed my mind" mechanism on this site and the campaign organizers (LotFP in this case) have no control or access to such things. "Overflow" from one project cannot be transferred to another. Consider your choice to contribute carefully and be sure you mean it before you hit that payment button.

July 23 Update: $30+ contributions get a 16 page sandbox setting by Rob S Conley (Majestic Wilderlands, Points of Light 1 & 2, etc.) in print + pdf as an added Extra. Not to be released in any form outside these campaigns. $50 and $75 perks include shirts, posters, and/or GWAR tickets. Grab Bag contributions get to choose their adventures (up to 6). $160+ get an exclusive 64 page James Edward Raggi IV LotFP adventure. Not offered in this form outside these campaigns.  See the Updates tab for full details.

Lamentations of the Flame Princess presents Towers Two by Dave Brockie

For centuries the province of Gar has been governed by the famously wealthy Family Hune. The mighty “Towers Two” have stood as a symbol of stability and prosperity over a world increasing slipping into chaos. But ever since the difficult birth of the identical twin brothers Rondrel and Zal, a shadow has fallen over the family and the land they had ruled for centuries. The brothers quarreled over the power they had inherited from their father, squandering their wealth, and sending the line into decay. The nearby village of Ham, once happy to call Towers Two and the Family Hune their protectors now live in fear of the fortress and it inhabitantsâ€•a fear born from the outrageous rumors that surround this ancient family and provide ample gossip for the taverns. But how much truth is there to the tales of strange lights that can be seen over the castle, people disappearing from their homes, and bizarre creatures haunting the fringes of the settlements? Just what the hell is happening up there? A group of local merchants wants to know, and are willing to pay to get the answers…

About the Author
Towers Two is the first professional RPG credit from Dave Brockie, the man better known to the world as Oderus Urungus, lead singer of the legendary shock-metal band GWAR. In addition to playing GWAR’s pig-nosed singer for over 25 years, Brockie is an avid artist and writer whose first novel, the blood-soaked Whargoul, can be found here...

About LotFP
LotFP is the publisher of Weird Fantasy Role-Playing, a horror-fantasy tabletop RPG. It is a second-generation retro-clone, which means that adventures compatible with LotFP are also compatible with over a dozen different games. A free no-art PDF version of the LotFP rulebook is available here. For more info hit the LotFP home page or LotFP blog.

This is one of a number of concurrent campaigns underway to get adventures by top talent published for LotFP. The full list:

Escaping Leviathan by Aeron Alfrey
The Seclusium of Orphone by Vincent Baker and Cynthia Sheppard FUNDED
Strange and Sinister Shores by Johnathan Bingham
Towers Two by Dave Brockie
The Unbegotten Citadel by Monte Cook and Eric Lofgren
The House of Bone and Amber by Kevin Crawford and Earl Geier
Of Unknown Provenance by Michael Curtis and Amos Orion Sterns
Machinations of the Space Princess by James Desborough and Satine Phoenix
Horror Among Thieves by Kelvin Green FUNDED
We Who Are Lost by Anna Kreider
The Land that Exuded Evil by Cynthia Celeste Miller and Rowena Aitken
Pyre by Richard Pett and Michael Syrigos
I Hate Myself For What I Must Do by Mike Pohjola and Joel Sammallahti
Broodmother Sky Fortress by Jeff Rients and Stuart Robertson FUNDED
Normal for Norfolk by Juhani Seppälä and Rich Longmore
Poor Blighters by Jeff & Joel Sparks and Mark Allen
The Depths of Paranoia by Jennifer Steen and Jason Rainville
Red in Beak and Claw by Jukka Särkijärvi and Jason Rainville
The Dreaming Plague by Ville Vuorela and Juha Makkonen

For more information about this series of campaigns, to discuss contribution strategies, ask questions, or to simply comment about this madness, go to the message board for this campaign series here.

About the Campaigns

The "Extras" aka "What I Would Do With This" sheets are each a single A5 sheet written by James Edward Raggi IV advising how he would change an adventure to give it a different sort of twist or fit into his own campaign.

There are risks for choosing bundle options - if the project you chose the bundle options on does not fund, you'd end up with nothing. If fewer than expected adventures fund, you're paying more than you would have by contributing to each adventure individually. Be aware of how you are contributing and what cost/benefit ratio you're willing to risk.

The perks above the single adventure levels are leaps of faith representing a desire to help get things funded and a hope of a better deal - but this is crowdfunding, we cannot guarantee results.

What is the Pembrooktonshire Gardening Society?

That's the LotFP Fan and Discount club. It costs 10€ to join (+23% VAT for EU orders), and you get a 1€ discount on all print products in the LotFP store forever. Sometimes other benefits too, like saving $50 on an exclusive hardcover set in these campaigns. Details on joining the Society here.

Where Does the Money Go?

Two-thirds of the money goes to the talent working on the project: The writer, artist, graphic designer, editor. The rest goes towards printing and shipping (and IndieGoGo's fees). The exact figure varies depending on how many of which perks are chosen, but LotFP will not begin making money on these projects until they hit $7000. LotFP's profits will (hopefully) come after the adventures are released and you all start raving about how cool the adventures are so the non-hardcore supporters go for them.

Other Notes

July 10 Update:
(see the July 10 entry in the Updates tab for more info on these points)
All funded adventures will include a PDF supplement with conversions to the "OGL 3.PF" rules system.
A new funding level has been added: The 3.PF Faithful, with all these conversion notes and stats included in their own booklet
New perks and information for The Faithful and Collecting Faithful levels:

  • If you go in for The Faithful level or above, and that adventure is the only one that funds, you will receive a 100€ coupon for the LotFP store. If only that and one other funds, you will receive a 50€ coupon.
  • An exclusive 64 page adventure by James Edward Raggi IV. This adventure will never again be printed in this format (only an abridged 32 or 48 page version in the future), only those pledging at the Faithful or Collecting Faithful levels on funded adventures will receive it. There will be no PDF version of this adventure. This adventure does not count against the ones mentioned in the previous bullet point. It will be included in your Collecting Faithful package but will not be a hardcover inside the slipcase.
  • A booklet with all of the "How I Would Fit This Into My Campaign" sheets, with cover art by Zak S (Vornheim, Playing D&D With Porn Stars, etc), will be included with these perks (will not be made as a hardcover for the slipcase).

For the Grab Bags, you may choose which adventures you want.
A new perk: "Retail Support" has been added
Three random Collector-level contributors on funded projects will get to have a character of their choice drawn by Jez Gordon in a situation from a funded adventure of their choice, with this art appearing in the Extras booklet.
(end July 10 Update)

It is our intention to go to press in late November/early December. However, with a potential 19 authors and 18 artists involved, someone is likely to be late so the adventures may not ship out until the new year.

Some of the adventures in these campaigns will be for ages 18+ because of (im)mature content, so be aware of that before contributing to any adventures or multi-adventure perks. If you want to double-check whether any individual adventure will be an 18+ affair, leave a note in the comments and we'll get back to you shortly.

Adventure titles are all subject to change although I'll roast the authors' bits if they turn in something ridiculously different than their supplied description.

All prices include first class shipping from Finland, or a tracked parcel if your stuff comes out to over 1kg.

Each adventure is scheduled to be an A5 sized 32 page book and would retail for 10€-13€ ($13.00-$16.00 depending on exchange rates) not including taxes or shipping. The $20 single copy purchase price is the best approximation of the price including first class shipping worldwide but the real amount may or may not match that. Some adventures, depending on the adventure structures, may be more than 32 pages.

Each funded adventure will have a full print run done for distribution.

The author of a funded adventure will get 10% of all money raised above the $7000 mark, and the artist will get 5% of all money raised above that amount, in addition to their agreed-on fees. Additional profits go into the LotFP war chest.
