story:
We are Diamond Cat Games, indie developer from Russia. Our team have experience in the PR and marketing side of the games industry. We have experience in creating 2D & 3D games for Facebook, iOS & Android apps and online / viral campaigns with a true focus on social interaction. Our team of gathered gifted programmers and all round creative guys, to implement something new in football manager games and put together unique gaming experience.

There are a number of reasons why we need your help!  To begin with, Diamond Cat Games are independent company and we want to remain that way.  As gamers ourselves, we want to deliver the best gaming experience and to do so we have to self-fund the project.  As you will probably know making games is quite expensive and takes quite a long time and to ensure we put the best game out we can we are turning you.

Once we have the funding in place we believe it will take four to six months to complete the project however if we exceed the target we have already pencilled some amazing extras that would include more formats and more features - hopefully we can tell you more if we exceed the target!

Football: Strategy and Tactics takes the best facets out of boardgames, like turn-based strategy, well-balanced gameplay, and blends it with football manager game, where you build and train your team to compete with other players.


We want to make players interact in many different ways. To chat, to play friendly matches, to trade players and, ultimately, participate in tournaments.

"Football: Strategy and Tactics" is comprised of two main elements, first, it is classic football manager, with a few RPG elements, and a turn-based strategic game during the match. The idea is quite similar to good old XCOM games, where you manage your resources in a manager mode and then use it in battle mode.


During the match, you will have the ability to move players around on the hexagon-based field, using turn based strategy mechanics, merged with the actual football rules. 

Each manager will have a collection of tactics that he can use to determine, witch characters he want to move every turn.

Both players plan they turn at the same time, they press "Ready" button, and then their turns are implemented simultaneously. This mechanic makes you not only think two steps ahead, but gives you opportunity to outthink your opponent.

The challenge with our project is simple - to make Unique Football Manager game. This by its very nature carries many risks. We clearly understand what we want to include in the final version of the game, and we know when we want to launch the game. 
We want to use a reasonable amount of time for bug testing, balancing, fine tuning and more bug testing to ensure we are releasing the best game we can.

Yes, we are not well-known game developers, but we do our best to create fun and interesting game. 

Thank you so much for helping us to make Football: Strategy and Tactics. If you are unable to back and pledge then sharing this page with your friends and family would be wonderful too.

story:
We are Training Wheels, a small indie game developing company. We've been working for 6 years on our 3D horror survival game called Harvest Carnivale.

We strongly believe that along the path, many game companies have lost their passion. Harvest Carnivale will pierce in the mind and soul of gamers for a very long time.

 

Because Hell is Different for Everyone...

 

Harvest Carnivale takes us to a weird chain of events. Our main character gets trapped in a roadside carnival that appears to be stuck in time.  By seeing the true face of fear she will be dragged through a constantly changing wonderland.

No one knows what this place is, but the player will surely have to fight his/her own fears to unravel the mystery in this cynical limbo. Dreadful enemies and a mysterious environment awaits you.

Is it a zombie game? No, it is not. Remember, hell is different for everyone.  

 

So we will be doing...

  • A release for PC and shortly after for Mac OS X.

  • A unique and original story.

  • Amazing 3D graphics.

  • Enjoyable and unique gameplay.

  • An unforgettable experience!

  • Updates and add-ons.

  

Why we need your help?

In a changing industry, the only way to survive is to deliver your products on a short deadline. We have the expectation to release our game in December, 2012. But doing so with such a small workgroup is a hard task to endure. Having the extra funds to get our required assets/tools faster will surely speed up the process.

 

Our main reasons why we need your support:

  •  We need to acquire two Unity 3D Pro Licenses + Team License which adds up to $3500 (in order to deliver the best ingame effects and functionalities available).

 

  • We need other licenses as well, for the tools we are using to develop (3D modeling, animation, image manipulation, optimization tools). Play fair! No piracy!

 

  • We still need to get some 3D assets, plugins and sound effects. Also we need another programmer and to pay for the concept art.

 

  • PROMOTION! That is the key to success. We want the world to know and live this new game experience.

  

What happens if we get over-funded? 

  • We will buy licenses to develop for iOS, Android and if possible a Wii License.
  • We also have 6 more projects in the queue, so any extra cash will go directly to our next project.
  • We will be able to hire a service Unity Studios offers, which is to optimize the game (this means: the game will be suitable for older machines, but still look good enough).
  • We are in Costa Rica, and even though we have talent, it is hard to get support here. We want to support indie developers in our country as well.
  • I mentioned promo, right? Well, part of the promo ideas is to create a website using the idea of the ZoomQuilt (click here if you don't know what that is: http://zoomquilt2.madmindworx.com/zoomquilt2.swf).
  • Bonus perks for all who donated!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Go to our Facebook page and Like us.
  • Follow us on Twitter
  • Share our project with the people you know!
  • Like us on IndieGogo - Click on Like Us below the main banner.

 Our email: info@harvestCarnivale.com

And that’s all there is to it. Thank you very much.

Please stay tuned for updates. We will be posting a promo video soon!

Updates and add-ons.


  
Why we need your help?
In a changing industry, the only way to survive is to deliver your products on a short deadline. We have the expectation to release our game in December, 2012. But doing so with such a small workgroup is a hard task to endure. Having the extra funds to get our required assets/tools faster will surely speed up the process.
 
Our main reasons why we need your support:


 We need to acquire two Unity 3D Pro Licenses + Team License which adds up to $3500 (in order to deliver the best ingame effects and functionalities available).


 


We need other licenses as well, for the tools we are using to develop (3D modeling, animation, image manipulation, optimization tools). Play fair! No piracy!


 


We still need to get some 3D assets, plugins and sound effects. Also we need another programmer and to pay for the concept art.


 


PROMOTION! That is the key to success. We want the world to know and live this new game experience.


  

What happens if we get over-funded? 

We will buy licenses to develop for iOS, Android and if possible a Wii License.
We also have 6 more projects in the queue, so any extra cash will go directly to our next project.
We will be able to hire a service Unity Studios offers, which is to optimize the game (this means: the game will be suitable for older machines, but still look good enough).
We are in Costa Rica, and even though we have talent, it is hard to get support here. We want to support indie developers in our country as well.
I mentioned promo, right? Well, part of the promo ideas is to create a website using the idea of the ZoomQuilt (click here if you don't know what that is: http://zoomquilt2.madmindworx.com/zoomquilt2.swf).
Bonus perks for all who donated!

 
Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Go to our Facebook page and Like us.
Follow us on Twitter

Share our project with the people you know!
Like us on IndieGogo - Click on Like Us below the main banner.


 Our email: info@harvestCarnivale.com
And that’s all there is to it. Thank you very much.
Please stay tuned for updates. We will be posting a promo video soon!

story:
Ce projet est traduit en Anglais et en Français
afin d'être accessible pour plus de monde.

This project is translated into English and French
in order to be available to more people.

Dracuna World est fier de vous présenter Gambrinus. Son tout nouveau jeu de société stratégique, drôle et convivial créé par l'auteur Français Nicolas Delrue.

Dracuna World proudly presents Gambrinus. A new strategy, funny and friendly game by French author Nicolas Delrue.

Vous êtes des apprentis, travaillant pour un maître brasseur de renommé : Gambrinus.
Suite à un tragique incident, ce dernier a disparu dans un nuage de mousse alcoolisé...
En ayant raté sa dernière recette de bière (Certains disent qu'il se serait transformé en tonneau !?).

Après avoir tirer-au-flanc et consommé toutes les bières de feu votre patron. Vous vous retrouvez par la force des choses, livrés à vous même à gérer seuls cette brasserie !
Sans réelle expérience, la peur se lit sur vos visages.
Surtout quand vous regardez votre entrepôt qui est maintenant rempli... que de vide !

Vos tâches seront de produire de la bière fraîche, comme le faisait votre mentor, issue de récoltes.
Il va falloir être très habiles, savoir marchander ou ruser...Tous le moyens seront bons pour vous démarquer avec quantité de Pièces d'Or et de Pièces d'Argent !

Un navire arrive à quai ! Chargez-le vite avec vos tonneaux avant qu'un autre apprenti ne le fasse avant vous. Livrez, vendez vos tonneaux, avant qu'il n'y en ai plus un seul.

Empochez une récompense à chaque livraison accomplie et prenez garde à ne pas vous faire dévaliser et devenir pourquoi pas : le nouveau Roi de la Bière !

You are apprentices working for a renowned brewmaster : Gambrinus.
Following a tragic incident, it disappeared in a cloud of alcohol foam ...
Seems to have missed his last beer recipe (Some say he would have turned into barrel?!).

After pull-duck and consumed all the beers of your late boss. You find yourself in the nature of things delivered to you even manage alone the brewery !
No real experience, fear reads on your faces.
Especially when you look at your warehouse that is now filled... with nothing!

Your tasks will be to produce good cold beers, as did your mentor from harvest.
You should be very clever, cunning or haggle... All means are good to stand out with amount of Gold Coins and Silver Coins !

A ship arrives at the dock! Load it quickly with your barrels before another apprentice do it before you. Deliver, sell your barrels before that there was more than one.

Win a prize on each completed delivery and take care to not be rob and why not become : the new King of Beer !

Notre objectif principal est d'amasser 12 000€. Grâce à vos contributions, nous serons capable de vous fournir une version pro de Gambrinus pour début 2014.

Our main goal is to raise € 12,000. With your contributions, we will be able to provide you with a pro version of Gambrinus in early 2014.

Pourquoi un tel financement ? Le coût de production du jeu, les illustrations, le livret de règles, le packaging et les frais d'envois. Tout ceci n'est pas gratuit...
N'étant pas une maison d'édition j'essaye de faire connaitre mon jeu et surtout le partager avec vous. Avec vos contributions ce projet aboutira avec vous !

Why such funding? The cost of production of the game, artwork, rulebook, packaging and postage costs. All this is not free ...
Not being a publishing house I try to know my game and especially to share it with you. With your contributions this project will result with you!

Une fois notre objectif de financement principal atteint, tous les contributeurs qui ont pré-commandé Gambrinus auront la possibilité de recevoir une version imprimable prêt à jouer.
Note: Cette version PDF prête à jouer du jeu n'inclut pas le design final.

Une fois que vous avez fait votre contribution (d'un montant minimum de 5€), vous pouvez si vous le souhaitez, nous envoyer un courriel à gambrinusboardgame@gmail.com et demander vos fichiers.

Once our main funding goal has been reached, all contributors who have pre-ordered Gambrinus will have the option to receive a Print and Play version of the game.
Note : The PnP PDF version of the game does not include the final artwork.

Once you've made your contribution (a minimum of €5), you can email us at gambrinusboardgame@gmail.com and request your files.

Ce que vous trouverez dans la boîte :

- Livret de Règles (en Français et en Anglais)
- 3 Dés 6 faces
- 1 Dé 4 faces
- 1 Dé 6 faces 1-2-3
- 1 Navire
- 12 Ressources "Eau"
- 12 Ressources "Orge"
- 12 Ressources "Bois"
- 15 Tonneaux de Bière
- 1 Sac en Tissu
- 10 Pièces d'Or
- 35 Pièces d'Argent
- Sacs Ziploc

Inside the box you will find:

- Rulebook (in French and English)
- 3 Six-sided Dice
- 1 Four-sided Dice
- 1 Six-sided Dice 1-2-3
- 1 Ship
- 12 "Water" Resources
- 12 "Barley" Resources
- 12 "Wood" Resources
- 15 Barrels of Beer
- 1 Fabric Bag
- 10 Gold Coins
- 35 Silver Coins
- Ziplock Bags

story:
Concept Demo

 recommend requirements

windows 7

DX11 GFX

quad core CPU

4 Gigs MEM

DOWNLOAD < updated Concept Demo.


Hi guys welcome to the new concept demo for Rift Rash.

We change things up a bit. You can now toggle Virtual Reality mode and standard mode in game with the number 9 and 0 keys.

For standard mode you will control the Player on foot with basic fps controls W A S and D keys to move mouse to look.

For the Virtual reality mode the W key will move you forward and along with turning your head to look around you can rotate your player with the A S and D keys.

The motorcycle controls are still the same W is gas S is break and A,D is turn Shift is a nitrous boost

and space is a more aggressive break.


About the Game

Rift Rash is a motorcycle themed driving/racing game with sophisticated driving dynamics and in-depth vehicle upgrading, featuring both Open World exploration and more Traditional Track Races. 


Unique Racing Experience

First and foremost, we’re building a FUN racing game with PERSONALITY. It’s all about the stuff that really matters: varied tracks, cool Bikes, and the defining once-in-the-lifetime moments that can be achieved on two wheels.



Expect epic on the edge wheel to wheel fights over the finish line and beautiful scenery. Featuring both Rift and Standard mode.



We want to add Awesome Motorcycle's

These are some of the models we are planing on putting in to the game and is the first goal of our Indiegogo.

story:
HEY!

Are you sick of pretending to be a profiteer in search of monopoly?
Dispirited with playing as hawks hunting for global domination?
Tired of treating people like pawns in your game?


What if there were a game so astonishing that you had to make a new word for it?
So brain-spankingly unique that every time you played it, it could be a different game?
A game so revolutionary that it could actually be evolutionary?


Guess what? It's memee!

We're a group of players -- often called The Novad(s) -- from the RevPlay radical game collective.  We're trying to bring a new game into the world. It's a social game based on asking revolutionary questions like

- How would you describe the experience of eating chocolate to someone with no taste buds?
- In the 2012 U.S. presidential election, would you rather vote for Nobody...or Everybody?
- If we need more radicals to make revolution, how do you make radical babies?

Occupy Wall Street has taught us that every revolution begins with a question and some people who are ready to play something new. Now we want to spread the memee meme we all found through OWS all around the US! It's going to be a bit like Travels with Charley; instead of bringing a dog, we've got our hypoallergenic game to help us learn about the making of another American revolution.

We'll be documenting the journey and the evolution of this game with a fancy little blog featuring things like imagination maps (exploring the new mental cartography), audio recordings of our memee sessions, which we'll be sharing over the internet, and a "Book o' Wisdom" for preserving all the knowledge that we collect.

By the end, we'll have a biography of memee, from its beginning and its initial evolution, that will also be a story and a portrait of the people we meet. We'll release the book in a number of 10-20 page chapters in both the physical and digital formats.

We believe that play can be a form of art. Play can actually create a new culture. And play may be the future of Civilization. So please help us memee with you. Let's all play together!

You may be asking: "Why you guys? What makes you so special?" Well, here's a little about each one of us (in alphabetical order):


Jez B. (Archives/East)
Jez likes to travel with words! He has been selecting odd and everyday items for inclusion in the Anarchives since before the beginning of Occupy Wall Street. He tries to spend most of his time listening, because he knows that EACH MOMENT and EVERYBODY is in fact a guru!







Alex C. (Arts & Culture/North)
Alex is a 28 yr old physician from Rio de Janeiro that worked with primary care in impoverished regions and disaster relief; he slowly realized that disease ends and begins in society, and that to follow the Hypocratic Oath was to fight for social justice everywhere. He came to NYC in 2009 for a Master's in Public Health, where that insight became founded and matured into a radical political struggle. He decided to leave behind a "safe" life in Medicine to spark supernovas through Occupy and travels with memee. 
Katie F. (Tech Ops/West)
Katie's been involved in OWS since September 24th and has found a home in the Tech Ops working group, although she prefers to remain relatively autonomous. She's an artist who believes good work comes from new ideas and new ideas come from new people. And new ideas change the world! She believes in the potential of all individuals, people included...a "change your mind and you've changed the world" perspective. Can you picture the venn/flow diagram of that sentence? Katie can.





Richie M. (Wellness/South)
The sandy dirt crunches in rhythm
as my body tells my feet to push forward.
This road is lined with advertisements,
but behind those lie the trees of the forest where my people were born.
I keep-on on this soul-road, waiting
for when the opening into the woods will appear.
Up ahead green fingers wave to me...             Suddenly,
peace fills,                                                        the sun licks
& freedom washes over me,                            and I am home--
                                   where fingers emerge from my skin                 to taste just all that is.


Kevin S. (Info/Compass Rose)
Kevin came to Liberty Plaza in September, a few days into the occupation, with the same questions everyone had. Who are these people? What do they want? As he walked past the people holding signs around the perimeter, the questions continued, "How is this different?", "Where are the leaders?". Looking around at the clusters of people sitting in neat circles, communicating patiently with words and hand-signals, he saw what seemed like some answers. It turned out to be more questions!!! "What do I have to say?", "Is there something I could do?". From that point, he spent every day in the park- asking questions, answering other people's questions with more questions (e.g. Stranger: "What are your demands!?" Kevin: "Oooooh!! What are YOUR demands!?"). To Kevin, the most striking thing about Occupy Wall Street was never the answers being given but rather the mystery of the response. The ideas expressed in the park are hardly new or controversial; what WAS new and controversial was the nature by which the park drew people in. By playing a game of questions and challenges-- by seeing a dangling conversational thread as invitation to pull instead of mend, the intellectual straightjackets could be unraveled instead of reinforced. Kevin feels that this is the most important tool the Occupy Movement has created: empowering people not by merely sharing one's own knowledge or opinion, but by offering space and time for reflection, creation, curiosity, and support. Kevin feels this idea is consistent with the revolutionary heritage of Jesus, Ghandi, Kierkegaard, and Gutierrez, and it is in the spirit of those counter-intuitive methods he wants to rediscover America.

EXPENSES:

The $9,000 we are asking for will cover:
- $2224: 60 day ulimited Greyhound bus pass (/4 people = $556 each)
- $200: shipping costs
- $6576: food and extranneous costs (/60 = $109.6 per day ...roughly $27 per person)

We'll be staying with friends and strangers, camping at times, eating on the cheap (we'll have a rotating PB&J stewardship policy), and cutting costs wherever possible. If you have any questions or something you'd like to offer us (like a floor for a night or some snacks) you can email us at travelswithmemee@gmail.com.

IN CONCLUSION:

We can't tell you how excited we are about this project. Hope we see you soon. Thank you for your support!

THANK YOU!

THANK YOU!!!

- with love & solidarity -

Kevin, Richie, Katie, Alex, Jez

story:
Constant C is an addictive 2-D puzzle platformer set in a futuristic space station where time stops and all objects around you became motionless. Your task is to control a robot to navigate through each stage of the game and overcome obstacles using special devices that granted you the ability to restore time and defies gravity!

  • Time Field 
    All objects are static in this world, and the Time Field around rescue robot is the only way to make them move on. Use your smarts to turn obstacles into stepping stones! 

  • Gravity Shifting 
    This advanced skill will not only let you dodge deadly traps, but also perform many spectacular actions! Turbo jump, manipulate inertia and even super cool ninja dive!

  • Gravitational Shift + Control Time Flow = Momentum Manipulation
  • Over 100+ mind-twisting levels
  • Filled with light-hearted dialogues, fascinating storylines with an epic ending
  • 2D skeletal animation with cute character designs
  • Created a unique futuristic, mysterious atmosphere with beautiful lightning
  • Kickass soundtracks
  • Will be playable on multiple platforms, including Windows, Mac and Linux

This 2-D puzzle platformer guarantee you a fresh experience with unique game features. Constant C challenges players to use wits over weaponry, as players will need to utilize the highly experimental devices to solve the hilariously mind-twisting puzzles, which brings the overwhelming feelings of achievements upon completing each levels.

In the year 1905, Albert Einstein published the theory of special relativity, suggesting that nothing can move faster than the speed of light, what if any mortal could break that constant? Stretch beyond that limits? Would human finally find a way to cheat death and wins over immortality? Or is it Chaos that follows the manipulation of time and gravity?

Dive into the world of Constant C, where rules of fundamental physics could no longer apply. In a space station away from Earth, mysterious event has triggered the distortion of time. Journey through the game as a lone robot, who step by step uncovering the truth behind the incident, and to find the purpose of his own creation.

Despite of the seemingly gloomy setting, along the line of catastrophic outer space crisis. The game’s mood is delightful, humorous dialogues were inserted allowing players to enjoy the gameplay while not feeling stress.

We want to create a platformer that emphasize on brilliant puzzles with innovative gameplay, make players feel the sense of achievement after they finished each level. And believe that any good games should have elements of outstanding storylines and characters that illustrate humanity, which is the soul of many classic games. Constant C aimed to represent the same values.

  • We want to convert the game into other platforms which needs funds.
  • We need you to spread the words for us, help us get on Steam.
  • We want to provide gamers more language options.
  • We want to establish our very own Constant C community
  • Stay connected with the indie fans

We see ourselves as part of the indie game community and as indie game developers, but the indie game scene in Taiwan is still in its infancy stage. The game has been pushed to Steam Greenlight and hopes are high for it to become the first Taiwan developed Steam game.

Constant C development was initiated by a new generation of game developers in Taiwan, core members including Light Wang, Han-Yu Wang and Steven Hsu devoted to the project during their years in university and co-founded the Brain Damage studio. Originally the game was designed for the Android platform, which upon its released receive numbers of positive reviews from the local medias and won several important Gaming App awards in Asia. Despite of the success, the team was not satisfied with the results and vows to gain international presence with Constant C. Hence they joined IGS soon after for the purpose of further enhance game qualities and converted the game to the PC platform.

Light Wang : Producer/Director, winner of most major 2011 app contests in Taiwan.

Han Yu Wang : Programmer/Level Design, love to torture people with his crazy levels.

Steven Hsu : Programmer/Level Design, love RPG and puzzle games.

Po I Chang :  Animator/Artist, 2D CG artist of arcade racing game Speed Driver 3.

Shu Ting Wu : Story/Cut Scene, planner of Speed Driver 3 & 4, a retired cheerleader.

Stanley Chen : Programmer, video game industry veteran in Taiwan, Lead programmer of Invincible Knight(PS3).

Tim Lee : Shader Programmer/Render Wizard, his eyes can detect the difference between 119 FPS and 120 FPS, GODLIKE in Super Hexagon.

Peter Lee : Programmer, was a Software Engineer in EA. Participated in EA Sports Active 2.

Yen Chou Chen : Planner/Level Design, planner of Speed Driver series.

Sakura Kuo : Tank, protector of the team.

 

Follow us on twitter and facebook, and don't forget to vote on Steam Greenlight. Thanks for all your supports
story_txt:
Constant C is an addictive 2-D puzzle platformer set in a futuristic space station where time stops and all objects around you became motionless. Your task is to control a robot to navigate through each stage of the game and overcome obstacles using special devices that granted you the ability to restore time and defies gravity!


Time Field All objects are static in this world, and the Time Field around rescue robot is the only way to make them move on. Use your smarts to turn obstacles into stepping stones! 

Gravity Shifting This advanced skill will not only let you dodge deadly traps, but also perform many spectacular actions! Turbo jump, manipulate inertia and even super cool ninja dive!




Gravitational Shift + Control Time Flow = Momentum Manipulation
Over 100+ mind-twisting levels
Filled with light-hearted dialogues, fascinating storylines with an epic ending
2D skeletal animation with cute character designs
Created a unique futuristic, mysterious atmosphere with beautiful lightning
Kickass soundtracks
Will be playable on multiple platforms, including Windows, Mac and Linux

story:
Help us reach $3000 so we can add voices to the game!


** Pay What You Want!

** Support Indie Game Development!

** Be Part Of The Game!

** Full Transparency! (With Alpha Channel set to 255)

** Funny and less funny jokes all together!

** Fully funded within 5 days, development completed within in a week or so, and now entering beta stage! 

** Refer people to contributed $45, and you will also get your name in the game.

** Get any of the perks, which will be available until they are sold out or until the game is released.


Can a great point and click adventure game be made in a week using only Unity store assets? Absolutely!

Herbert's Quest is a small passion project of mine, that takes place in a medieval setting. It's a satire of both crowd funding and RPG's. It contains a lot of black humor and is guaranteed** to make you laugh! 


** Laughter is not guaranteed in countries where unavailable..

As you go around the medieval village, you'll be helping a group of adventurers in their crowd funding effort. You'll go on a quest to help our townsfolk, in a mysterious dungeon, meet plenty of interesting characters, and go on an epic journey to fund your adventures!



How did it all begin?



In December 2014 there was a sale on unity medieval assets, and I wanted to see if it is possible to use only these assets to make an awesome game just with these them, and do it in a very short time.
This is the sale as it appeared on the asset store.

https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/sale


The relevant assets from this sale that are usable in  an adventure game total to  $377.5.

I launched the campaign and bought this character. Soon after, David Melanson contributed $500 and chose the name "Herbert The Hero" for him, and thus Herbert's Quest was born.



Initially, I made a prototype just a few hours:

Click here to play Medieval Madness Asset Adventure Game Prototype #6



Which was based on an even earlier prototype:


I got our main character walking around talking to NPC's  shortly after launching the campaign.


The assets available are really great. This inspired me to have Herbert look for magical items in the dungeon we got:


Using only the assets available I am attempting to write this existing character 3D model into a strong independent female character based on this model. It's a real challenge. She is based on a friend of mine Infy Snow, who is a talented musician.


Herbert will meet Dr. Infy Snow, the alchemist as he goes around the dungeon looking for magical items after his conversation with Astrid, Pollo Diablo, the village's sorceress and a big supporter of crowd funded adventures like Herbert's.


Music, Voices and stretch goals

Omri Lahav who collaborates with me on Bolt Riley also made the beautiful music for this game. 

You can listen to is here:

https://soundcloud.com/omri-lahav/sylvan-path
Because the game turned out so great, it would be amazing if we can get funds to hire voice actors. We estimate it to be a few hundred dollars more, which we hope you can help us with.


Full Trasparency!

I've decided to open up the experience completely so it can be used as an educational tool for the commonity. When you support this game you will also support other game developer who are interested in learning about budgets, time frames, project management and things that aren't usually being shared.

Every dollar earned and spent is listed in the budget. 

You can track our budget and expenses as we spend them live on :

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1X-4Qz4Vbx365AAeKzU-do9hjFwf4Y5SPz2_xXZKtS2c/edit?usp=sharing


And you can track our development at Trello, and see how we progress, live.
Don't know what trello is? Try it here: https://trello.com/soundguy77/recommend
https://trello.com/b/8VFbl1F6/medeival


Awesome, now let's do this! 

Weeeeeeeee!! My head is spinning!

P.S. If this campaign is super successful and makes us rich I'm planning on also buying a luxury yacht:

https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/4419

P.P.S. What about Bolt Riley ? shouldn't you be working on the epic Reggae adventure game you crowd funded?

What about it? I'm still working on it and it's going strong!  I Just took a short break to get some creative juices flowing.

Don't know what trello is? Try it here: https://trello.com/soundguy77/recommend


https://trello.com/b/8VFbl1F6/medeival






Awesome, now let's do this! 

Weeeeeeeee!! My head is spinning!
P.S. If this campaign is super successful and makes us rich I'm planning on also buying a luxury yacht:
https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/4419
P.P.S. What about Bolt Riley ? shouldn't you be working on the epic Reggae adventure game you crowd funded?
What about it? I'm still working on it and it's going strong!  I Just took a short break to get some creative juices flowing.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. I see. Here are some things to do in this section: *reads dot points below, interested*.

  • Introduce yourself and your background. I'm magicdweedoo.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. The campaign is, that I need to raise about $330 AUD so I can buy the Game Maker Studio 2 smart phone export module. I already own the GMS1 Master Collection but there was no discount/upgrade for GMS2 version of smart phone export module, so I have to buy it again. I don't like this, but hey, that's the way the cookie crumbles. THat's life.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve. The magnitude of what you will help achieve, by contributing to this campaign, is so immense, that it isn't possible to put it into words that a mere human is able to comprehend.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ok. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution? *asks myself the above question, but doesn't think very hard about the answer*.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail: Ok.

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you. Ok so it costs $330 AUD. *takes a screenshot of the yoyogames website where you can buy it, to prove what I said, so people are more likely to trust me and want to fund me*.

  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! My unique perks, are that you get the game for free when it's released. This is a one of a kind perk, that has never been done before.
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal. If I don't reach the goal, the funds will still go towards buying the module, but I will make up the rest of the amount by scraping the gutters for rare trinkets (eg, a mangled lightning bolt earring, obsolete flavours of doritos, one of those looney tunes things you used to get with cereal, or whatever, where it's like a little tab thing, and you put it in the oven and when it's ready it has somehow grown into a keychain thing), i will sell the trinkets for the extra money.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make: Ok.

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Well, to be honest, it's not of value in any way. It's an indie game! Lol!
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). I have released 3 games on steam and they're a lot bigger than this one so if I can finish them then I can finish this. Unless it doesn't get funded of course in that case I will just go look for an actual job and possibly become a functioning member of society but probs not.
  • Make it real for people and build trust. This is real. *builds trust*.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Cool. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal. Ok. Well the risk with this project is, that if [WHEN] it gets funded, there is a small chance that a new technology will arise, rendering smartphones obsolete. It'd be like, a brain chip that lets you see a HUD within your eyes, and you just control it all using your brain waves. If that happens, then everyone will have moved their games onto this new platform (it'd be called like, "Myndr", or "Braindoo" or something), and I will be left behind, clutching my GMS2 smart phone module out in the rain, looking at all the indie games celebs partying it up in their mansion, doing lines of P1x3l/D_st (this is what indie games developers call cocaine. it's purple and the granules are actually voxels. if you leave them out for a while those little microscopic red spiders will appear and start pushing them together and build houses, and defend themselves from creepers) off fembots' chrome asses.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Well, I am very slow to adopt new technologies, so i'd be fine with sticking to smartphones should they be replaced with newer tech.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges. I will make another indiegogo campaign asking for money to by the GMS2 Braindoo/Myndr export module. All g.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ah i see.

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Ok will do.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! What share tools?

And that's all there is to it. Cool thanks.

 

oh yeah, here are some link(s):

devlog

 

in the absolutely bizarre and unprecedented case of this camp (that's what i call campaigns) raising more than what the module costs + fees, then it will be used for other things relating to the game. like getting it onto steam.

Describe your plan for solving these challenges. I will make another indiegogo campaign asking for money to by the GMS2 Braindoo/Myndr export module. All g.



Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ah i see.

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Ok will do.

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! What share tools?


And that's all there is to it. Cool thanks. oh yeah, here are some link(s):devlog in the absolutely bizarre and unprecedented case of this camp (that's what i call campaigns) raising more than what the module costs + fees, then it will be used for other things relating to the game. like getting it onto steam.

story:
Website | Discord | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook | YouTube | E-mail | Application

 

VR headset NOT required to use our theater

 

Net VR Theater is a revolutionary application that will change the face of live streaming by allowing interaction in a virtual space. With Net VR Theater, content creators can:

  •  CREATE more engagement/outreach
  •  BUILD a stronger relationship with your community
  •  CUSTOMIZE a theater to showcase your style and brand
  •  MONETIZE with in-app purchases, e.g. branded avatar skins and merchandise

Net VR Theater can be directly streamed through an OBS (Open Broadcaster Software). We also connect to Twitch and YouTube with Facebook in progress; chat functionality is synced with each platform. Our theater can be connected through ReStream which allows streaming to multiple platforms simultaneously.

 

With Net VR Theater, viewers can:

  •  STRENGTHEN relationships within communities with similar interests
  •  HOST your favorite content creator
  •  CUSTOMIZE a theater to fit your style or your favorite content creator's style
  •  UNLOCK exclusive avatar skins and rewards

 

VR headset NOT required to use our theater

 

Help accelerate and launch our application to the forefront of live streaming!

 

Completed phases:

  • Phase 1: Theater development
  • Phase 2: Multi-player functionality
  • Phase 3: Streaming platform integrations

Phases in progress:

  • Phase 4: Marketplace
  • Phase 5: Continue theater enhancements

IndieGoGo phases:

  • Phase 6: Update user interface and avatar mechanics
  • Phase 7: Add avatar customizations and more functionality
  • Phase 8: Add theater customizations and more functionality
  • Phase 9: Performance enhancements

While resources have already been invested in developing a prototype, without IndieGoGo funding, the scale of our project will be greatly reduced. 

As a content creator, you will need to download our application and an OBS.

  •  STREAM directly to a theater or connect our application to Twitch, YouTube or Facebook - additional platforms integrated upon availability 
  •  ADMIN functional access and controls
  •  MODERATE viewers within your theater

Please contact us at info@thenetvr.com if you would like to test streaming to a theater.

 

As a viewer, everything you need is included in one download. A VR headset is NOT required to use our theater.

  •  ACCESS to live theaters
  •  CHAT functionality across major streaming platforms
  •  VOICE functionality within the theater
  •  CUSTOMIZE your avatar
  •  EMOTES for your avatar
  •  SHOP within the marketplace - currently in development 

 

Watch a Live Demo

User: Kourtnie

 
 We're continually developing our application with content creators and viewers in mind by implementing all of the industry's best practices for live streaming. Our current focus is the gaming industry. As gamers ourselves, we're continuously 'playing' to our strengths and knowledge of the industry as we grow.
 

 

Net VR Theater is currently in alpha testing but is available free for download with in-app purchases coming soon. We're PC and VR head mount display compatible with mobile and console available in the future!

 

 

Development for more functionality and customizations are in the works but you can download our application and start streaming your content, create your avatar and connect with viewers!

 

Thank you BACKERS for all of your SUPPORT! Our goal is to complete phases 4-9 by the end of June 2021 however we would be able to accelerate our timeline with your help! If you are interested in becoming an alpha-tester, please contact us at info@thenetvr.com.

 

Website | Discord | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook | YouTube | E-mail | Application

 VOICE functionality within the theater
 CUSTOMIZE your avatar
 EMOTES for your avatar
 SHOP within the marketplace - currently in development 

 
Watch a Live Demo
User: Kourtnie



 
 We're continually developing our application with content creators and viewers in mind by implementing all of the industry's best practices for live streaming. Our current focus is the gaming industry. As gamers ourselves, we're continuously 'playing' to our strengths and knowledge of the industry as we grow.
 

 
Net VR Theater is currently in alpha testing but is available free for download with in-app purchases coming soon. We're PC and VR head mount display compatible with mobile and console available in the future!
 



 
Development for more functionality and customizations are in the works but you can download our application and start streaming your content, create your avatar and connect with viewers!
 
Thank you BACKERS for all of your SUPPORT! Our goal is to complete phases 4-9 by the end of June 2021 however we would be able to accelerate our timeline with your help! If you are interested in becoming an alpha-tester, please contact us at info@thenetvr.com.
 
Website | Discord | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook | YouTube | E-mail | Application

story:
12 is Better than 6 – is a dynamic, hardcore Top-Down Shooter with stealth elements, made in a western theme. The action takes place in 1873 – the noon of lawless and cruelty all over the North America. The main hero of the game is Mexican escaped convict who is being chased by thugs.


  • It’s a truly challenging game – your abilities and reactions will be pushed to the limit. Bullets are deadly, your enemies don’t think twice before firing, and they rarely miss.
  • It’s has a beautiful, unique art style – the game is drawn by hand on pen and paper to create a unique atmosphere.
  • Choose your own play style – you don't have to go in guns blazing. Take the stealthy approach to surprise your enemies, or just sneak straight past them. You can complete almost the entire game without being noticed.
  • An enthralling 6-hour long story follows the trials of an escaped Mexican prisoner fighting for survival and freedom in 1870's America. Above all, it’s a story about people, their lives, and how those people tried to forge their own meaning in a violent yet hopeful New World.
  • Move freely around the map. You can travel the land protecting the common people, or move from town to town robbing banks.
  • Authentic weapons and environments will immerse you in the world and the story. Real weapons, real places and even authentic Mexican curses, amigo!
  • A lot of work has already been done to create a unique art style and a fully functioning engine. The demo-version is complete and includes 30-40 minutes of gameplay, however there is still a long path of content and environment creation still to go.



               

                                            


What do we need funds for?

Ink Stains Games - is a young team.

We started development in a February of 2014. By now we've already produced full demo-version, which you can download at our website.

Big job is in front of us, making content, coding and we don't know exactly how many time do we need.

But we want to speed up the development of product and publish the game in 2015. To speed up this process we need to raise funds for the office (for now we’re working in a sitting room), game engine, license and updating of our computers.

story:
Bandura Games has been written about in the following publications:


"Justin Hefter wants to change the world through games. He hopes to create lasting peace one relationship at a time, mainly by getting people from different cultures to play games with each other" - VentureBeat

"Bandura Games is a small studio with big ambitions." - GameIndustry.Biz

"That desire to make the world a better place obviously plays a big part in taking a role at a company like Bandura Games, and [Randy] Angle is enthused by the difference he can make in his new role." - PocketGamer

"RunZoo might turn out to be more than just a game." - CNET

"We’re not talking small potatoes here" - Tech.co

"With smartphones now just as powerful as many video game consoles, it's no wonder there are more games and more players out there than ever before. In fact, ABC7 News found out, it's a pastime that's become so universal some think it could even bring about world peace." - ABC7 News

"There are places in the world where hatred hangs in the air, like floating motes. It is breathed in and it is breathed out. It is borne aloft by suspicion and distrust of the other... Justin Hefter has been working to establish empathy between people since his days as a student at Stanford, where he organized a social group designed to increase understanding between Muslim and Jewish students." - Polygon

"For conflicts where “othering” and alienation is the norm, an experience that establishes a fellow player as a human being and potential partner could lay the foundation for further peacebuilding action." - PeaceTech Lab




Our mission is to use cooperative games as a way to create connections, empathy and friendships for people around the world. 

Bandura Games was founded by an American, Israeli and Palestinian team. We’ve since grown to over 10 people. We are 40% women. We are Jewish, Muslim and Christian. We are black, white and brown. We are gay and straight. We are the change we want to see in the world.

Fun should have no borders, so join us in our campaign to have #FunWithoutBorders!


People in Different Countries Around The World Can Play RunZoo Together

Most social networks and games allow people to play and connect with people they already know. Our games connect people with players from around the world. 


For every $5 that you donate, we can reach 1 more person and create 1 new connection through our game!

The more that we raise, the more friendships we can help create for people around the world!

By pairing people who would never otherwise interact, we are allowing our players to create diverse friend networks.

Because our games are cooperative, meaning that players play on the same team, they start to develop trust with one another. Players quickly learn that they are able to cooperate and develop relationships with people from countries and cultures that they have never experienced before.

In our game RunZoo, you play an animal who is escaping the zoo, and running to a tropical paradise where the animal kingdom lives in peace and harmony. In order to make it without being caught, you need to partner with your other animal friends (real players from around the world). You and your partner have to work together in order to be more successful and you are encouraged to share resources, complete joint missions, and save each other's lives.

Only after you successfully partner with someone do you then get to learn who they are, where they are playing from, and what you both have in common. You have the opportunity to add that person as a friend in our game and receive +100 extra coins for doing so!RunZoo let's players learn about what they have in common with one another so they are more likely to want to play together again and develop friendships. 

Players work together and save each other's lives in the game. 

The cooperative nature of our game increases the likelihood that players will develop the trust that can form the basis of a friendship. 

New Character Accessories

Also check out the Image Gallery for more Critter concept art



   

Justin is our American CEO/co-founder and fearless leader. He's a Stanford graduate with experience in business/conflict-resolution and it's his life mission to bring people together! He traveled to Israel to see how he could use games to bring Israeli and Palestinian kids together, met Etay and Ammoun, and discovered that games could connect the Whole World.

Etay is our Israeli co-founder of Bandura Games and is a  hardcore gamer. He met some of his best friends playing online games, and believes that games have the power to create global friendships. He even brought his good friend Ammoun onto the team, who he met on a peace program in Germany.

Ammoun is our Palestinian co-founder of Bandura Games and loves working with kids. Her secret talent is getting rowdy classrooms to respect her enough so that she can teach them valuable lessons. She believes games have the power to teach important lessons to kids around the world.

Randy is the Chief Creative Officer at Bandura Games. He's been making games for 35-years and once wrote a college paper about how video games changed his life. While he almost joined NASA, through games he's been able to experience more interesting planets than the moon, and believes that through games we can make real life on planet Earth better as well.

Elizabeth is our PR guru and emissary to the rest of the world. She has several decades of video game marketing and branding experience and has seen the power of games to improve people's lives. She helped promote the Lion King video game to great success and is a big cat lover!

Veronica is our social media expert and community manager. If you've seen our Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram, Facebook or LinkedIn, they look amazing because of her! She's got a great wit, and charm and is speaking at TEDx UF in 2016! Send us a comment on social media and it's likely she's the one who will respond.

Aubrey is our head artist and a renowned animal lover. Her love of animals shines through in her artwork, which is featured heavily on our Indiegogo page and will soon be in our game thanks to your contributions! She lives with 6 animal companions: 2 dogs, 3 cats, and an African Grey Parrot.

Eric is our video game engineer working on programming the new features we need to make RunZoo awesome. He's a former student of Randy's and it's a dream to have him as part of our team. He's a SCUBA diver and friend of many fish.

Binex Solutions is our excellent technology partners in Pakistan, extending our global reach. They collectively have over 30 years of experience creating video games and have published over 200 mobile games and apps on all major platforms such as iOS, Android and Kindle. 


Our Team's Video Game Experience: Our team collectively has over 100 years of game design, programming, production and marketing experience. Randy Angle, our Chief Creative Officer alone has worked on over 100 games and toys that have earned over $500M and have been played by 250 million people. Our team has worked on many global successes.

Major Titles include:

Star Trek: Next Generation, Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, Pac-Man (mobile), Ms. Pac-Man (mobile), Deal or No Deal (mobile), 1 vs. 100 (mobile), Dig Dug (mobile), Galaga (mobile),Command and Conquer, The Lion King, Army Men, The Sims, FunChat; F.A.S.T (mobile)

to name a few…






Our Filmmaking and Editing Partners, Lychee Visual Creations and 5PM Agency!

story:
http://www.gamehandout.com is a gaming forum where we giveaway games to the active community. We're in the process of trying to update the site, and add more rich features that will improve our goal. Our goal is to turn GameHandout from just a forum with giveaways to a fully functional community. We're trying to get a homepage with lots of updates, news, reviews, etc. create a giveaway area where the members and community can host giveaways and get rewarded for such actions.


About GameHandout:

GameHandout is based on giving back to the gaming community. Our name says it all. We giveaway games, with over 60+ different games were currently attempting to giveaway. We're nonstop trying to contact game developers, buy games, etc. to obtain as many games as we can to help out the gaming community.


We see all the other game giveaway sites where you're constantly struggling to win a giveaway, though we do have a giveaway section we have a forum that allows the members to talk to one another, and in doing so you raise forum currency called GameHandout Cash also known as GH$. GH$ can be spent in our shop to redeem for specific games you want without having to try and win them. This way you have control over what you want to save for, get, obtain, and play. Every dollar we get we spend back on the site to improve it, add more games, and to make the community a better place.


We allow members to make reviews for games they enjoy. This way the developers of games get a good look at what the members truly think without worry about if they've been paid to do it, paid off, etc. It's 100% up to the community to make reviews, and they tell it as it is. We have a section dedicated for this, and it's one of the main reasons we're trying to upgrade to get a portal, so we're able to show these reviews, and have them easily accessible to the public.


We're fond of social media, as many gamers tend to gravitate towards social media, so we love to giveaway games on all of our social media. We also host a youtube channel, and we're in the process of trying to turn it into a community ran youtube, where you submit your own video and we review it, and if it meets the standards we have set we upload it on the channel. This way we can help out the youtube side of the gaming community by helping to advertise them, and show the world their potential.


If you'd like to know any more information feel free to contact us on anything from our social media, to our email. Contact@GameHandout.com


What We're Upgrading:

Here is a list of some things we're planning on upgrading:

A Portal (HomePage) that will allow us to desplay everything we need, such as a spotlight for member Reviews on games, our latest announcements, polls, stats/statistics, a section for random key giveaways, our giveaways and more!


A more indepth, and better giveaway system. Our current one is fine, but it takes a while to create a giveaway, and our members are not able to make their own giveaway. We want the members to have all the freedom they need, and making  their own giveaway is kind of a big deal.


Site Improvements, I'm really trying to upgrade the host, we have a decent package right now, but we're gaining members, and content fast so upgrading will help the site load more, as well as become more stable, and hold more pictures, user created content, and more.


General Updated. My goal is simply to make the site better, this will be minor tweeks, changes, and addons. GameHandout is an ever expanding community, and thus making the site itself ever expanding and changing. We want the members to be as happy as possible, and in doing so we're required to add certain things. Our goal is to make the site 100% automatic. Currently, most of our functions are manual, and with the expanding community we're going to need to make it 100% automatic.




GameHandout Community Created Work:

story:
Informed Planet Mobile Apps

It's about time we organized to get some real apps to better communicate on Informed Planet. For some time mobile users have been stuck using the mobile site via their browser with limited features. Let's make the experience better for them, and encourage more mobile bound people to join.

  • Smoother Browsing of Informed Planet via mobile.
  • Integrated chat that is cross compatible with all devices.
  • Beautiful new design, better user experience.
  • Smart photo viewer, with pinch to zoom.

All around better mobile user experience for all Informed Planet Members.

Real Time Chat

The app will integrate chat program will give us realtime Cross-platform messaging everywhere - mobile and website.

  • Cross-platform: works on the web site, mobile web site, iPhone, iPad and Android devices with native applications.
  • Real time messaging with push notifications.
  • Custom stickers in chat allows you to express your emotions.
Example of application and how it will look.


Any additional funds left after applications are complete will be directly invested in improving the website.

story:
It includes a cat teaser, a cat fishing stick, a feather, a small ball, and a laser.

Cats are always interested in new options yet short of endurance. Searching for new toys is then agonizing, so we start to ponder the possibility of a toy with a lasting charm. And, the idea of creating this fun and play-on toy sparked. Working with a group of cat lovers, WANT-i came to life! With all the indispensable elements cats long for, we finally make a toy with at least 6 playing ways, so your precious cats can always find the grass green.


When brainstorming a name for our novel concoction, we decided to make it easy and simple, just to keep the essences. No knickknacks. No hazards. We just WANT to provide her Majesty the most interesting, innovative, and irresistible toy. Then, here goes WANT-i.


Embellished with fresh light green, the white console is pleasing to the eye. WANT-i will become an adorable addition to your house.

We came up with this wonderful idea and then let the French designer deal with its outlook. If you look closer from the top, you can find a cat’s eye, or a scratch of the cat. As a toy, WANT-i starts the fun from the appearance.

We believe little things make a big difference, so WANT-i not only provides the fun to your cats but also makes the owners appreciate it. The remote control of WANT-i replaces the traditional, boring design with a cute look of the cat paw, so using it will be like having a contact with your cats.

With multiple play modes, WANT-i has equipped with high playfulness for our cats. Yet, we still feel there should be some more gadgets to better our device. Then, we add a randomization feature to the play modes, so the cats can never guess what comes next and thus create even more fun!

Not only that, WANT-i offers extra interactivity between the owner and the pet. The owners can choose to play simply with their cats with the included cat teaser or the laser pointer. Or, they can use the remote to control the console from a distance.

To multiply the fun, here we suggest some methods for you and your pets.

Spinning : 

With the agile movement of the bait spinning on the fishing stick, your cats can fully enjoy the hunt.

Slithering : 

Take the stick off the console and rock it on the floor, and you can have a recreational and intimate moment with your pets.

Wiggling : 

Let the console wiggle the teaser for you, and the cats have the ample fun!

Batting : 

WANT-i comes with a specially designed bat and ball. Set up the batting mode, and the moving ball will catch your cats’ eyes!

Ball tracking : 

Even without using the bat, the track in the console will allow the ball to roll freely, and you can see your cats’ cute little paws patting the ball.

Laser chasing : 

Mixing the laser with the multiple play modes of WANT-i provides sufficient exercise and ample fun for your cats, and, of course, you, the owner.

When will I receive the order?

With all our efforts, we aim to deliver WANT-i to all our backers in February, 2016.

How’s WANT-i charged?

The console is charged by only 3 AA batteries, and the remote control requires 2 AAA batteries.

How long do the batteries last?

Both the console and the remote control require the use of batteries. Normally, it takes about one week to change the batteries for the console, and a month for the remote. The real situation is up to the usage and conditions.

Where is the device produced?

WANT-i is manufactured in Taiwan.

How do I replace the teaser in the future?

As long as the stick of the new teaser is thinner than 5mm, it should be compatible with the console of WANT-i.

When is the best time to use WANT-i?

Well, anytime! Nevertheless, according to the research, cats dine around the dawn and the dusk, and these are the times they hype with the hungers to chase. Therefore, we advise you to utilize WANT-i around these times.

Will the machine automatically shut down?

Yes, we equip WANT-i with the wise auto shutdown feature. If the device has been started for ten minutes, the spinning function will be off to prevent the battery exhaustion.

Is the device working quietly?

We’ve strived to eliminate the noise of our cat toy, so the console would only contain some sounds caused by the electric motor. Besides the motor sound, there might be a chance that you encounter louder squeaking sounds if your pets block the movement of the device. This is due to the safety mechanism we specifically design to protect your pets from snapping by the machine, so don't worry about it.

With our goal of providing the safety and pleasure in mind, we’ve strived for almost two years, and we’re more than glad to announce the molding has coming to the perfection.

We look forward to introducing WANT-i to all the cat lovers. Though working with an experienced maker and having tested our design for a long period of time grant us confidence in our production plan, we will never sacrifice your satisfaction in the mass production.

We will try our best to deliver the perfected product to you in January, 2016. Nevertheless, should there be any unanticipated issues, please be a bit patient with us.

We will update any latest information about the production, so you won’t miss it.

We care about not only our own cats but also the cats around us. In Taiwan, there are more than 120,000 stray cats, and the amount is increased by 20% every year. This has caused concerns regarding the environment and the cats caring.

Presently, it is advised to utilize the Trap-Neuter-Return (TNR) program to humanely and effectively control the number of stray animals and thus sustain the quality of the environment and the pets caring.

Not only that, TNR can reduce about 50% of the government budget using on animal control.WANT-i wants to be part of it. With every WANT-i sold, we will donate 1% of the sale to Stray Cats TNR Association, Taiwan, which has been promoting the TNR programs around Taiwan and has helped at least 15,000 stray cats.

WANTi web site.
story_txt:
It includes a cat teaser, a cat fishing stick, a feather, a small ball, and a laser.



Cats are always interested in new options yet short of endurance. Searching for new toys is then agonizing, so we start to ponder the possibility of a toy with a lasting charm. And, the idea of creating this fun and play-on toy sparked. Working with a group of cat lovers, WANT-i came to life! With all the indispensable elements cats long for, we finally make a toy with at least 6 playing ways, so your precious cats can always find the grass green.




When
brainstorming a name for our novel concoction, we decided to make it easy and
simple, just to keep the essences. No knickknacks. No hazards. We just WANT to provide her Majesty the most interesting, innovative,
and irresistible toy. Then, here goes WANT-i.





Embellished with fresh light green, the white console is pleasing to
the eye. WANT-i will become an adorable addition to your house.

We came up with this wonderful idea and then let the French designer
deal with its outlook. If you look closer from the top, you can find a cat’s
eye, or a scratch of the cat. As a toy, WANT-i starts the fun from the
appearance.

We believe little things make a big difference, so WANT-i not only provides the
fun to your cats but also makes the owners appreciate it. The remote control of
WANT-i replaces the traditional, boring design with a cute look of the cat paw,
so using it will be like having a contact with your cats.



With multiple play modes, WANT-i has equipped with high playfulness
for our cats. Yet, we still feel there should be some more gadgets to better
our device. Then, we add a randomization feature to the play modes, so the cats
can never guess what comes next and thus create even more fun!

Not only that, WANT-i offers extra interactivity between the owner and the pet. The
owners can choose to play simply with their cats with the included cat teaser
or the laser pointer. Or, they can use the remote to control the console from a
distance.


To multiply the fun, here we suggest some methods for you and your
pets.

Spinning : 
With the agile movement of the bait spinning on the fishing stick, your cats can
fully enjoy the hunt.




Slithering : 
Take
the stick off the console and rock it on the floor, and you can have a recreational
and intimate moment with your pets.





Wiggling : 
Let
the console wiggle the teaser for you, and the cats have the ample fun!





Batting : 
WANT-i
comes with a specially designed bat and ball. Set up the batting mode, and the
moving ball will catch your cats’ eyes!





Ball tracking : 

Even without using the bat, the track in the console will allow the ball to roll
freely, and you can see your cats’ cute little paws patting the ball.








Laser chasing : 
Mixing
the laser with the multiple play modes of WANT-i provides sufficient exercise
and ample fun for your cats, and, of course, you, the owner.














When will I receive the order?
With all our efforts, we aim to deliver WANT-i to all our backers in February, 2016.
How’s WANT-i charged?
The console is charged by only 3 AA batteries, and the remote control requires 2 AAA batteries.
How long do the batteries last?
Both the console and the remote control require the use of batteries. Normally, it takes about one week to change the batteries for the console, and a month for the remote. The real situation is up to the usage and conditions.
Where is the device produced?
WANT-i is manufactured in Taiwan.
How do I replace the teaser in the future?
As long as the stick of the new teaser is thinner than 5mm, it should be compatible with the console of WANT-i.
When is the best time to use WANT-i?
Well, anytime! Nevertheless, according to the research, cats dine around the dawn and the dusk, and these are the times they hype with the hungers to chase. Therefore, we advise you to utilize WANT-i around these times.
Will the machine automatically shut down?
Yes, we equip WANT-i with the wise auto shutdown feature. If the device has been started for ten minutes, the spinning function will be off to prevent the battery exhaustion.
Is the device working quietly?
We’ve strived to eliminate the noise of our cat toy, so the console would only contain some sounds caused by the electric motor. Besides the motor sound, there might be a chance that you encounter louder squeaking sounds if your pets block the movement of the device. This is due to the safety mechanism we specifically design to protect your pets from snapping by the machine, so don't worry about it.

With our goal of providing the safety and pleasure in mind, we’ve strived for almost two years, and we’re more than glad to announce the molding has coming to the perfection.

We look forward to introducing WANT-i to all the cat lovers. Though working with an experienced maker and having tested our design for a long period of time grant us confidence in our production plan, we will never sacrifice your satisfaction in the mass production.
We will try our best to deliver the perfected product to you in January, 2016. Nevertheless, should there be any unanticipated issues, please be a bit patient with us.
We will update any latest information about the production, so you won’t miss it.

We care about not only our own cats but also the cats around us. In Taiwan, there are more than 120,000 stray cats, and the amount is increased by 20% every year. This has caused concerns regarding the environment and the cats caring.
Presently, it is advised to utilize the Trap-Neuter-Return (TNR) program to humanely and effectively control the number of stray animals and thus sustain the quality of the environment and the pets caring.
Not only that, TNR can reduce about 50% of the government budget using on animal control.WANT-i wants to be part of it. With every WANT-i sold, we will donate 1% of the sale to Stray Cats TNR Association, Taiwan, which has been promoting the TNR programs around Taiwan and has helped at least 15,000 stray cats.
