story:
Why the ChristWreath 


During the Christmas season a number of years ago, our pastor was lamenting that we see Frosty, Rudolph and Santa ...Secularism and the American atheist movement is being very effective in diminishing the presence of Christ in Christmas.

While he continued I noticed a Cross adjacent to him and behind that, a beautiful Christmas wreath. HMMM..why not bring together the  CROSS, the universal symbol of Christ and the wreath, this NEW CHRISTMAS SYMBOL, the ChristWreath, will serve as an affirmation of the true meaning of Christmas the Birth of the Christ Child.

The ChristWreath will be a symbol of Christian Pride and what HIS values bring to our lives,our Country and the World.


       


Most Christians place a round wreath on their home at Christmas. How many would now display the ChristWreath....the New Christmas Symbol, on their home to affirm their Pride in Christianity and support for Religious Freedom?

There are over 240,000,000 Christians in America, if only 10% embrace the meaning of the ChristWreath, that means we have to produce  24,000,000  (that's MILLION), ChristWreaths.

How many JOBS could we create in America if we had to Manufacture 24,000,000 ChristWreaths???

Millions of artificial Christmas wreaths are imported from China every year. We Americans send Billions of our U.S. dollars to China to manufacture 95% of OUR CHRISTmas  products for OUR CHRISTIAN celebration. Does this make business sense???  ( and China is not a Christian country)

We were elated when we were notified by the United States Patent and Trademark Office that the ChristWreath has been granted both a DESIGN PATENT and a copyright for the ChristWreath name.

With having a design patent, we now have the opportunity to make the ChristWreath, The NEW CHRISTMAS SYMBOL, a MADE IN THE USA product and help create badly needed JOBS in America.
We have also decided that we want to start,by having these jobs created in Challenged  Communities throughout the United States.

We are working with Churches and Schools to use the ChristWreath as a Fund-Raiser  to help support  their Youth and Family Ministries. Any organization is encouraged to use the ChristWreath and our New ChristWreath Christmas Cross Jewelry collection plus other ChristWreath designed products to enhance their fundraising opportunity and share the New Christmas  Symbol.
              Insert pictures

Please go to our web www.ChristWreath.com to register your organization for the ChristWreath fundraiser.
.
The ChristWreath is now like a two edged sword, it brings a wonderful Christmas message and secondly,   helps create much needed jobs in America for our Youth and the unemployed!!!

This Christmas,Dec 25th, help us plan the largest Celebration ever with this banner as HIS invitation to each one of us:

              

 Wouldn't it be wonderful to see this inviting message placed on our roadways,Schools and Churches all over America as our response to the billboards being placed by the American Atheists.

Please go to our web www.rsvpJESUS.org for information on this Billboard and Banner program.

Job Creation Plan

With our campaign we are reaching out to all communities throughout the United States requesting they JOIN US on this wonderful journey to Keep Christ In Christmas and create jobs in your Community by manufacturing millions of ChristWreath designed products.

With the Design Patent, we can preclude China from bringing in a ChristWreath Design product.  With a large percentage of Christians supporting and wanting a ChristWreath designed product the most efficient and effective way to get the ChristWreath  to the customer will be to manufacture them in all States throughout the United States.

With having the Design Patent we will license manufacturers who wish to either start a new business or license current manufacturers that wish to add the ChristWreath product to their current product line in order to improve the profit potential to their company.

The products to be manufactured could be vast;

Both real and artificial ChristWreath for your home, lighted wreaths,small and large plastic wreaths (injection molding Companies), 





Our plan is to partner with local businesses, to add the ChristWreath to their product line, as they already have a manufacturing infrastructure.The goal is to hire teens and other unemployed in the local area to provide them with the job skills necessary to be  productive and successful individuals as they strive to improve their lives.

We are pleased that Resurrection Life Family Worship Center,Ft Pierce Fl.,  is to be the first to be manufacturing ChristWreath products and providing individuals within their Community a job opportunity.

We will be reaching out to Churches, Schools and the general public requesting they support the mission of the ChristWreath which will also create additional employment in the Community.

If the ChristWreath manufacturing opportunity we create here can be an effective bridge for individuals to attain self esteem and job skills, then the ChristWreath manufacturing program could be used as a model in other Communities to improve the lives of many throughout the USA.

Depending upon demand, manufacturing locations could be set up in various locations throughout the country.

There are over 200,000,000 Christians in the USA. If only 10% would support the Keep Christ In Christmas campaign and display a ChristWreath, we will need 20,000,000 (that's MILLION) ChristWreath's manufactured.  How many jobs could we create to meet that small %???

What if  20% embraced the ChristWreath as the NEW CHRISTMAS SYMBOL?? 40,000,000 CHRISTWREATHS NEEDED!!  WOW....

China has been the recipient of billions of USA dollars for OUR Christmas product manufacturing - (and theirs is not a Christian country)  Isn't it time that Christmas and all that it embodies, has a re-birth IN the USA??

This has developed into a wonderful journey. Having retired a number of years ago, I had not envisioned being at the threshold of a worthy mission as well as helping  create much needed jobs in America. My past business experience was in helping to build independent Insurance Agencies  in Northeast Pennsylvania.

WE would love to have the ChristWreath be the start, and to be an example, of how we can all help to re-build AMERICA and provide individuals with additional opportunities.

We are pleased that Indian River State College's Entrepreneurship Development Institute is assisting as we move forward with our planning to help create jobs in America.  St Anastasia Knights of Columbus council is assisting in our marketing initiative to contact various Christian Churches and Schools to consider using the ChristWreath as a fundraiser to help them fund their Youth and Family Ministries.  Pastor Trevor Banks of The Resurrection Life Family Worship Center is the first to be using the ChristWreath to provide jobs in their Community.

Our hope is that this will spread as a National Campaign across America.

The ethics and moral values are badly broken in our country today. Is it not time to have a re-birth of Christian Family Values ........The New 3R's we need to emphasize are...

                         Respect...Responsibility...Righteousness

Will YOU help...  If Not You..WHO??     If Not Now....WHEN??

Please go to   ChristWreath.com  for more information of our ChristWreath Mission

             Merry Christmas  It's My Birthday  Dec 25th  Join The Celebration

                                                      rsvpJESUS.org

 


What We Need & What You Get

Contributions to our campaign will be used to spread the Message of the New Christmas Symbol...the ChristWreath through the manufacturing and sales of the ChristWreath and ChristWreath related products.

To manufacture the  Christwreath we will need to purchase many things ..wreath making machines,wreath rings,wreath greenery material,decorating,packaging material etc.

Injection Plastic mold for plastic ChristWreath's. Machinery to embroider team hats with the ChristWreath Logo (our team is larger than the NFL & MLB... it's the Christian Pride team). The ChristWreath Christmas Jewelry Collection (necklace, earrings, bracelet, etc.)

Contributions may also be used to purchase billboard advertising for invitations to the largest Christmas celebration in the USA. (see our website billboard and banner program @ ChristWreath.com)

By supporting the ChristWreath - "Keep Christ In Christmas" campaign you not only will be able to express your pride in Christianity by displaying the ChristWreath but also help create needed JOBS in the USA.

The Impact

Our Mission is to engage and challenge the Christian community to Keep Christ In Christmas.

Reaffirm the PRIDE of what Christian Family Values bring to our lives, our country and the world.

Assist in a Re-Birth of Christian Family Values in America which  made the USA the envy  of  the world.

Manufacturing JOBS created through the ChristWreath will help build a bridge for the unemployed to become more successful members of America and meet their individual goals and aspirations.

The Christian community, JOINING TOGETHER, can place in motion a movement to return the USA to its prior Righteousness. There are Christians all over this great country who can help take the lead to 'KEEP CHRIST IN CHRISTMAS"

There are business leaders and manufacturers who could improve their profits by adding a ChristWreath related product to their offerings and at the same time create jobs in the USA.....a Win Win combination

If not you  WHO...If not now...WHEN

             Merry Christmas  It's My Birthday Dec 25th  Join The Celebration

                                                    rsvpJESUS.org


Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider how you can help move this campaign forward. Go to our website  @  ChristWreath.com for some ideas and to send us yours ideas and your feedback.

We understand that some folks just can't contribute, but we would love for you to help in other ways!!

Ask others to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Remind them to use their:

CONTACTS... SOCIAL MEDIA... FACEBOOK... TWITTER... THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS

Sharing the Mission. That's all there is to it! Come join us on this wonderful journey.

...Now let's celebrate!!!           It's all about Him!!!             Jesus is born!!!

              Merry Christmas  It's  My  Birthday  Dec 25th   Join The Celebration

                                                   rsvpJESUS.org

story:
Short Summary

Here ThomasSquall, the programmer, I'm a 21 years old guy and I'm the founder of BadaSquall Videogames. Our team is composed by a programmer (me), 3 drawers and a music director and we are expanding our members. We are creating a Pokémon game (code written from zero and not a hack) with new characters and a new graphic. We develop for Microsoft (Pc and X-box 360). After this project we are supposed to create new games totally created by us.

What We Need & What You Get

My team need funds to buy licences of software that we are using, like photoshop, visual studio and others. After this we will be able to publish our works. The funds are for the team itself and not for the actual project so they are usefull for the future too.

Thanks from Badasquall Videogames Team:
                             

                                            https://www.facebook.com/BadaSquall

story:
Hello Gamers !


We are a game studio who is developing a real paintball FPS multiplayer game with your own account system!

We started 8 months ago with own fincancing, and need now the support of the paintball community.


We try to build THE world changing paintball game for everyone free to play !

But as you all know, there are lots of cost for development and servers.

As for us there is NO PROFIT ! We make this game for the community.

And the money collected will be provided to make the game better for all of us.

Since we started this project, there is for 8 months no income for this studio. And we are dedicated to use every penny wisely. We ourself are paintballers, so we just want this game to happen as good as possible!

Dont take our word for it! Play the BETA:

http://paintballgame.com/webplayer/high-quality.html

 

What We Need & Why

Break it down for folks in more detail:

1000 $ = Improve menu's, fix bugs, add game music and sounds to the game

2000 $ = Paying for High Traffic servers (2 webserver + 4 gameservers)

3000 $ = Beta becomes demo online

4000 $ = Game Account Login feature

5000 $ = Adding "The Military Base" Game Map, DAY NIGHT and SUNSET version.

6000 $ = Flash version also online

6500 $ = Killcam added

7000 $ = ASIA Server comes online

8000 $ = Adding cool features: New guns that you would like into the game, Dye, Empire, BT, Tippmann, Ego etc.
Adding: Smoke granade, Paint C4, Paint Claymore

10.000 = iOS Game version on iPad

15.000 = Sup'Air mode, for the sports players

18.000 = Subair levels and official game modes (NPPL, millenium series etc).

20.000 = Finishing touch and get everything done propperly.
 
 
We use these cost to pay our 3d artists, programmeurs, developers, music artists, servermanager. The studio itself has NO-MONEY-PROFIT from this. Every dollar is spend on production.
 

1 person can make the difference ! That means you :)

 
We have put a LOT more to start developing the game. The core of the game is done (the stuff that you will not notice, like programming/networking). We needs these last dollars for finishing the game.
 
If you could donate one amount of money, that would help us a great deal ! And provide you a great game.
 

If you cannot contribute to our Paintball Game Online?

Well play our game ! See if you can find bugs and post info on our forums.
And while your playing, text some friend and get them to play the game also.
story_txt:
Hello Gamers !

We are a game studio who is developing a real paintball FPS multiplayer game with your own account system!
We started 8 months ago with own fincancing, and need now the support of the paintball community.
We try to build THE world changing paintball game for everyone free to play !
But as you all know, there are lots of cost for development and servers.
As for us there is NO PROFIT ! We make this game for the community.
And the money collected will be provided to make the game better for all of us.
Since we started this project, there is for 8 months no income for this studio. And we are dedicated to use every penny wisely. We ourself are paintballers, so we just want this game to happen as good as possible!
Dont take our word for it! Play the BETA:
http://paintballgame.com/webplayer/high-quality.html
 


What We Need & Why
Break it down for folks in more detail:
1000 $ = Improve menu's, fix bugs, add game music and sounds to the game
2000 $ = Paying for High Traffic servers (2 webserver + 4 gameservers)
3000 $ = Beta becomes demo online
4000 $ = Game Account Login feature
5000 $ = Adding "The Military Base" Game Map, DAY NIGHT and SUNSET version.
6000 $ = Flash version also online
6500 $ = Killcam added
7000 $ = ASIA Server comes online
8000 $ = Adding cool features: New guns that you would like into the game, Dye, Empire, BT, Tippmann, Ego etc.Adding: Smoke granade, Paint C4, Paint Claymore
10.000 = iOS Game version on iPad
15.000 = Sup'Air mode, for the sports players
18.000 = Subair levels and official game modes (NPPL, millenium series etc).

20.000 = Finishing touch and get everything done propperly.
 
 
We use these cost to pay our 3d artists, programmeurs, developers, music artists, servermanager. The studio itself has NO-MONEY-PROFIT from this. Every dollar is spend on production.
 
1 person can make the difference ! That means you :)
 
We have put a LOT more to start developing the game. The core of the game is done (the stuff that you will not notice, like programming/networking). We needs these last dollars for finishing the game.
 
If you could donate one amount of money, that would help us a great deal ! And provide you a great game.
 

If you cannot contribute to our Paintball Game Online?
Well play our game ! See if you can find bugs and post info on our forums.And while your playing, text some friend and get them to play the game also.

story:
*DEAR FRIENDS PLEASE NOTE! YOU CAN TO DONATE ANY AMOUNT YOU WISH. (SEE "CONTRIBUTE" TASKBAR ON THE RIGHT, ABOVE LIST OF PERKS)
YOU DO NOT NEED TO "CLAIM" A PERK TO SUPPORT MY CAMPAIGN!* :)

Sarah Pang’s story as a Singaporean tennis player competing on the Womens Pro Circuit is one most would have written off as impossible.  She started tennis at 19, and had a dream that was only greeted by naysayers—to one day play professional.  With no funding and limited family support, Sarah paved her own way and self-funded her developmental pipeline for 10 years. This year, Sarah represented Singapore at Fed Cup, the SEA Games, and joined the Womens Pro Circuit, as a full time professional player.  

Read more of Sarah's journey at:

1a.  Yahoo Sports, Singapore.
"Sarah Pang comes from a humble background. A true-blue HDB girl, she lives in Bukit Merah, grew up on mee pok and fishball noodles and only picked up a tennis racquet at 19.  Twelve years on, Pang is now gearing up for a genuine crack at obtaining a WTA ranking and then playing on the circuit itself."
https://sg.sports.yahoo.com/blogs/fit-to-post-sports/singapore-tennis-player-sarah-pang-takes-to-crowdfunding-to-go-pro-102321501.html

1b. Exclusive Campaign Feature with SuperSports360
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LOGT9d4GESk

1c. Exclusive with ActiveSG
https://www.myactivesg.com/news/2015/10/an-indiegogo-path-to-the-wta

2.  Personality Feature with Elle.sg

"What does playing for our country (Singapore) mean to me?  It means having a platform to potentially be a tennis sporting symbol for our nation. That is a huge possibility and responsibility that I do not take lightly." --http://www.elle.sg/zh/living/girl-we-love-sarah-pang-5549188

"It is my hope that funders, sponsors and the government consider investing more in people, breaking out of the frame that you always need results before any sort of help will be given. It is a chicken-and-egg cycle and there are better ways to sustainably groom talent. We need to expand our understanding and definitions of success." -http://www.elle.sg/en/living/how-to-make-your-dream-a-5882134

3.  Interview with CNBC
http://video.cnbc.com/gallery/?video=3000386008

4.  WTA Championships/SEAGames Feature
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KrVqcuMd80Y
5.  Having Fun with Kiss 92 and OneFM ;)
KISS 92: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=86q35UHwM_UO
OneFM: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=29IV1kIzGhM

Join Sarah on her journey at
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/tenniswithsarah
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/tenniswithsarah/?hl=en
Web: http://www.tenniswithsarah.com

story:
Okrenite s nama novu stranicu priče o KOZi

Skupina mladih entuzijasta iza kojih stoji višegodišnje iskustvo organiziranja kvizova općeg znanja u sklopu rada udruge Novi mediji ovoga Božića odlučila vas je obradovati novim projektom: KOZa društvena igra znanja. Nakon brojnih kvizova na području Hrvatske odlučili smo koncept pretočiti u opipljiv proizvod – društvenu igru na ploči koju bismo i sami željeli zaigrati na board game večerima s društvom.

Koncept igre u potpunosti smo razvili, dizajn je u finišu, no slijedi financijski najzahtjevniji korak: troškovi tiska za inicijalnu ediciju premašuju naš skroman budžet i tu nam je potrebna vaša pomoć kako bismo igru porinuli u svijet. Ovom kampanjom dobivate priliku uključiti se u realizaciju projekta jer svojom donacijom odnosno predbilježbom za igru nama pomažete pokriti visoke početne troškove tiska (pravog tiska, ne simboličnog printanja iz videa :)), dok sebi po promotivnoj cijeni poklanjate brojne zabavne večeri u društvu originalne igre znanja na ploči, ali i pravo na samohvalu kako ste na vrijeme prepoznali i podržali pravi projekt.

 

 

Što je KOZa društvena igra

  • više od 2.500 pitanja
  • 10 kategorija
  • 2–16 igrača (2–4 pojedinca ili 2–4 ekipe)
  • dob: 17–117

Temeljena na svježem i originalnom konceptu, KOZa društvena igra razlikuje se od popularnih igara sličnog tipa koje ste možda odigrali.
Raznovrsnost izazova koje KOZa predstavlja igračima na putu do cilja osigurava dinamičnu i uzbudljivu igru od početka do kraja. Adrenalin i osjećaj anticipacije svakako podiže i mogućnost profitiranja od suparničkih grešaka – što izravno (prilikom da se odgovori na netočno odgovoreno pitanje suparnika), što putem posebnih kartica. Dodatne kartice kladionice i veta od igrača zahtijevaju i dobro taktiziranje, a raznolikost zastupljenih područja općeg znanja onemogućuje igrače jake u samo jednom području da se „prošeću“ do cilja. S obzirom na brojnost kategorija i vrsta prepreka za igrače, pravila su ustvari jednostavna i pristupačna pa nije potreban dugotrajan proces upoznavanja mehanike igre. Isto tako, igrač ili ekipa koji prvi počnu igrati nisu ni u kakvoj prednosti nad suparnicima, što je vrlo važno za pravednost natjecanja.

O detaljnim pravilima igre informirajte se u Pravilima te pratite naše objave u kojima ćemo vas pobliže upoznavati s karakteristikama igre. Sljedećih dana pokazivat ćemo vam i kartice kako ih naša dizajnerica bude izbacivala iz pećnice.

 

Podrži KOZu i izaberi poziciju: od stočnog suradnika do meeecene

Za sve koji nas odluče podržati pripremili smo znakove pažnje:

  • Za donaciju od 3 $ na mejl vam stiže tajna poruka na drevnom (i zasad nedešifriranom) kozjem jeziku.
  • Za 5 $ na kućnu adresu stiže vam KOZa bilježnica.
  • Za 15 $ možete se obući u profinjeno KOZa odijelo (dakle majicu).
  • S 25 $ naručujete svoju KOZa društvenu igru po promotivnoj kampanjskoj, ovaj, blagdanskoj cijeni.
  • Za 35 $ dobivate igru KOZa i vodite svoju ekipu na kviz s 4 ulaznice* za KOZa kvizove.
  • S 50 $ ulažete u veliki KOZa paket, koji uključuje igru KOZa, majicu, bilježnicu i 4 ulaznice* za KOZa kvizove.
  • Za 80 $ uz KOZa društvenu igru dobivate godišnju ulaznicu na sve kvizove u organizaciji KOZe u Hrvatskoj.
  • 100 $ donosi vam igru u kojoj ćemo vam tiskati posebnu zahvalu kao istaknutom kozočinitelju.
  • Za 150 $ u igru uvrštavamo vaše pitanje (podrazumijeva se: kad smišljate pitanje, nema vrijeđanja ni na kakvoj osnovi).
  • Ako uplatite 1000 $ (i oslobodite nas marketinških muka), zaključit ćemo da vas je obuzelo kozje ludilo i dati vam sve od navedenog, a usto ćemo vaše cijenjeno ime nositi s KOZom kuda god ona išla.  

*Vrijedi za gradove u kojima se održavaju KOZa kvizovi (ili nas pozovite u svoj grad!).

Svoju nagradu izaberite klikom na željeni perk: nagrade koje ne uključuju primjerak igre dostavljamo po završetku kampanje, u siječnju 2017., dok igra stiže u veljači 2017., čim iziđe iz tiska radi kojeg smo se ovdje okupili. U perkove je uključena dostava u Zagrebu i poštarinu u ostatku Hrvatske, ali ne i regije.

VAŽNA NAPOMENA: Svi koji se svojom donacijom predbilježe za svoju KOZa društvenu igru, dobivaju je u veljači 2017. bez obzira na konačan iznos prikupljenih sredstava. (Iliti: Tko plati, taj i dobije.)

Donacije možete uplatiti PayPalom ili karticom, a za uplatu ne morate imati otvoren račun na Indiegogou. Isto tako, donirati nam možete javno ili anonimno.

Na temelju vaših upita, dodali smo i mogućnost uplate na račun općom uplatnicom na: 

Udruga Novi mediji 
Zagreb, Jablanska 82
IBAN: HR2023400091110547631  uz obaveznu naznaku: Za projekt KOZa društvena igra. Ako ste odabrali perk, napišite i naziv perka u opis plaćanja.

Podržite i proširite vijest!

Vaša nam je podrška ključna u ostvarenju ove igre.
Vjerujemo da imamo odličnu ideju, da smo osmislili igrivu, pristupačnu i uzbudljivu društvenu igru. Ako su izazovi koji igrače čekaju od početka do kraja ploče veliki, oni se čine zanemarivima u usporedbi s preprekama koje nas čekaju od razvijenog koncepta do gotove društvene igre na stolu (ili podu). Podržite nas i dajte svoj doprinos ostvarenju ovoga projekta i postanite jedan od prvih i ponosnih vlasnika igre KOZa. Ako se ne možete uključiti donacijom ili narudžbom, udijelite nam lajk ili šer – dobra riječ ne košta ništa!

Za pitanja, pohvale i pritužbe, savjete i komentare, pišite nam na koza.drustvenaigra@gmail.com, a čitamo se sljedećih dana ovdje, na našem webu i na Facebook stranici!

story:
My name is Hugo Castro, I am the person responsible for bringing a bunch of people together in 2007 to start working in a videogames expo, that with the years would become one of the most important videogames initiatives of Mexico.

In a nut shell, GAMACON was created to boost the video games, animation and creative media development industry in the State of Baja California. It’s more than just an entertainment expo; it has an agenda that covers the educational needs and economic development of the industry that now helps different regions of Mexico as well.

We work all year to create these opportunities (some of us volunteering for free, and some of us pro-bono). And once a year, we have our annual event that consists of 5 sub-events:

  • Business meeting
  • Symposium (Conferences and workshops)
  • Startup Weekend (Hackathon)
  • Expo
  • Videogames music concert with a symphony orchestra

This year we have our annual event on Nov 4-6, 2016, in Mexicali, Baja California, Mexico, at the Convention Center of the Centro Estatal de las Artes. And we certainly need your support. This is an event that is partly funded by the Federal Government, but only enough to cover 50% of the cost. And with the current exchange rate of the dollar vs the peso, this only make things a little harder for us to cover everything.

Before moving on to the details of the event, I would like to tell you a story, it’s a little long, but it’s totally worth to stick to the end, so you could appreciate why we do this, why every year we work to create opportunities for students, and Mexican development companies, why we put so much passion, heart and soul into this initiative.

I'm often asked what one of the most relevant stories of Gamacon is. There are two really good stories, but for now, I will stick with only one, which I believe has had the most impact on me personally. The first Gamacon expo was created in March 2008, and for the gala closing event, we did a very famous videogames music concert the first time in Mexico that we will call SFVMC (some famous videogames music concert). So many things went wrong, my team and I weren't ready for a 1000 people expo, and the complicated music concert that was SFVMC.

Financially, I lost a lot of money. My two passions together in one event: Music and Videogames. I didn’t want to know anything about them; I didn’t want to know anything about Gamacon. But for the people that attended, they were really impressed with the expo, and thanks to the support of the SFVMC production team, the concert was mind blowing for them. They didn’t know everything that went wrong.

At the end of the concert one of the co-creator of SFVMC wanted to talk to me, and asked me why so many things went wrong. I humbly said that we were only a group of friends that wanted to make a great videogames expo, and ended up lacking the experience to deliver what we needed, that we failed. Strangely he replied that he didn’t see it that way, that he believed we did a great job. He continued saying that every show he goes to, the staff is more than 50 people, and we were only 7 for the expo and the concert. He said: “How did you guys do it? It’s incredible. Yes, many things were wrong, but you have a great team.” ”I would have never thought of doing a show in Mexicali, since it’s not a huge metropolis”. And I asked, then why did you come? He replied that the way I spoke to him about what we wanted to achieved, how we wanted to create the opportunities that we didn’t have when we were younger to create videogames as a living, how we wanted Mexico to be an important pillar in the videogames industry, the passion with which I described every detail of the project, made him believed that one day Gamacon would be one of the most important videogames expo in Mexico, and that he wanted to be part of the beginning of it. He finished by saying: “The videogames industry couldn’t be in better hands than yours.” At that precise moment, I loved music and videogames again. And I said to myself that my team and I would learn from our mistakes and continue with Gamacon!

Fast forward to 2016, Gamacon today is an initiative that is supported by the Mexican Federal Government, an initiative that has been adopted by the Baja California State Government, the IT cluster, the private sector and the state Universities. It’s an initiative that welcomes nearly 4500 people, development studios from different parts of the world and Mexican development studios from different states of Mexico, that helps hundreds of Universities students following their dream of making videogames. We have achieved so much and created many opportunities in the past years, but we’re just getting started and we need your support to create and achieve more!!!

Linked to the Baja California IT Cluster, the Secretariat of Economy, ProMexico, ProSoft, the Mexican Association of Information Technologies Industry, the Convention and Tourism Committee, educational institutes, and the private sector, we converge all the activities related to video games and unified all efforts, planning and coordinating them to reach a common goal. The common goal is to prepare the talent and generate business opportunities for all Mexican development studios, helping to nurture and foster the growth of companies in this industry, making Mexico an important pillar of this industry in the world.

This year will be the 7th edition of GAMACON (we skipped 2012 & 2013), every year getting bigger and more important for this industry, and it’s currently called the most important event north of Mexico.

Now let’s talk more details about each of our sub-events:

BUSINESS MEETING – MEET THE INDUSTRY

At business roundtables, meet with game developers and artist from Mexico and other parts of the world, educational institutes, regional committees, and the government institutions in charge of the economic development of the State.

This is one of most important events of Gamacon. Here we get together with the Mexican Government, Universities, Mexican development studios and foreign studios and discuss about the different projects and business opportunities that we can create, as well of some business-to-business meeting between the participants.

SYMPOSIUM - INDUSTRY INSIGHTS

Conferences and workshops targeted at University students and current developers alike put them on the path to success.

Gamacon provides the opportunity for the audience to hear professionals’ experiences, learning about trends and identify opportunities within this industry.

We are expecting about 900 students this year to take advantages of the different conferences and workshops that we’re preparing for them.

Here’s a list of our confirmed speakers:

 

Alex Gonzalez – Entrepreneur/Author

“Entrepreneurship: Follow your dreams”

 

Roy Wooley – Visual effects expert

“From a though to reality, the creative process”

 

Richie Bisso – CTO Hyperkinetics Studios

“The creativity behind decision making”

 

Luis Fernando Martinez – Mexico country manager Razer USA Ltd

“From a Startup to a solid and self-sustainable company”

 

Kiyoshi Tsuru – ESA Mexico representative TMI Law

“The videogames industry in Mexico as a business”

 

Gabriel Reyes – CEO iDigital

“What goes with creating an idea?”

 

Rob GilesRitter & Jessie Cano – CEO & Studio Manager Haiku Studio

“The creative process to produce an indie videogame”

 

Harish Rao – Executive producer Monster VR

“VR/AR creative process in indie development”

 

Luis Daniel Ramirez – Voice Actor LolaMx

“Localization services: a sustainable business in Mexico”

 

Yoshitomo Moriwaki – CCO Hyperkinetic Studios

“The different ways you can be a game designer in the video games industry”

 

More to come….but we need your support!

 

EXPO - IT’S ALL ON DISPLAY

On the expo floor, the industry meets the consumer!

Universities and studios promote their programs, demos and services.

Additional activities feature cosplay, videogame tournaments, art galleries, wrestling matches, live music, meet & greet with special guests from the film and videogames industry, and more!

Special guests invited:

Gerard K Marino – Music composer for the God of War series

Shota Nakama – Music arranger for Final Fantasy. Video Game Orchestra creator & Capcom Live producer.

Roy Wooley – Visual effects expert. Worked on Rob Zombie’s Halloweend, the Hunger Games, and was in the SyFy channel show Face Off.

Mario Castañeda – Latin-American voice actor for Goku in the Dragon Ball series.

Alex Gonzalez – Went around the world on bicycle. Author, entrepreneur and motivational speaker.

Nadyasonika – Mexican international cosplayer, model and singer.

STARTUP WEEKEND - DEVELOP YOUR IDEA OR PROJECT

In just 54 hours, you will experience the highs, lows, fun, and pressure that make up life at a startup.

As you learn how to create a real company, you'll meet the very best mentors, investors, cofounders, and sponsors who are ready to help you get started.

At the end of the startup we already have three guardian angels that are willing to look at the three best products and consider invest in them. This is a great opportunity for the young students!

GAMACON SYMPHONY - THE MUSIC LIVES!

A spectacular evening of game music with a symphony orchestra, choir and rock band, with synchronized lightning and each game’s footage playing videogames music.

Each score directed by the music’s original composer!

We will have the participation of two symphony orchestras: The Red Rio Nuevo Orchestra, composed of young kids from 12-18 years old; and The Summoners Orchestra, composed of young adults from the Los Angeles area.

CAPCOM LIVE FOR THE FIRST TIME IN LATIN-AMERICA!!!

Gamacon Symphony will have Capcom Live as special guest for the first time in Mexico and Latin-America.

The official Capcom concert produced by Shota Nakama and Tommy Tallarico. The show features exclusive footages synchronized with the most memorable music from the Capcom franchise such as Street Fighter, Resident Evil, Mega Man, Devil May Cry and many more. www.capcomlive.com

SCHEDULE AT A GLANCE

November 2016

          Date(s)                          Time                    Event                                     

          Nov 4                            9am – 5:30pm              Conference Sessions

          Nov 4                            6pm – 9pm                   Business Meetings                

          Nov 4-6                         6pm                               Startup Weekend

          Nov 5-6                         11am – 8pm                 Gamacon Expo

          Nov 5                            8pm                               Orchestra Concert

 

YOU CAN PARTICIPATE!!!

Business Meetings – Meet the developers that could make your next game.

Outsourcing – Get in touch with companies looking to outsource parts of their next project.

Local Investment – Find the location and staff to open a local office of your business.

Acquisitions – Discover your next offshore game studio.

Angel Investors – Give yourself the opportunity to present your project to potential investors and sponsors.

Sponsorship – Support the Industry as a whole by sponsoring Gamacon itself!

BENEFITS OF THE PROJECT

Video games are the entertainment industry that has growth more rapidly in the last years, having already moved to second place the movie industry. They are the entertainment industry that generates the most revenue worldwide, and we’re missing out.

Considering our geographic advantage of Baja California over the rest of Mexico, by being neighbors to the State of California, where most of the leading development studios are based in the US, it’s absurd not to promote and boost this millionaire industry in this State. Under this convenience, several US companies are willing to participate with us by giving conferences and workshops to prepare the talent we need.

Business meeting benefits:

  • New technologies for universities and local and regional studios already established.
  • New business opportunities
  • Potential investors.
  • International promotion of Baja California development studios.
  • Access to companies (national and international) that will potentially get involved in the different State Chambers.
  • Business networking with other companies from Mexico, and other parts of the world.
  • Acquire data as to how Baja California is seen and compared to other parts of Mexico within the industry.

Symposium benefits:

  • Training in new technologies.
  • Improve the academic programs of the Universities and the talent of the students.
  • International acknowledgement of our talent incubation program in this industry.
  • Opportunities for internships and workshops with visiting companies.
  • State wide labor resource development in this industry.
  • Job opportunities for development studios and aspirant candidates.

Expo benefits:

  • Improve tourism in Mexicali.
  • Improve business for hotels and restaurants.
  • Promote commerce for local businesses and companies.
  • International promotion of the City of Mexicali as a host of important, innovative and attractive events.
  • Promotion of culture and art.

TESTIMONIES OF PARTICIPATING COMPANIES

"…Wanted to reach out to you and everyone who worked so hard to make Gamacon as successful as it was… was one of the most eye opening experience I’ve ever had at a convention… you have a really talented group of people working for you… I can’t wait to see Gamacon and the gaming industry grow in Mexico!.." – Britanni Johnson, Actress – “Guardian Angel, Borderland series”

"… This event is of great importance and of high impact to the community, since besides offering entertainment, it offers the possibility to the community to hear experiences from important personalities from the video games industry…it gives us the opportunity to show the products and works that our students have created…it let us, the academic institutes, to link our programs with the productive sector, letting us create alliances…we hope these type of events continue…” – Dania Licea, IT school dean – “CETYS Universidad”

"…We are very happy with the event this year since we gain better results…It really show considerable to be a bigger event and better organized…we had the chance to meet important personalities from the video games industry like Nolan Bushnell…We were able to increase our contacts network in all areas, universities, government and national and international studios…we were able to get 5 potential customers for mobile applications and create strategic alliances with local companies…we hope that with this type of events, the community, the younglings, the universities and the Government, start looking at this industry that is a millionaire in foreign countries, and that we still haven’t started taking advantage in Mexico…” – Kristoffer Ancona, CEO – “Dot Studio”

"…the event returned stronger than ever…all attendees can take something interesting from it regardless of their likes…this is something that makes GAMACON stand out of the others, as right there is a space to promote university majors in digital design or animation that might appeal to a large number of attendees…it’s very good to see how an event like this has so many perspectives even though it’s not located in a big metropolis…a very different experience…”  – Pamela Lima, co-editor – “Game Master Magazine”

"… you rocked and loved the event…I better stay in touch with you for future events…BRAVO!!!…glad it went so well!!!!" – Derek Maki (on behalf of Meghan Ashley, Marvel model), President – “Coolwaters Productions LLC”

"…Thanks again for your hospitality and a great (and memorable!) time in Mexicali!…I hope we can work together again sometime…All the best to you and your crew…" – Steve Downes, Actor – “Master Chief, Halo series”

"…many high praises for the excellent organization of GAMACON 2014…without doubt it positions our city on a national and international level…for our institution it’s a very important event…it was the perfect setting to promote our new major: Engineering in animation and visual effects…this event was one of our most important for promotion this year…GAMACON will be an invaluable ally for positioning our institution, turning into the most important meeting place for talent in our country…” – Juan Jesús Algravéz, Rector – “Universidad Politécnica de Baja California”

“…Mexico is rich with creativity and we would love to see more game developers emerge from the BC region… Now that we know first hand what the city of Mexicali is looking to achieve (along with the state of Baja California) we can now address each group with a better understanding of the end goal(s)…” – Joe Santos, sales manager at “Unity Technologies”

“…The business meetings in a smaller circle as part of the event proved very interesting and productive… I am looking forward to more connections during the next Gamacon… we would like to come back next year with a bigger team…” – Jochen Siess, general manager at “Slang”

“…For us it was a very interesting experience in regards to what is going on with the video games and software development industry in Baja California…the most important added value of Gamacon is the networking we were able to obtain with the different participants…I congratulate your organization and thank you for the time you and your team gave us…I’m looking forward to continue collaborating with you in the future…” – Alejandro Torres, sales director at “Nvidia Mexico”

“…I have been to many places to give conferences or place a booth, and this has to be one of the best experiences that I have had in the almost 5 years I’ve been at full time within this industry…” – Hugo Juarez, co-editor at “Game Master Magazine”

“…I’ve already talked to the people at the magazine offices of the potential of Gamacon and we’re very interested in continuing with everything you have in the future…” – Daniel Idelson, marketing manager at “Game Master Magazine”

“…today I believe this is one of the most important events of the country…it gave me the opportunity to make networking with important people of the industry…I would like to come back next year to Gamacon and have a bigger booth…” – Ricardo Villareal, CEO at “Xibalba Studios”

“…we believe this is a great initiative to boost the video games development industry in Mexico…it helped us understand the market a little more and how it works, as well as make networking with contacts that will help our company grow, which we just recently opened…” – Kristoffer Ancona, CEO at “Dot Studio”

“…Gamacon was a great event for all those companies that are looking for new business opportunities…” – Arturo Jauregui, producer at “Lapis Lazuli”

MILESTONES        

 $18,000          Goal

 $45,000          Nolan Bushnell, founder of Atari attends Gamacon!
story_txt:
My name is Hugo Castro, I am the person responsible for bringing a bunch of people together in 2007 to start working in a videogames expo, that with the years would become one of the most important videogames initiatives of Mexico.In a nut shell, GAMACON was created to boost the video games, animation and creative media development industry in the State of Baja California. It’s more than just an entertainment expo; it has an agenda that covers the educational needs and economic development of the industry that now helps different regions of Mexico as well.We work all year to create these opportunities (some of us volunteering for free, and some of us pro-bono). And once a year, we have our annual event that consists of 5 sub-events:
Business meeting
Symposium (Conferences and workshops)
Startup Weekend (Hackathon)
Expo
Videogames music concert with a symphony orchestra
This year we have our annual event on Nov 4-6, 2016, in Mexicali, Baja California, Mexico, at the Convention Center of the Centro Estatal de las Artes. And we certainly need your support. This is an event that is partly funded by the Federal Government, but only enough to cover 50% of the cost. And with the current exchange rate of the dollar vs the peso, this only make things a little harder for us to cover everything.Before moving on to the details of the event, I would like to tell you a story, it’s a little long, but it’s totally worth to stick to the end, so you could appreciate why we do this, why every year we work to create opportunities for students, and Mexican development companies, why we put so much passion, heart and soul into this initiative.I'm often asked what one of the most relevant stories of Gamacon is. There are two really good stories, but for now, I will stick with only one, which I believe has had the most impact on me personally. The first Gamacon expo was created in March 2008, and for the gala closing event, we did a very famous videogames music concert the first time in Mexico that we will call SFVMC (some famous videogames music concert). So many things went wrong, my team and I weren't ready for a 1000 people expo, and the complicated music concert that was SFVMC.Financially, I lost a lot of money. My two passions together in one event: Music and Videogames. I didn’t want to know anything about them; I didn’t want to know anything about Gamacon. But for the people that attended, they were really impressed with the expo, and thanks to the support of the SFVMC production team, the concert was mind blowing for them. They didn’t know everything that went wrong.At the end of the concert one of the co-creator of SFVMC wanted to talk to me, and asked me why so many things went wrong. I humbly said that we were only a group of friends that wanted to make a great videogames expo, and ended up lacking the experience to deliver what we needed, that we failed. Strangely he replied that he didn’t see it that way, that he believed we did a great job. He continued saying that every show he goes to, the staff is more than 50 people, and we were only 7 for the expo and the concert. He said: “How did you guys do it? It’s incredible. Yes, many things were wrong, but you have a great team.” ”I would have never thought of doing a show in Mexicali, since it’s not a huge metropolis”. And I asked, then why did you come? He replied that the way I spoke to him about what we wanted to achieved, how we wanted to create the opportunities that we didn’t have when we were younger to create videogames as a living, how we wanted Mexico to be an important pillar in the videogames industry, the passion with which I described every detail of the project, made him believed that one day Gamacon would be one of the most important videogames expo in Mexico, and that he wanted to be part of the beginning of it. He finished by saying: “The videogames industry couldn’t be in better hands than yours.” At that precise moment, I loved music and videogames again. And I said to myself that my team and I would learn from our mistakes and continue with Gamacon!Fast forward to 2016, Gamacon today is an initiative that is supported by the Mexican Federal Government, an initiative that has been adopted by the Baja California State Government, the IT cluster, the private sector and the state Universities. It’s an initiative that welcomes nearly 4500 people, development studios from different parts of the world and Mexican development studios from different states of Mexico, that helps hundreds of Universities students following their dream of making videogames. We have achieved so much and created many opportunities in the past years, but we’re just getting started and we need your support to create and achieve more!!!Linked to the Baja California IT Cluster, the Secretariat of Economy, ProMexico, ProSoft, the Mexican Association of Information Technologies Industry, the Convention and Tourism Committee, educational institutes, and the private sector, we converge all the activities related to video games and unified all efforts, planning and coordinating them to reach a common goal. INDUSTRY INSIGHTSConferences and workshops targeted at University students and current developers alike put them on the path to success.Gamacon provides the opportunity for the audience to hear professionals’ experiences, learning about trends and identify opportunities within this industry.We are expecting about 900 students this year to take advantages of the different conferences and workshops that we’re preparing for them.Here’s a list of our confirmed speakers: Alex Gonzalez – Entrepreneur/Author“Entrepreneurship: Follow your dreams” Roy Wooley – Visual effects expert“From a though to reality, the creative process” Richie Bisso – CTO Hyperkinetics Studios“The creativity behind decision making” Luis Fernando Martinez – Mexico country manager Razer USA Ltd“From a Startup to a solid and self-sustainable company” Kiyoshi Tsuru – ESA Mexico representative TMI Law“The videogames industry in Mexico as a business” Gabriel Reyes – CEO iDigital“What goes with creating an idea?” Rob GilesRitter & Jessie Cano – CEO & Studio Manager Haiku Studio“The creative process to produce an indie videogame” Harish Rao – Executive producer Monster VR“VR/AR creative process in indie development” Luis Daniel Ramirez – Voice Actor LolaMx“Localization services: a sustainable business in Mexico” Yoshitomo Moriwaki – CCO Hyperkinetic Studios“The different ways you can be a game designer in the video games industry” More to come….but we need your support! EXPO - story:
Short Summary

My name is Karen Turner and I have been running amateur and pro racquetball events for 15 years.  I want to promote the sport in general and increase women's participation.  One way to do that is to showcase the amazing women of the LPRT - the Ladies Professional Racquetball Tour.  They are amazing athletes and an inspiration to all players.

Prize money for a major event such as this one is $12,000.  We have some wonderful local sponsors, but with the economy affecting everyone, we need more help!  

I am just a woman trying to bring an exciting sporting event to northern Virginia.  I don't have any corporate backing - all aspects of the tournament are run by volunteers.  I am not seeking money for myself.  All money raised will go toward the tournament - the more we raise, the better the experience for everyone!

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking enough money to cover the pro prize money.  That is $12,000.  The other tournament expenses are covered by players' entry fees.  Whatever money we raise will go toward the prize money, regardless of whether I reach the goal or not.  If we get extra, then I can do more for the 100+ players we expect to play that weekend.  

If you donate at least $100, you'll get a tournament shirt (very nice dry-fit); if you donate $500, you will be recognized in all of our promotional materials - if you have a company logo, we'll put it on the posters and shirts.  Plus, if you are local, you will be invited to our sponsor party to meet the players and get a chance to play with them if you'd like, and front row viewing seats all weekend.  If you donate at least 1/2 the goal, we'll name the tournament in your honor (or your company's) - you'll be the title sponsor.  

    The Impact

    This is the 8th year the lady pros are coming to this tournament.  We have been running this tournament for over 20 years now.  It is an annual Christmas season tradition.  

    You will be helping a team of volunteers run the best tournament we possibly can without struggling, as we have in past years, with actually being able to afford it.

    This tournament will go on no matter how much we raise.  In the past, I have "bridged the gap" if we are short funds with my own, personal money.  I have invested countless hours and much financing into these tournaments, because it is my passion.  

    With your help, the financial aspects of the tournament will be one less thing to worry about to ensure success.  

    Do you love racquetball?  Do you like supporting small, individual efforts?  If so, this is the campaign for you! 

    Risks & Challenges

    My risk every year is that I won't raise enough outside money to cover costs.  If those costs aren't covered, the money comes out of my pocket.  I am just a regular person with a regular job.  I am not rich, I don't have thousands of dollars to give; nonetheless, I have done so in the past, and I would do so again.  

    The tournament will go on regardless - but any money I raise will greatly reduce my financial burden.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please get the word out:  If you know others who play racquetball or live in the northern VA area, let them know about our campaign.  We also need food sponsors, someone to make trophies, other giveaways for the players, etc.  If you can help in a non-monetary way, we'd love to hear your ideas!
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Karen Turner and I have been running amateur and pro racquetball events for 15 years.  I want to promote the sport in general and increase women's participation.  One way to do that is to showcase the amazing women of the LPRT - the Ladies Professional Racquetball Tour.  They are amazing athletes and an inspiration to all players.
Prize money for a major event such as this one is $12,000.  We have some wonderful local sponsors, but with the economy affecting everyone, we need more help!  
I am just a woman trying to bring an exciting sporting event to northern Virginia.  I don't have any corporate backing - all aspects of the tournament are run by volunteers.  I am not seeking money for myself.  All money raised will go toward the tournament - the more we raise, the better the experience for everyone!   What We Need & What You Get I am seeking enough money to cover the pro prize money.  That is $12,000.  The other tournament expenses are covered by players' entry fees.  Whatever money we raise will go toward the prize money, regardless of whether I reach the goal or not.  If we get extra, then I can do more for the 100+ players we expect to play that weekend.  
If you donate at least $100, you'll get a tournament shirt (very nice dry-fit); if you donate $500, you will be recognized in all of our promotional materials - if you have a company logo, we'll put it on the posters and shirts.  Plus, if you are local, you will be invited to our sponsor party to meet the players and get a chance to play with them if you'd like, and front row viewing seats all weekend.  If you donate at least 1/2 the goal, we'll name the tournament in your honor (or your company's) - you'll be the title sponsor.  

  The Impact This is the 8th year the lady pros are coming to this tournament.  We have been running this tournament for over 20 years now.  It is an annual Christmas season tradition.  
You will be helping a team of volunteers run the best tournament we possibly can without struggling, as we have in past years, with actually being able to afford it.
This tournament will go on no matter how much we raise.  In the past, I have "bridged the gap" if we are short funds with my own, personal money.  I have invested countless hours and much financing into these tournaments, because it is my passion.  
With your help, the financial aspects of the tournament will be one less thing to worry about to ensure success.  
Do you love racquetball?  Do you like supporting small, individual efforts?  If so, this is the campaign for you! 
  Risks & Challenges My risk every year is that I won't raise enough outside money to cover costs.  If those costs aren't covered, the money comes out of my pocket.  I am just a regular person with a regular job.  I am not rich, I don't have thousands of dollars to give; nonetheless, I have done so in the past, and I would do so again.  
The tournament will go on regardless - but any money I raise will greatly reduce my financial burden.

  Other Ways You Can Help Please get the word out:  If you know others who play racquetball or live in the northern VA area, let them know about our campaign.  We also need food sponsors, someone to make trophies, other giveaways for the players, etc.  If you can help in a non-monetary way, we'd love to hear your ideas!

story:
What is it?

It’s a card game where you match symbols on a card in your hand with symbols on a placed card on the table (or chair or rock or lawn or friends back or space shuttle or wherever you’re playing). The more symbols from your card that you can match with the symbols on the placed card, the more points you score.

The first person to score 21 wins.

Each card is made up of 1 to 3 symbols (square, triangle or circle).

What is it not?

It’s not a memory game. You don’t have to remember where any cards were placed. It’s just plain simple symbol matching. It’s easy!

Ok, explain to me in detail how it works.

The game has different variations of play depending on how difficult you want to make it.

We’ll start with the basic play which is the easiest way of playing it.

A game consists of a deck of 39 playing cards (standard game) with 1, 2 or 3 symbols on it. The symbols are a combination of Triangles, Circles and Squares.

The Setup

To begin with, select a person who will deal the first round. This can be the youngest, the oldest, the tallest, the shortest, the one with most hair, the one with no hair or whatever you decide.

The dealer deals each player is 5 cards.

The rest of The Deck is placed face down between the players and the top card is turned over and placed next to the deck. This is called “The Pile”. The cards in The Pile are always face up.

The Game

The player to the left of the dealer starts by selecting a card from his hand, where as many symbols as possible match the top card in The Pile. For each symbol the player can match, he or she will score one point.

So if you match 1 symbol, you score one point, if you match two symbols you score 2 points and so on.

The selected card is placed face up on The Pile and the player pulls a new card from The Deck.

If a player is unable to place a card, they pull a card from the Deck and if they still can’t place a card, the turn goes to the next player.

A player who has more than 5 cards on his hand should not draw a new card from The Deck when they place a card on The Pile during their turn.


Here's an example:

The top card on The Pile has a triangle and two squares on it.

You look at the cards in your hand and see that you have a card with two squares and a circle on it. You can match the two squares on your card with the two squares on the top card of The Pile so you play that card. You score two points and take a new card from The Deck and it's the next players turn.

The next player has a card with  circle, a triangle and a square on it.
He plays that card and scores 2 points as he can match one circle and one square with the card.


Variations of Play:

Medium difficulty

A more difficult game would be if each player is dealt only 3 cards. The same rules apply as in the easier game, first player to reach 21 points win. However it's now more difficult to get a card with a matching symbol.

Hard difficulty

To make things even harder, deal only 2 cards to each player. Again the same rules apply, first to 21 points win.

Sudden Death Game

This is perhaps the quickest game and will appeal to some players looking for a quick fun game during a break. Each player is dealt 2 cards. There is no score limit in this game. However if you are unable to play a card from your hand, you're not allowed to take another card from The Deck. Instead it's the next players turn.

If that player is able to play a card, then you've lost. However if the next player is unable to play, the turn goes to the following player.

If all players are unable to play a card, the game ends and the person who has scored the most wins the game.

The Star Cards

Each deck also contains 3 star cards. one 1 star card,  one 2 stars card, and  one 3 stars card.

Players decide before starting the game whether or not they wish to play with the star cards.

These cards have special rules when played. A star card can be played at any time and does obviously not match any symbols in The Pile. The player who plays a Star Card, will automatically score the same amount of points as there are stars on the card.

The next player however, has to play a card with equal amount of symbols. So if a card with 2 stars is played, the next player has to play a card with only two symbols on it.

They also score no points for playing that card.


How far have we got?

Well all the card graphics is made (although we may change the colour brightness once we recieve the first test print). Tuck box graphics is all designed too.

We're currently vetting two different printers to see what quality and quantity they can produce. The game RRP etc. is calculated on the prices quoted from the two printers.

Both printers are well established and respected with a large customer base.

What will the money be used for?

Printing decks of cards! No seriously, that's what we will do for the money if we meet the target. Even if we only get 50 sponsors on here, we will still get 50 decks printed and send them out to you. We'd probably make a huge loss on that but such is life and that's why we're doing flexible funding for this.

What if you go over and above your funding?

We will print more decks! The funding we're asking for will allow us to print 500 decks and also includes the allowance for shipping world wide.

However, if we go well over an beyond our targets, we will bring forward our plans on a mobile version of the game.

Wait, what? A mobile version?

Yes, that's right. We have plans on making a mobile version of the game with 1 on 1 multiplayer game-play. The difference with the mobile version of the game is that it includes colour mode play which means you get extra points for matching a blue square with a blue square but only one point for matching a blue square with a non-blue square.

There's a whole bunch of opportunities for mobile games and we'd love to begin development on it as soon as possible. However that cost money and we've decided to take baby steps with this by developing the card game first to see if there's any interest in this.

Are there any risks involved?

There are always risks. It may turn out to be the biggest flop every and only one of you support us in the end. If we can't get 50 backers, then the money goes back to you. There's no point in us holding on to it. It will mean we lose money on this by paying it all back to you but that's our own fault then.

If I back you, will I get the game for Christmas?

We would love to say yes to this, but reality is that you won't get it. The end date for this project is end of November and then we need to wait 15 working days for the money raised to reach us. Then it all has to go to print so, realistically you're looking at a mid-January delivery of the first packs.

How can you help?

Back us and spread the word! Please! Even if you can't back us or don't want to back us, please spread the word about this project.
The more backers we get, the bigger the chance is that we can get this project off the table and in to the printers room.

story:
Hallo!

The english version of this text can you read below.

 

Wir sind Axel und Trang und sind beide Studenten aus Deutschland. Außerdem ist in unserem Team noch ein begabter, junger Manga Zeichner Patrick. Eines Abends kam uns eine Idee. Wir wollten ein Kartenspiel für Mädchen machen! (natürlich können es auch Jungs oder Erwachsene spielen)

 Das Produkt unseres Vorhabens nennt sich FAMY.

 Zunächst: was ist FAMY überhaupt?

 Wie schon erwähnt ist es ein Kartenspiel. Die Karten können im Laden gekauft und somit gesammelt werden. Ein Päckchen beinhaltet 6 Karten.

Thematisch handelt es sich dabei um Feen, die bestimmte Kräfte haben.

 

Und so sehen die ersten Entwürfe der Sammelkarten aus:

 

Warum sollte man Famy spielen?

 Im Zeichen der Gleichstellung-  FAMY soll eine Alternative zu den auf dem  Markt bereits erhältlichen Sammelkartenspielen wie Pokemon oder Yu-Gi-Oh darstellen. Wir sind selbst mit diesen Karten aufgewachsen. Dabei ist uns oft aufgefallen, dass kein Äquivalent für Mädchen auf dem Markt existiert.

Friedlich, aber nicht schwach- Die Feen haben bestimmte Kräfte. Einerseits können sie sich wehren mit ihren Attacken, andererseits stellen Feen auch friedliche Wesen dar. Kinder können sich oft nicht gegen bestimmte Sachen wehren oder fühlen sich nicht Ernst genommen. Wir wollen ihnen mit den Feen ein wenig Mut schenken.  Denn nur weil man Kind ist, heißt es nicht, dass man sich nicht wehren und eine eigene Stärke beweisen kann. FAMY will hierbei zu einer positiven Ermutigung dienen. 

 Was heißt hier „typisch Mädchen“? – FAMY stellt außerdem verschiedene Berufe dar. Fußballerinnen, Pilotinnen, Detektivinnen und viele weitere finden einen Platz in der Reihe der FAMY- Feen. Somit könnte es auch zu einer Förderung der Interessenerweiterung in einem frühen Stadium beitragen. Wir wollen einen kleinen Schritt zur Aufbrechung des sozialtypischen Konsens, was mädchen- oder jungenhaft ist, wagen. Helft uns!

 Strategie lernen- Neben den verschiedenen Darstellungen von Identitäten und Rollen im gesellschaftlichen Leben, lernt man hier in der spielerischen Interaktion die Fähigkeit zum strategischen Denken. Die Attacken der Feen haben jeweils einen Zahlenwert, der beim „ Gegner“ subtrahiert wird. Der Gegner kann dies ebenfalls tun. Somit lernt man, welche Attacke oder mit welcher Fee der nächsten Schritt im Spiel bestimmt wird. Auch wird hier vorrausschauendes Denken und empathisches Bewusstsein geschult. 

 Kreavität fördern – Da es 100 verschiedene Feen mit unterschiedlichen Charakteren und Berufen gibt und so eine relativ große Bandbreite an Erfahrungen und Variabilität gezeigt wird, kann dies zusätzlich die Kreativität der Kinder fördern. Sie werden erkennen, dass es nicht nur Dinge gibt, die sie aus dem Alltag bei sich zu Hause oder Schule kennen, sondern eine Welt mit Magie und gleichzeitig realen Bezügen. Dies könnte ein Beitrag sein, um den Horizont zu erweitern und die Motivation Eigenes und Neues zu schaffen.

Spaß!- Gerne erinnern wir uns daran, wie wir mit anderen durch diverse Spielkarten das Sammel- und Tauschfieber in uns entdeckten. In den Schulpausen oder zu Hause haben wir damit unsere Zeit verbracht und Freude daran gehabt. Das möchten wir nun auch an die Kinder weitergeben. Neben Computerspielen und Fernseheinflüssen, wollen wir mit FAMY wieder etwas Greifbares schaffen.

Warum brauchen wir eure Unterstützung?

 Wir sind beide Studenten, die etwas Eigenes schaffen wollen. Unsere Leidenschaft sind Sammelkarten und das Fieber und die Freude, die damit ausgelöst werden. Aber zwei Menschen können so ein großes Projekt nicht ganz alleine stemmen. Dabei kommt ihr ins Spiel!

Um ein eigenes neues Produkt auf dieser Welt zu etablieren benötigt es an Know How. Bürokratie und Markensicherung sind wichtige Stellen auf diesem Weg dahin.

Auch kann es sehr nützlich sein, eine große Masse an Menschen und hier vor allem Kinder zu erreichen. Helft uns, dass FAMY einen Platz in der Welt erhält! 

Wir brauchen euch.

Für eure freundliche Unterstützung erhaltet ihr selbstverständlich unsere Anerkennung, in dem ihr von uns ein kleines Geschenk bekommt.

 

Falls ihr uns nicht entgeltlich helfen könnt, dann teilt doch bitte diese Seite euren Freunden mit und geht auf unsere Webseite  www.famy.de.mg! Natürlich findet ihr uns auch bei Facebook :

www.facebook.com/famyfee

Und wer sich noch weitergehend für die Spielregeln interessiert, müsste jetzt weiterlesen!

 

Spielregeln

 Zwei Spieler

 Voraussetzung: Deck mit ca. 25 Feenkarten und ca. 15 Sonderkarten.

 Spielablauf

Es wird ein Stapel an Karten mit Feen und Sonderkarten gemacht. Der Stapel wird gut gemischt.

Jeder Spieler zieht je 6 Karten von dem Stapeln und definiert eine Fee, die kämpft.

Der Jüngste Spieler fängt an.

Man legt die Kampf-Fee in die Mitte des Tisches und sagt welcher Angriff gestartet werden soll.

Diese Punkte werden bei den Lebenspunkten der gegnerischen Fee abgezogen.

Dann ist der Gegner an der Reihe und macht dasselbe.

 Es dürfen max. drei Feen und zwei Sonderkarten eines Spielers zum Kampf auf dem Tisch liegen.

Dabei kann man nicht nur eine Karte bei einem Zug legen. Es dürfen max. 2 Karten gleichzeitig gelegt werden.

Eine vom Spieler festgelegte Fee, die zum kämpfen ausgewählt wurde, darf nicht mehr zurückgenommen werden. Diese muss bis sie keine Lebenspunkte mehr besitzt, im Spiel bleiben.

 Bevor jeder am Zug ist, muss derjenige 5 Karten auf der Hand haben. D.h. man muss die Anzahl ziehen, die einem noch zur vollständigen Anzahl von 5 Karten fehlt.

 Hat eine Fee keine Lebenspunkte mehr, so wird sie umgedreht auf einen Extrastapel gelegt. Diese kann nicht mehr verwendet werden.

Ende

Das Spiel endet sobald ein Spieler keine Feen mehr zum kämpfen bereitstellen kann. Der Gewinner ist der, der noch Feen zum Spielen hat.

www.famy.de.mg

facebook at
www.facebook.com/famyfee.

twitter
www.twitter.de/feefamy

 

Danke für eure Aufmerksamkeit!

 

Hello!

We are Axel and Trang and we are students from Germany. And we want to create a new card game, which can be collected.
A mount of fairies fill the magic world of FAMY!

Girls and boys ( and adults) are invited to play the new game!


First things first: What is Famy?

It is a game of cards which can be bought in selected stores. The cards are available in booster packs which contain 6 FAMY cards each which need to be collected by the player.

The cards depict different fairies and their specific powers

 

Here is a first version of how the cards are going to look like:

Why should you play FAMY?

In terms of equality- FAMY shall offer an alternative to already available card games like Pokemon and Yu-Gi-Oh. 
We grew up with these games ourselves and had to realize that there was nothing similar on the market that covers preferably girls` likes and dislikes.


Amicable, but not weak- All FAMY fairies have certain powers. They can protect themselves by using different attacks, but they are amicable and peaceful creatures by nature. Children/ Kids can feel helpless in certain situations and often have the impression that they are not being taken seriously. With our fairies we want to enhance their self-confidence.
Being a child does not mean that you cannot be brave and stand up for yourself. FAMY wants to positively influence this part of growing up.


What do you mean by "That`s so girly"?

FAMY depicts a variety of professions. Our fairies are for example soccer players, pilots and investigators. We want to contribute to the development of different interests in a young person neglecting stereotypes of what is considered to be typically "boyish" or "girly". Please help us with that!


Discover strategy- Next to learning about different roles and identities in social life, the player can also discover her or his ability to act and think strategically through playful interaction. Each attack of a fairy
is measured as a certain number which has to be subtracted from the "opponents`" fairy card. The opponent in return can do the same. This teaches the players how they can influence the outcome of the game with a certain attack or fairy.
FAMY helps that way to train creative and empathetic thinking.


Support creativity- The FAMY world contains 100 fairies with different characters and professions. The thus resulting scope of variety and experiences will promote creativity in childrens` development. They will discover a world of magic with realistic tendencies next to their daily routine at home and in school. This could contribute to widen their horizon and motivate them to create new things of their own.


Fun!- We like to look back at our own childhood where we discovered our own passion for collecting and trading cards with others.
We filled lunch breaks at school or free time at home with it and loved it. Now, we like to hand that over to our kids. Next to computer games and TV we want to offer with FAMY something "touchable" again.

 

Why do we need your support?

We are both students who want to create something on our own. Our passion are card games you can collect and the fun and "fiever" that is ignited by them. But two people by themselves cannot bring a project as big as this one to life on their own.
This is where you come into play.

It takes the right "know how" to establish a new product in this market. Burocracy and branding are important steps to take
to get there.

It is also important to reach a large amount of people, especially kids, to awaken their interest. Please help FAMY to get its place in this world.

We need you.

For your kind support you will of course receive a renumeration in form of a little present.


If you cannot help us out with money, please share this site with your friends and go to
www.famy.de.mg

facebook at
www.facebook.com/famyfee.

twitter
www.twitter.de/feefamy
