FAMY will hierbei zu einer positiven Ermutigung dienen. 
 Was heißt hier „typisch Mädchen“? – FAMY stellt außerdem verschiedene Berufe dar. Fußballerinnen, Pilotinnen, Detektivinnen und viele weitere finden einen Platz in der Reihe der FAMY- Feen. Somit könnte es auch zu einer Förderung der Interessenerweiterung in einem frühen Stadium beitragen. Wir wollen einen kleinen Schritt zur Aufbrechung des sozialtypischen Konsens, was mädchen- oder jungenhaft ist, wagen. Helft uns!
 Strategie lernen- Neben den verschiedenen Darstellungen von Identitäten und Rollen im gesellschaftlichen Leben, lernt man hier in der spielerischen Interaktion die Fähigkeit zum strategischen Denken. Die Attacken der Feen haben jeweils einen Zahlenwert, der beim „ Gegner“ subtrahiert wird. Der Gegner kann dies ebenfalls tun. Somit lernt man, welche Attacke oder mit welcher Fee der nächsten Schritt im Spiel bestimmt wird. Auch wird hier vorrausschauendes Denken und empathisches Bewusstsein geschult. 
 Kreavität fördern – Da es 100 verschiedene Feen mit unterschiedlichen Charakteren und Berufen gibt und so eine relativ große Bandbreite an Erfahrungen und Variabilität gezeigt wird, kann dies zusätzlich die Kreativität der Kinder fördern. Sie werden erkennen, dass es nicht nur Dinge gibt, die sie aus dem Alltag bei sich zu Hause oder Schule kennen, sondern eine Welt mit Magie und gleichzeitig realen Bezügen. Dies könnte ein Beitrag sein, um den Horizont zu erweitern und die Motivation Eigenes und Neues zu schaffen.
Spaß!- Gerne erinnern wir uns daran, wie wir mit anderen durch diverse Spielkarten das Sammel- und Tauschfieber in uns entdeckten. In den Schulpausen oder zu Hause haben wir damit unsere Zeit verbracht und Freude daran gehabt. Das möchten wir nun auch an die Kinder weitergeben. Neben Computerspielen und Fernseheinflüssen, wollen wir mit FAMY wieder etwas Greifbares schaffen.
Warum brauchen wir eure Unterstützung?
 Wir sind beide Studenten, die etwas Eigenes schaffen wollen. Unsere Leidenschaft sind Sammelkarten und das Fieber und die Freude, die damit ausgelöst werden. Aber zwei Menschen können so ein großes Projekt nicht ganz alleine stemmen. Dabei kommt ihr ins Spiel!
Um ein eigenes neues Produkt auf dieser Welt zu etablieren benötigt es an Know How. Bürokratie und Markensicherung sind wichtige Stellen auf diesem Weg dahin.
Auch kann es sehr nützlich sein, eine große Masse an Menschen und hier vor allem Kinder zu erreichen. Helft uns, dass FAMY einen Platz in der Welt erhält! 
Wir brauchen euch.
Für eure freundliche Unterstützung erhaltet ihr selbstverständlich unsere Anerkennung, in dem ihr von uns ein kleines Geschenk bekommt.
 
Falls ihr uns nicht entgeltlich helfen könnt, dann teilt doch bitte diese Seite euren Freunden mit und geht auf unsere Webseite  www.famy.de.mg! Natürlich findet ihr uns auch bei Facebook :
www.facebook.com/famyfee
Und wer sich noch weitergehend für die Spielregeln interessiert, müsste jetzt weiterlesen!
 
Spielregeln
 Zwei Spieler
 Voraussetzung: Deck mit ca. 25 Feenkarten und ca. 15 Sonderkarten.
 Spielablauf
Es wird ein Stapel an Karten mit Feen und Sonderkarten gemacht. Der Stapel wird gut gemischt.
Jeder Spieler zieht je 6 Karten von dem Stapeln und definiert eine Fee, die kämpft.
Der Jüngste Spieler fängt an.
Man legt die Kampf-Fee in die Mitte des Tisches und sagt welcher Angriff gestartet werden soll.
Diese Punkte werden bei den Lebenspunkten der gegnerischen Fee abgezogen.
Dann ist der Gegner an der Reihe und macht dasselbe.
 Es dürfen max. drei Feen und zwei Sonderkarten eines Spielers zum Kampf auf dem Tisch liegen.
Dabei kann man nicht nur eine Karte bei einem Zug legen. Es dürfen max. 2 Karten gleichzeitig gelegt werden.
Eine vom Spieler festgelegte Fee, die zum kämpfen ausgewählt wurde, darf nicht mehr zurückgenommen werden. Diese muss bis sie keine Lebenspunkte mehr besitzt, im Spiel bleiben.
 Bevor jeder am Zug ist, muss derjenige 5 Karten auf der Hand haben. D.h. man muss die Anzahl ziehen, die einem noch zur vollständigen Anzahl von 5 Karten fehlt.
 Hat eine Fee keine Lebenspunkte mehr, so wird sie umgedreht auf einen Extrastapel gelegt. Diese kann nicht mehr verwendet werden.
Ende
Das Spiel endet sobald ein Spieler keine Feen mehr zum kämpfen bereitstellen kann. Der Gewinner ist der, der noch Feen zum Spielen hat.
www.famy.de.mg
facebook atwww.facebook.com/famyfee.
twitterwww.twitter.de/feefamy
 
Danke für eure Aufmerksamkeit!
 
Hello!
We are Axel and Trang and we are students from Germany. And we want to create a new card game, which can be collected.A mount of fairies fill the magic world of FAMY!
Girls and boys ( and adults) are invited to play the new game!
First things first: What is Famy?
It is a game of cards which can be bought in selected stores. The cards are available in booster packs which contain 6 FAMY cards each which need to be collected by the player.
The cards depict different fairies and their specific powers
 
Here is a first version of how the cards are going to look like:

Why should you play FAMY?
In terms of equality- FAMY shall offer an alternative to already available card games like Pokemon and Yu-Gi-Oh. We grew up with these games ourselves and had to realize that there was nothing similar on the market that covers preferably girls` likes and dislikes.
Amicable, but not weak- All FAMY fairies have certain powers. They can protect themselves by using different attacks, but they are amicable and peaceful creatures by nature. Children/ Kids can feel helpless in certain situations and often have the impression that they are not being taken seriously. With our fairies we want to enhance their self-confidence.Being a child does not mean that you cannot be brave and stand up for yourself. FAMY wants to positively influence this part of growing up.
What do you mean by "That`s so girly"?
FAMY depicts a variety of professions. Our fairies are for example soccer players, pilots and investigators. We want to contribute to the development of different interests in a young person neglecting stereotypes of what is considered to be typically "boyish" or "girly". Please help us with that!
Discover strategy- Next to learning about different roles and identities in social life, the player can also discover her or his ability to act and think strategically through playful interaction. Each attack of a fairyis measured as a certain number which has to be subtracted from the "opponents`" fairy card. The opponent in return can do the same. This teaches the players how they can influence the outcome of the game with a certain attack or fairy.FAMY helps that way to train creative and empathetic thinking.
Support creativity- The FAMY world contains 100 fairies with different characters and professions. The thus resulting scope of variety and experiences will promote creativity in childrens` development. They will discover a world of magic with realistic tendencies next to their daily routine at home and in school. This could contribute to widen their horizon and motivate them to create new things of their own.
Fun!- We like to look back at our own childhood where we discovered our own passion for collecting and trading cards with others.We filled lunch breaks at school or free time at home with it and loved it. Now, we like to hand that over to our kids. Next to computer games and TV we want to offer with FAMY something "touchable" again.
 
Why do we need your support?
We are both students who want to create something on our own. Our passion are card games you can collect and the fun and "fiever" that is ignited by them. But two people by themselves cannot bring a project as big as this one to life on their own.This is where you come into play.
It takes the right "know how" to establish a new product in this market. Burocracy and branding are important steps to taketo get there.
It is also important to reach a large amount of people, especially kids, to awaken their interest. Please help FAMY to get its place in this world.
We need you.
For your kind support you will of course receive a renumeration in form of a little present.
If you cannot help us out with money, please share this site with your friends and go towww.famy.de.mg
facebook atwww.facebook.com/famyfee.
twitterwww.twitter.de/feefamy

story:
Hi, my name is Kenneth. 

Some of you may know me from my Youtube Channel or my Instagram, but enough about me, lets get to the reason why you're here. Isometric Playing Cards.

I have been developing this deck over the past year and a half, and have finally decided to release them to the public.


(If you can't see anything above this wait for the pictures to load!)

PLEASE REMEMBER TO ADD SHIPPING. I WILL NOT BE ABLE TO GET YOUR DECKS TO YOU IF YOU FORGET.


Risks & Challenges

To be able to make these decks, I need to raise $4,500. This is a fixed funding campaign. If the goal of $4,500 is not met within 30 days, I won't be able to print the Isometric Playing Cards. The upside though, is that you will be refunded after the 30 day period.

Managing this whole campaign will be a challenge for me though. This is my first indiegogo campaign and I'm pretty much a one man company. I will however, be dedicating a ton of my time to this, and will be constantly updating you on this campaign. 

In addition, I will be enlisting the help of the Legends Playing Card Company's fulfilment services, meaning that once the decks are printed, shipping should be a breeze.

Any other way I can help?

Even if you don't want to contribute cash to this campaign, it would be amazing if you could help me spread the word! Click the share button on this page to get the word out to everyone. It would be a dream come true to see people using these.

Thanks for making my dream come true!

Much love,

Kenneth Aidan Foo


READ ME: Shipping is not free to any location. Remember to add your shipping in or I will not be able to ship your cards to you. :(


Frequently Asked Questions

Can I add on decks?
Yup! Just follow the table below to add on the cost of the decks to the Perk+Shipping. 

For example, if I want to buy 9 decks and I live in Australia, I will select the Perk for 6 Decks, ($60) then add the shipping cost for 6 decks ($15), and the cost of 3 decks from the table above ($36) = $111

What stock/finish are these cards?
The Isometric Playing Cards are made with Legends Playing Cards Emerald Finish. If you have handled a Legends deck before, you know that they put a ton of detail and attention into these cards. The Emerald Finish has a great snap and thickness, while not making the cards too thick.

These cards look very similar to another deck.
It is true that they look similar to another deck on the market at the moment, However, the design is inspired by something completely different, and I feel that there aren't a lot of cons to having more decks designed for cardistry on the market.

Will this deck have custom faces?
Nope! While one of the prototypes had custom faces, I felt that the design was lacking, (seeing as I am not really a designer) and also felt that classic faces would be more familiar and useful for magicians and laypeople. So I decided against the use of custom faces!

There will be a custom Ace of Spades and Jokers though!

Will these be limited edition?/What is the print run of this deck?
The deck will be a limited edition in a sense. I will only print as much as the fund raising permits me. The fund raising is based on a 1,000 print run. If there is a demand for more than 1,000 decks, I'll print that many. After that amount is printed, I will not be printing any more of these decks. So get them while you still can!

story:
Sign Up - http://www.whatupbridge.com/

 

The Problem

As much as 30 minutes per day is wasted by millions of commuters stuck in traffic due to infrastructure. WhatUpBridge solves this problem by providing proactive alerts and tracking information for the movable infrastructure that may affect your commute. There is currently no major effort to gather or disseminate this data and our vision for WhatUpBridge is to be the data source for the status of critical infrastructure in the US and abroad.

 

The lack of insight into the status of our infrastructure causes easily avoidable traffic congestion. This problem costs commuters in wasted gas which leads to excessive emissions, employers in lost productivity, and municipalities in lower quality of life for residents. In Miami alone, there is an average of 16,000 commuters per bridge affected every day by busy drawbridges. There are 21 bridges in Miami, New York has an average of 20,000 commuters per bridge with 25 bridges, and Chicago has 43 bridges. That result is over 1.3 million displaced commuters, 650k hours of additional traffic, and millions of dollars in wasted gas and lost business.

 

 

What we do, Who we are

We are a company based in Florida that spawn from Hackday Miami in 2011. We won the competition and sponsor prize with our solution which was featured in The Miami Herald. Miami has an issue with the many draw bridges and commuters in our city. As we are a city of waterways and boaters, each day hours of peoples time are wasted waiting for drawbridges to close and allow people to continue on to their destination.

Our solution is simple. Provide the commuter with a notification of a Draw bridges status based on their schedule and selected bridge. If a bridge that you have a schedule for changes status during your set day and time. We will send you a PUSH notification, Text message and/or email to notify you.

We collect the data on the status of bridges via two methods.

1) We are applying for permits to install the sensors we have developed to communicate with our servers, notifying us as to the status of the bridge.

2) We provide a means of feedback thru the mobile application which allows us to collect crowd sourced information as to the status of the bridge.

With these two sources combined we are able to send quality notifications to users.


What makes us unique

We have been approved by the various entities that oversee our bridge and tunnel infrastructure. The US Coast guard, Florida Drawbridge, The Miami Downtown Development Authority, The Miami River commission and the residents of Miami are all behind us to implement our solution.

 

What we need and what you get

We need $20K to bring WhatUpBridge Mobile to initial release. The money will be used to fund full-time development by me, Erik Ebright, and Miami Mobile Developers.

This will allow me to bring WhatUpBridge Mobile to a production-grade 1.0 release from it's current development stage. The money will go purely to covering expenses during that time, as well as rewards for you, our supporters.

 

Shirts ship free

Backer T-Shirts will be shipping for free to our backers whom choose such perk.

 

 

Please share this project on your blog, Facebook, and Twitter! Tell your friends if you have backed this concept, and encourage them to do the same. 

Sign-Up  - http://www.whatupbridge.com/

 

Press

http://www.miamiherald.com/2011/11/10/2499705/hackers-race-to-use-power-for.html

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/craig-agranoff/the-growing-tech-scene-in_b_1123111.html?

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m0gOr5PDt6E

story:
What are you asking for? What is it you are doing?

Simply put, I’m asking for $1,650 to bring a character from initial concept right though to the point where he can be put into production as a collector’s miniature. What follows is a rundown of the character, the line who I am and where we are as of 16-Nov-2012.

 

Who is Cambric?

Our first miniature and the focus of this campaign is Cambric Goayin. He is an itinerant Jurist, an adventuring but practical scholar of the law. Since achieving his confirmation over 10 years ago he has travelled the Archipelago by both land and sea lending his expertise to all those in need regardless of station. He inspects the punishment logs of both ships and settlements he visits to ensure that the Maritime laws that govern the island nations are not applied harshly or indeed to lightly.

As an experienced traveller he has learned the hard way what he require on his journeys and carries everything on his person so as not to be a burden to his companions. A scholar more than a warrior he wears no armour but does carry a number of weapons including his large executioners blade. The sword, as much as a symbol of his office as his red coat, has a weight that moves along the blade with each swing lending each stroke fearsome power

The concept of the itinerant jurist is strongly based on the roaming Brehon judges of Irish history specifically between the 7th century when the orals laws of Ireland where written down for first time…

What is the Haar Miniature Line?

The Haar miniature line will contain heroes, villains, beasts and monsters from our Kharybdis Archipelago setting.  The theme of this world is Woodpunk i.e. Steampunk without the steam. It is a setting recovering from a significant war with many opportunities for those souls brave enough to seize them.  We have 36 concepts currently detailed in three series of 12 and artwork for the first series is already underway. Obviously this will take a number of years to get through just those we have planned at this stage.

All of the miniatures within the Haar line will be limited run with a number between 200 and 700 which will depend on the miniature and their associated costs. Once they are gone they are well… gone. I should emphasize that the final product is not just “a nice miniature” we’re aiming for a type of character pack including the miniature, base, concept art, setting cards, details about the characters back story etc… there will be a lot crammed into each one. We’re also currently looking into the legality of including pre-filled digital character sheets for popular RPGs, though this is currently outside the scope of the campaign.

The target markets for this line are global thanks to eCommerce. The miniatures themselves will be Heroic 28 to 30mm in scale and as such gamers will be able to use them in most games whether they are RPGs, board games or wargames.  I should also say that I am developing a board game within the same setting and players with any of the Haar miniatures can use them in the game, though they do not need to have them to enjoy it.

Who are you?

I’m Darren Barber a long time gamer based in Edinburgh Scotland. For the past 3 years I have been operating Pyre Studios, as a sole trader, a small online retail venture and painting service. I have made the difficult decision to shut down the retail part of the company and transition into the manufacture of my own products. Prior to this I spent 19 years as a project manager within the IT and telecoms sector for some well known multinationals.  

In terms of experience in the manufacture of miniatures and associated products I have none, zip …  nil. I do have close contacts with the manufactures whose products I stocked and they have been very generous with their advice and counsel. While this is a big step for me I feel that it is an informed one. I have already received feedback and constructive criticism on the ideas for this project and I really feel that it’s a go-er.

How the money will be spent

Below is a brief breakdown of where the funds will go. Effectively I’m looking to get to a position where the first miniature can be cast. I have a great imagination but no artistic flair (something that constantly frustrates me!) so I have to use far more talented contractors to realize my ideas. In order the money will be spent on;

  1. $550: Concepts, art and packaging design
  2. $700: Master miniature sculpt
  3. $100: Resin master print (2)
  4. $300: Mould creation (est)

Points 1 and 2 are hard costs i.e. I have been quoted, accepted and committed to them. Point 3 is for 2 master prints of the sculpt  and this is really a form of risk mitigation as things never go smoothly and my previous experience in retail gave me an insight into how often things get lost or damaged in the post. Point 4 is an estimate for the casting costs based on advice from other manufacturers and early quotes from casters

Current Status

As mentioned I have 36 character descriptions accompanied by my own rather “unique” stick figure art. rather than rest on my laurels I have done the following;

I have commissioned the character concept for Cambric together with character sketches for the ten characters and 2 monsters in  the first Haar series. The ludicrously talented Carlos Cara has done a phenomenal job in capturing the core of each character from sketch to final concept. As these are character studies they do not represent the final pose of the miniatures.

Olivier Nkweti, the sculptor for Cambric has done a fantastic job of bringing the miniatures character to life and completed the sculpt on the 14th of December. Olivier is grossly tallented and has previously worked for Rakham, Upperdeck, Privateerpress, Wryd, Infinity, CMON and Dark-Age to name just a few...

I have approached several other sculptors at the time of writing this to establish a schedule and wow, are they ever busy people? Two further sculptors have expressed an interest and given a rough schedule of when they are available. More details as they are confirmed

The process of identifying a casting company continues…

While all of this is ongoing I have been continuing to flesh out the setting, its cultures and history, I hope to begin commissioning pieces of setting art early in 2013.

What will you do if you exceed your funding target?

Well firstly let’s not jinx it! Secondly while this campaign will be specifically used for Cambric he is just the first in an ongoing line of miniatures. Any additional funds, after potential stretch goals, will be fed directly into that progamme.

The Kharybdis Archipelago setting lends itself to all forms of gaming so developing the context for the Haar line in conjunction with the miniatures seems like the right thing to do.

What will you do if you do not meet your funding target?

Honestly? All of the above but over a much longer timescale. I am committed to this range of products and its setting.

Stretch Goals:

There are 12 miniatures sketched out for Haar Series 1. Being more realistic perhaps I've outlined the first three stretch goals beyond the funding for Cambric. Let's not get too far ahead of ourselves...

$3000: Haar 1-2: Sicilaine:The next character, Sicilaine: Lady of Waves and Rain, member of the 9 Mother Council, will be included in with the $15 & $22 perks. New sketches and concept art will be commissioned alongside the sculpt. A separate painted perk will be added for her ladyship:
Estimated delivery February/March 2013

$4500: Haar 1-3: Tenril Mornen: The third character, Tenril Mornen: Seeker of the Aeryil and hero of Daur Fast. Tenril will be included in with the $15 & $22 perks. New sketches and concept art will be commissioned alongside the sculpt. A separate painted perk will be added for this world weary warrior.
Estimated delivery February/March 2013

$5500: Genre Pack #1: Steampunk. This pack of 12 accessories with a steam punk feel will be added to the $22 & £40 perks. Comprising of ranged and melee weapons and odd looking pieces of equipment this pack will allow you to bring any of the Haar miniatures, or any others for that matter, into your steampunk themed games.
Estimated delivery March 2013

we have other Genre Packs in the works such as high fantasy and arcane-tech or magi-tech. Each will comprise of two sets of between 6 and 8 unique pieces.

Risks

The campaign does not meet its goals

Yeah this is a genuine concern given a) the time of year and b) the economic climate. It is a relatively small amount of funding required for the first miniature and there is a proven market for such product. That said though I think a weather eye will need to be kept on the campaign to pilot it to success.

Increase in costs

At this stage the true cost for a caster has yet to be pinned down but I have used an average of market prices given to me by several other manufacturers and included a 20% contingency. As soon as I pin down the cost I will update the campaign.

Unexpected delays due to use of contractors

Yes, certainly a risk given the nature of the beast. A strong communication plan and regular updates should help with this one. Any changes to delivery dates will be posted on the campaign as soon as they are confirmed.
story_txt:
What are you asking for? What is it you are doing?
Simply put, I’m asking for $1,650 to bring a character from initial concept right though to the point where he can be put into production as a collector’s miniature. What follows is a rundown of the character, the line who I am and where we are as of 16-Nov-2012.

 
Who is Cambric?
Our first miniature and the focus of this campaign is Cambric Goayin. He is an itinerant Jurist, an adventuring but practical scholar of the law. Since achieving his confirmation over 10 years ago he has travelled the Archipelago by both land and sea lending his expertise to all those in need regardless of station. He inspects the punishment logs of both ships and settlements he visits to ensure that the Maritime laws that govern the island nations are not applied harshly or indeed to lightly.
As an experienced traveller he has learned the hard way what he require on his journeys and carries everything on his person so as not to be a burden to his companions. A scholar more than a warrior he wears no armour but does carry a number of weapons including his large executioners blade. The sword, as much as a symbol of his office as his red coat, has a weight that moves along the blade with each swing lending each stroke fearsome power
The concept of the itinerant jurist is strongly based on the roaming Brehon judges of Irish history specifically between the 7th century when the orals laws of Ireland where written down for first time…
What is the Haar Miniature Line?
The Haar miniature line will contain heroes, villains, beasts and monsters from our Kharybdis Archipelago setting.  The theme of this world is Woodpunk i.e. Steampunk without the steam. It is a setting recovering from a significant war with many opportunities for those souls brave enough to seize them.  We have 36 concepts currently detailed in three series of 12 and artwork for the first series is already underway. Obviously this will take a number of years to get through just those we have planned at this stage.
All of the miniatures within the Haar line will be limited run with a number between 200 and 700 which will depend on the miniature and their associated costs. Once they are gone they are well… gone. I should emphasize that the final product is not just “a nice miniature” we’re aiming for a type of character pack including the miniature, base, concept art, setting cards, details about the characters back story etc… there will be a lot crammed into each one. We’re also currently looking into the legality of including pre-filled digital character sheets for popular RPGs, though this is currently outside the scope of the campaign.
The target markets for this line are global thanks to eCommerce. The miniatures themselves will be Heroic 28 to 30mm in scale and as such gamers will be able to use them in most games whether they are RPGs, board games or wargames.  I should also say that I am developing a board game within the same setting and players with any of the Haar miniatures can use them in the game, though they do not need to have them to enjoy it.

Who are you?
I’m Darren Barber a long time gamer based in Edinburgh Scotland. For the past 3 years I have been operating Pyre Studios, as a sole trader, a small online retail venture and painting service. I have made the difficult decision to shut down the retail part of the company and transition into the manufacture of my own products. Prior to this I spent 19 years as a project manager within the IT and telecoms sector for some well known multinationals.  
In terms of experience in the manufacture of miniatures and associated products I have none, zip …  nil. I do have close contacts with the manufactures whose products I stocked and they have been very generous with their advice and counsel. While this is a big step for me I feel that it is an informed one. I have already received feedback and constructive criticism on the ideas for this project and I really feel that it’s a go-er.
How the money will be spent
Below is a brief breakdown of where the funds will go. Effectively I’m looking to get to a position where the first miniature can be cast. I have a great imagination but no artistic flair (something that constantly frustrates me!) so I have to use far more talented contractors to realize my ideas. In order the money will be spent on;

$550: Concepts, art and packaging design
$700: Master miniature sculpt
$100: Resin master print (2)
$300: Mould creation (est)
Points 1 and 2 are hard costs i.e. I have been quoted, accepted and committed to them. Point 3 is for 2 master prints of the sculpt  and this is really a form of risk mitigation as things never go smoothly and my previous experience in retail gave me an insight into how often things get lost or damaged in the post. Point 4 is an estimate for the casting costs based on advice from other manufacturers and early quotes from casters

Current Status
As mentioned I have 36 character descriptions accompanied by my own rather “unique” stick figure art. rather than rest on my laurels I have done the following;
I have commissioned the character concept for Cambric together with character sketches for the ten characters and 2 monsters in  the first Haar series. The ludicrously talented Carlos Cara has done a phenomenal job in capturing the core of each character from sketch to final concept. As these are character studies they do not represent the final pose of the miniatures.
Olivier Nkweti, the sculptor for Cambric has done a fantastic job of bringing the miniatures character to life and completed the sculpt on the 14th of December. Olivier is grossly tallented and has previously worked for Rakham, Upperdeck, Privateerpress, Wryd, Infinity, CMON and Dark-Age to name just a few...
I have approached several other sculptors at the time of writing this to establish a schedule and wow, are they ever busy people? Two further sculptors have expressed an interest and given a rough schedule of when they are available. More details as they are confirmed
The process of identifying a casting company continues…
While all of this is ongoing I have been continuing to flesh out the setting, its cultures and history, I hope to begin commissioning pieces of setting art early in 2013.

What will you do if you exceed your funding target?
Well firstly let’s not jinx it! Secondly while this campaign will be specifically used for Cambric he is just the first in an ongoing line of miniatures. Any additional funds, after potential stretch goals, will be fed directly into that progamme.
The Kharybdis Archipelago setting lends itself to all forms of gaming so developing the context for the Haar line in conjunction with the miniatures seems like the right thing to do.


What will you do if you do not meet your funding target?
Honestly? All of the above but over a much longer timescale. I am committed to this range of products and its setting.
Stretch Goals: 
There are 12 miniatures sketched out for Haar Series 1. Being more realistic perhaps I've outlined the first three stretch goals beyond the funding for Cambric. Let's not get too far ahead of ourselves...

$3000: Haar 1-2: Sicilaine:The next character, Sicilaine: Lady of Waves and Rain, member of the 9 Mother Council, will be included in with the $15 & $22 perks. New sketches and concept art will be commissioned alongside the sculpt. A separate painted perk will be added for her ladyship: Estimated delivery February/March 2013

$4500: Haar 1-3: Tenril Mornen: The third character, Tenril Mornen: Seeker of the Aeryil and hero of Daur Fast. Tenril will be included in with the $15 & $22 perks. New sketches and concept art will be commissioned alongside the sculpt. A separate painted perk will be added for this world weary warrior.Estimated delivery February/March 2013

$5500: Genre Pack #1: Steampunk. This pack of 12 accessories with a steam punk feel will be added to the $22 & £40 perks. Comprising of ranged and melee weapons and odd looking pieces of equipment this pack will allow you to bring any of the Haar miniatures, or any others for that matter, into your steampunk themed games.Estimated delivery March 2013
we have other Genre Packs in the works such as high fantasy and arcane-tech or magi-tech. Each will comprise of two sets of between 6 and 8 unique pieces.

Risks
The campaign does not meet its goals
Yeah this is a genuine concern given a) the time of year and b) the economic climate. It is a relatively small amount of funding required for the first miniature and there is a proven market for such product. That said though I think a weather eye will need to be kept on the campaign to pilot it to success.
Increase in costs
At this stage the true cost for a caster has yet to be pinned down but I have used an average of market prices given to me by several other manufacturers and included a 20% contingency. As soon as I pin down the cost I will update the campaign.
Unexpected delays due to use of contractors
Yes, certainly a risk given the nature of the beast. A strong communication plan and regular updates should help with this one. Any changes to delivery dates will be posted on the campaign as soon as they are confirmed.

Development

It will be made using Shiva3D, Adobe Suite, and will be available for Mobile devices (iOS and Android) and web (as Flash).

From access to the game, to Credits in the game, to tShirts, to even get your pet in the game, and even see your pet in the game cinematic! how cool is that!

and now, THIS would be a great help: spread the word :D  link: http://igg.me/p/102568?a=343413

Will post a little update every day, till time's up :)

story:
Find Me (Finding Characters Game)



My name is Andres Mancera and I have been working with my father for more than eight years in the making of scenes where people have to find characters as newspapers promotions. I'm proud to say that I am very good at it, during the time I work with my father we won two first places in the 2010 International Newspaper Marketing Awards (INMA), one for Marketing Solutions for Advertising Clients and the other one for Print-Single Copy Sales; only three newspaper won two awards The New York times (USA), The Herald-Times (USA) and El Espectador (Colombia) this last one thanks to our games. Due to the success of the Newspaper games my partner and friend Andrés Alba and I decided to make this newspapers games a Video Game. Andres Alba is a Psychologist passionate about technology and startups, but what is more important for our company we are both game junkies since we were five years old.

We want to create a game of finding characters and also make it one of the best games on social networks. Working with my father I learn that games of finding objects as Gardens of time or Hidden Chronicles are not as entertained as games of finding characters and the reason is very simple objects don't fall, objects don't dress funny, objects don't cry to her mother for an ice cream, basically is easier to identify yourself or have sympathy for a character. We are going to do great illustrations of wonderful places and filled with characters. We know that illustrations are very important for a game of this kind, but as gamers we know that this doesn't mean a thing without a good game-play that's why we are developing new ways to interact with the game, a new interface, different game modes and different helps, and believe us the game will be amazing.

 

Game characters

 

What we need & what you get

We think that any help is valuable and after more than two years working and spending all our money in this company we know what it feels not being able to spend money in anything so if you want to help us and you simply don´t have the money you can copy the internet page of this campaign and show it to your friends.

We already have part of the work done if we can get to the ten thousand dollars in funding we can finish the game and from there the sky is the limit we can do more scenes even new play modes. If we didn´t make it to the ten thousand dollars goal we still create one or two scenarios and you will receive all your perks, then we will improve the game with money we receive from revenue of other games.

 

You as a game Character

One of the founders of our company has volunteered himself to show you how you could be portrait inside the game. In a special promotion we will make the cartoons of the first three people that pay the $300 perk or a higher perk, send the illustration to them and post it in the campaign before it ends, only if they want us to do it.

 

Art book

In the art book will be included not only the best images from our games, but also information about them like scripts, bios, technical aspects, and more. Besides, we are developing a comic telling the history of our company, This comic will be the perfect introduction to our art book. Above you can see some of the panels of the comic, also in the Updates or Gallery tab you can see more images of it.

 

Wallpapers

This is an image of a card game our company (GGwoot) is developing. It also is one of the Wallpapers you will get to choose for the $120 perk or one of the ten Wallpapers we will give you for the $300 perk or any other higher perk you buy. You can see more wallpapers in the Updates or Gallery tab.

story:
List Materials

and it is not all ;-)

News

Campaign 3Dsimo has been founded again after requests from fans. You can find the old campaign at: http://igg.me/at/3Dsimo/x/3721646  Goal amount is just 1000$ because the 3Dsimo project is going to be realised no matter how much is final collected amount. 

Hello, I would like to inform, you the new design of 3Dsimo has been created and it's also final design.

I hope you like the new ergonomic design.

Thank you for you support.


3Dsimo in the press:

What is it?

Do you have a fantasy? Then you have half won. You just need to make it real. This can be happened by using 3Dsimo which simply and fast enables you to draw 3D objects. And you don´t even need technical training. 3Dsimo has no limitations only user´s imagination and skillfulness. We have prepared for you set of models from various materials. 

3Dsimo as a first on the world provides to user the possibility to choose print options on a digital display. The adjustability of temperature and speed of materials throughput now offer amazing opportunities for your creativity. We can handle various materials as ABS, PLA,PET,HIPS,FLEX black, PVA (water-soluble material), nylon at different temperatures in order to achieve fast filling or even print in the air. Other options include backlight, turn on preheating or memory for storing settings. These parameters are used to determine the appropriate method of drawing.

Do not be limited by the choice of materials, for example choose between golden, silver, wooden or flexible PLA. Over time, new materials will be increasing due to the growing trend of 3D printing. Our 3Dsimo is fully prepared for this due to configurability of all parameters and thermal feedback for determining the exact temperature.



How it works?

3Dsimo is so simple to use as a pencil. Everyone who have ever draw with pencil will not have a problem to use 3Dsimo. After plugging it in you set the desired speed and temperature according to the material (these data will be appended together with 3Dsimo and new materials will be updated). 3Dsimo is based on the principle of FDM technology thus extruding plastic material through the hot end. If you want to print into the air or create infill of any object you can do it easily and quickly. There is no problem just make your choice. After a while of use you will find that with 3Dsimo you can create fantastic objects.

3Dsimo has many utilization:

  • Repairing of plastic devices
  • Bonding and assembling models of 3D printers
  • Repair abortive print (due to repair you don’t need to enter new several hours lasting print)
  • Creating jewelry
  • To implement your ideas
  • Simply for the joy of modeling

What we can create?

When drawing with normal pencil one is still improving and invents a new variations of drawings, then the same applies for our 3Dsimo. With 3Dsimo you may always think up new forms of creating 3D objects. Printing can be done on almost every solid material but for PLA it is recommended glass surface and paper for ABS.


Components and Equipment:

The whole 3Dsimo weights 180gr and its length is 170 mm. A part of equipment is a holder in which can be 3Dsimo simply and safely store and powered. For each 3Dsimo you also get a starting package of materials for experimentation. The package contains 3 ABS strings in different colors and 3 PLA 3 strings. Each string has a length of five meters so you have for testing an incredible 30 meters. We are progressively inventing and generating extenders pro drawing geometrical figures and to elevate the whole product on higher level. 3Dsimo has functional design for adding extenders and elimination of accidental burn when touch its jet.


As printing material can be used all the plastic material for the 3D printer such as ABS, PLA, nylon, PVA, flexi, wood, HIPS, PET . 3Dsimo uses a string with a width of 1.75 mm, the width of the strings was chosen as the most common for today´s printers. It is then easily available.


What are we going to do with collected sum of money?

If we reach at least 150 sold pieces the collected amount will be used to create injection molding form from nobel metal that cost $ 3500. If we will not reach as many sold pieces as required the project will be still realized with silicone forms and master model and their following casting. Silicone forms have been made yet and the next week the results are going to be published. Also the collected amount will be used for CE certificate that needs to have every product going to market. And of course for entire realization of project and making final product for you! I want to aware you on indiegogo is price of 3Dsimo lowest you can ever get.

Frequently asked questions:

1. What materiel it used to craft?  

1.Only with 3Dsimo you can use different types of material as ABS (known as a material for LEGO bricks), PLA nature friendly material on the basis of starch, PVA which is soluble in water and last but not the least nylon. Material used is a 1.75mm this fiber.You can choose proper temperature and material speed, so you have more options what kind of material to use.

2. What comes in Full Commercial Package?

2. 3Dsimo full set includes 3Dsimo amazing pen, docking station, 30 meters of a printing material ABS also as PLA and a power supply unit. We are finalizing few more amazing extensions now. First two of them you will see in one week time!

3.Where do we get that material once we ran out.

3.We are going to offer you all mentioned types of material in all color options 20m each. If you have another needs, just let us know.

4.Is it toxic, safe for kids to craft? I mean will it be hot while using or washable when used on skin,cloths?

4.Materials as ABS,PLA,PVA or Nylon are not dangerous and toxic. You can find these materials in LEGO, foodstuffs or textile. The material is hot for a very limited time, we cannot recommend you to apply it on your body, but for example application on textile, glass or even paper is fine.

5. Battery life of this device, can we have more information about it how it works actually?

5.Our device doesn't have a battery as of now, we use a power supply unit. In the gallerz you can find a video previewing all the parametrs you can setup. 3Dsimo is based on the principle of FDM technology thus extruding plastic string through the hot end. You can choose a temperature which differs at each kind. It is only up to you how thick layer of the material you will decide to use, look at the LEGO brick from ABS. Once again thank you for your questions. Hope you to support our project.

More videos:

story:
Summary

Iron Gaming is returning to the Rooster Teeth Expo this year with an even bigger presence and lots more to do while you are at the event.  We will be hosting the Iron Games Season One Finals featuring:

•  Counter-Strike:Global Offensive

•  Halo 4

•  SMITE

The teams attending the event will be playing for a top prize of $10,000 for each of the games.  Most of the teams have fought their way through online qualifiers and LAN events to earn their place at the finals, so the intensity will be fierce.  Featured on a raised platform in the center of Iron Gaming arena will be some of the best teams in the world battling it out against one another.  Those who can’t inch past the crowds for optimal viewing will be amazed by the detail they can see on the massive LED wall!  Yeah!  It’s ok.  You can read it again.  Massive LED wall!  It will be epic! 

We will also be hosting our version of the Halo Global Championship with our Halo 4 FFA tournament sponsored by Gaems.  Are you the best Halo player on the globe?  Got the skills to prove it?  Players worldwide will be fighting their way to the top to win over $10,000 in cash and prizes.  Cash and prizes will be awarded each day and the grand champion will be taking home at least $5,000 in cash! Why do we say “at least”?  Each Halo 4 FFA pass purchased online will add $5 to the prize pool.  So if all of the online passes sell out, the prize pool will be over $10,000 for first place!

What You Get & What We Need

What do you get?  We break it down for you in more details in the perks.  We’re talking everything from taking the bus with the IG Staff and top players to the DayZ Ultimate Experience. 

The goal is to pull together $25,000.  This will help keep operating costs down while still providing the optimal experience for our players and spectators.

Regardless of how much money we raise, it will go towards supporting our partners and creating a great time for the attendees at RTX! 

The Impact

At Iron Gaming we are dedicated to creating a platform for gamers to increase their notoriety.  We provide a community where each player can compete, be seen, and conquer.  It is our mission to create an enhanced opportunity for each player to step out from the shadows and create his/her presence in competition.  These are the gladiators of gaming. 

It is imperative that gamers are able to track their progress and grow with each game.  Competing against players with similar skills not only levels the playing field, but also builds confidence.  As a player continues to progress, he/she can simultaneously compete against statistically aligned players.  We believe this atmosphere will encourage gamers to apply themselves and see what they are capable of. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

•  Spread the word.  #IGChatty

•  Follow us: 

Twitter:  http://twitter.com/IronGamingTV

Youtube:  http://www.youtube.com/irongamerlive

Instagram:  @IronGaming

Tumblr:  http://irongamingtv.tumblr.com/

Iron Gaming's vision is to become the Olympics or X Games for eSports by building a system that legitimizes eSports and recognizes players and teams for their skill as traditional sports do today.

story:
What is Gerrymandering?

To understand what the game is about, we must understand the problem of gerrymandering which is explained well in video below.


About Game

The game is going to be a turn based strategy/board game where players(or AI) take turn re-drawing districts of a city to benefit their political party.

It features game modes with flexible and customizable gameplay parameters such as city size, number of districts, balance, population size and density.

There will also be a campaign with diverse scenarios.

Target platform is going to be Windows, Mac and Linux. 

Mobile/Tablet release is also a possibility, but not guaranteed.

Link to Demo Build


The Impact

When the map maker has more power over the outcome of the election more than the voter, that means the system is unfair and this game is here to demonstrate that while providing meaningful and challenging gameplay.

Point of the game is to raise awareness of a vary real problem and start a conversation while also being a fun board/puzzle game.


Why I Need Funding 

While game's framework is done, funding is needed for personal expenses while  working full-time on finishing the project. 

Depending on the funds raised i hope to hire an artist to help me with art asset production. Graphics and overall presentation of the game will depend on the funding.


Risks & Challenges

  •  Can you actually make the game?

The framework of the game has already been made, so there is not much risk of game not coming out if funded. And by framework i mean most of the game logic, game modes and interface layout. The game uses vary scalable semi-procedural level generation.

  • Can i play a demo?

Of course follow >>THIS LINK<< to a web demo introducing basic gameplay

  • Where will you publish it?

Right now im keeping an open mind and haven't decided definitely, but it's probably going to be self-published via web site or trough Steam.

  • Price?

Exact number is not decided yet, but it will be vary affordable.


Credits & Special Thanks

  • Board ganeration and managment is from Elliott Mahler's "Enhanced Elections" project https://github.com/ejmahler/EnhancedElections



Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word and share this page on social media
  • Talk to your council and get a conversation about gerrymandering going

story:
Hey All,
We are a group of four residents at Café (Choices are for Everyone).  Café  is a non profit that supports adults with disabilities.  We are trying to raise $800.00 to go see a Boston Celtics game in the Spring of 2014.  We are excited to take the Amtrak straight from Portland to the stadium in Boston!  The train pulls right underneath the TD Garden stadium.  Cafe will cover all staffing. 

How Can You Help?

Here's where you come in.  Our projected expenses for the trip are $800.

Game Tickets = $100 per person

Travel - $50 round trip per person

We will be fundraising through  Cafe for the additional $100 we need to cover these expenses.  Any funds raised over our initial Indiegogo goal of $800 will go toward souvenirs, snacks for our train adventure and toward future events.

More About Cafe

Cafe is a non profit organization devoted to removing barriers to personal choice and facilitating a unique community outreach experience to the individuals with disabilities that we serve.  For more information, please visit our website at www.cafeinc.org.

story:
>>> ABOUT LOST LEVELS

Lost Levels is a radically-casual 'unconference'-style picnic about games and play that aims to be hyper-inclusive: it is completely free to attend, and anyone can run a session. This year it is taking place on March 20, 2014 in San Francisco. 

Last year (2013):

  • we supported more than 50 (fifty) session facilitators, who shared over 839 ideas!
  • we outright rejected zero (0) session proposals.
  • we ran with an approximate budget of -$150 (negative one hundred fifty) dollars.

Basically, we think huge expensive conferences are good at some stuff but really bad at other stuff. So maybe we can help with that other stuff? Remember that the core of any conference is people hanging out and talking. So let's hangout and talk!

>>> WHY WE NEED MONEY THIS TIME / WHERE THE $$$ GOES

To help protect our participants, we are seeking an event permit this year -- the resulting fees (and the required event insurance policy we must also purchase) are rather expensive. Like, really really expensive. The cost of just all these basic fees alone is more than $3000 USD...

All money (minus IndieGoGo fees) will go toward the cost of the permit, insurance -- and possibly free food too, if we can manage it. 

Any leftover money will be set aside for next year. We refuse to profit off this in any way, and we will publish a post-unconference-picnic transparency report in April.


>>> WHAT YOU GET FOR DONATING

Peace and goodwill for your fellow people. Please refer to the IndieGoGo perks as well as this useful Pass Comparison Chart below:

>>> TOO POOR TO DONATE? THAT'S OKAY

  • If you'll be in San Francisco around then, sign-up to attend! We'll see you here!
  • Share our IndieGoGo link! Your support counts! Tweet about us (@LOOOST_LEVELS) and talk about us to your friends! :)

#LOSTLEVELS <3

all photos by Brian Taylor http://btphotographer.com/

story:
Short Summary

      I have been a Self-Employed Artist for 31 years and I have been live streaming every day since February, in a game called Minecraft. I turn off the monsters and the Survival parts of the game and play Peaceful/Creative. I am building a beautiful world full of Art projects that are sometimes simple and sometimes complicated, and now I have been given a Group Game that holds 500 people, for life, for free! They tell me that I am so rare in the gaming world that they want to be sure that I can continue to work in this direction free of the worry of monthly payments for a server. The trouble is that I am working on a small lap top that will not let me use a web cam and my 2800 followers can't see my face as I stream, or donate money to help pay for a computer. 

   My campaign is to take a room in my home and turn it into a place to  continue building a beautiful world. The art that I make in the real world makes people smile when they come to our town. This virtual world is a powerful influence all over the globe because this media reaches so many more people. People recovering from surgery watch because they say it is calming. I don't swear or get angry. I make things that are easy to copy and it is empowering to young artists to watch me build and talk about being an Artist in a difficult world. 

 

What We Need

  • I need a powerful computer I can trust to carry the load I need to stream, with 16 GB Ram and 4 GB Graphics, 
  • I want my computer to be fast enough that my son, can stream from my home with no worries. I don't want to beg from him for my computer set up.
  • I would like a new carpet for the room, as this one is 43 years old. 
  • I would like to paint the room with one wall as my green screen. 
  • I would like to have custom shelves built that will wrap around the room with the computer desk in the middle for ease of access. 
  • I would like a good chair just for this job. The one I am using was second hand 38 years ago.  
  • I would like a good recording system microphone and camera so the quality of the color and sound is the best I can provide. 
  • I am self-employed so during the time this project is being worked on, I will have no way to make a living. The balance of the funds will be for incidental expenses like postage for the perks and my living expenses until the work is completed.
  • With the money I have raised so far, I will buy one gallon of paint and paint the room myself, I will buy carpet samples to re-carpet the floor, and do the work myself, and I will buy a second hand computer tower.

     What You  Get

  • The first gift you will get will be the joy of watching my show go from a blurry mess with lag and dropped frames to a professional show. You will also have the gratitude of 2800 dedicated followers who watch me every evening hoping they can see me on a camera.

  • Every one who helps fund this project, will get a special thank you, a GG from the GG button, a High Five to the camera, and a Shout-Out! If you send an address with payment you will get a special card designed by myself with a Photo of Bacon_Mom, a series number, the date, and a hand signature! One of the mountains in my game has been named...COMPUTER MOUNTAIN and your name will be posted on that mountain on the day the donation is received.

The Impact 

 The folks who watch me say that I am in their minds and they dream of me planting 17,000 flowers around a rainbow Road... and they wake up with their depressions gone and they are full of the joy of making the world a better place. 

  • Three years ago I wanted to paint a mural on the outside of a building . The pattern had 30,000 squares...but I had no money for the materials or the paint. It took me three years to fund my project but with the help of the world public and my local government all the costs were covered. I did the art work for free. The painting is still on that wall for all to enjoy. Hopefully this project will not take as long.

Risks & Challenges


  • I think the biggest risk I have in asking for money is the risk of receiving very little. It is embarrassing to have to ask in the first place, and even more embarrassing to be unsupported by friends and family. Perhaps I don't deserve a computer room and they all feel I should just give it up. It is also hard to have messages on this site from people who want me to pay them $5.00 so they will donate $1.00 so I will look like there is money coming into the fund. I stand alone in my request and I will let the challenge run to the end with honesty.
  • The internet world has a dark side and the challenge for me is to swim with the sharks and keep a smile on my face when times get tough. I have been greeting the public all my life and I enjoy the way I can be a good example. 
  • Other Ways You Can Help

 Where are many ways to help my project. You can talk about it to your friends on Social Media. You can use the Indiegogo share tools, and you can come to the chat room on my live stream and mention the project there. I will be posting a link with NightBot to promote it as well. Go to Twitch.tv, look for live streams, then Minecraft, and then for Bacon_Mom. See you there!

story:
Short Summary

Hey there, I'm Conor Lazarou, computer science student and soon-to-be game developer with your help. I've been dreaming about making games since I got my first video game on my fifth birthday (Pokemon Red, in case you were wondering). Now that my nineteenth birthday is just around the corner, I realized I can actually start making games! There's nothing in my way!

Nothing in my way, that is, except software costs. I went online because I've been recommended to use GameMaker. Unfortunately, the modules I need for it cost $500. I don't have that kind of money, I'm a student!

What We Need & What You Get

So that's where you come in. I need $500 to buy my game design software so I can get to work at learning and churning out indie games. Anything over and above that $500 will go towards the games themselves, likely in buying music or other media rights.

My first game I've got planned is called Pip pip, a light-hearted puzzle game for tablet and smartphones.

Edit: Here's a rendition of what the game will look like:

After that, I'm thinking of making a more serious tactics/RPG game in the same genre as Nintendo's Fire Emblem games.

The Impact

Any contribution you make would mean the world to me, and brings me a step closer to being able to call myself a game developer without my parents laughing at me and telling me to get a real job.

As for the perks, I've got a couple lined up.

For $10, you'll get a free copy of Pip pip once it's finished.

For $20, you and a friend, lover, mother, or cat get a free copy of Pip pip once it's finished.

For $50, you get two copies of Pip pip and your name in the special thanks section in the Pip pip credits

For $100, you get two copies of Pip pip, two copies of my tactics/RPG game upon its release, and your name in the special thanks section in both games

And for $500, if you're that generous, you get 5 copies of each game, and your name (or company name) in the credits in every commercial game I make EVER!

Keep in mind, though, that this is my first dip into game design and that I have no idea when the games will be finished. Christmas 2013 is a ballpark estimate for Pip pip, and Christmas 2014 for the tactics game.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to see me succeed but don't have the funds to contribute, you can still help out by

  • Sharing this campaign on your social media site of choice
  • Write a letter to your rich aunt Patty with the URL enclosed
  • Print off this page, tape it to a brick, and throw it through your local oil tycoon's window
  • Or go buy another indie game right now, because helping anyone in the community helps everyone in the community

Cheers

-Conor Lazarou

Or go buy another indie game right now, because helping anyone in the community helps everyone in the community


Cheers
-Conor Lazarou

story:
Why Vote4US app matters

Many voters are unsure or confused as to whom to vote for and some end up voting for whoever posted the most signs or bought the most advertising. I have tried to find a good place that was fun and with unbiased information, but I couldn't so I decided to make it...

Vote4US is a mobile app that enables the over 132 million voters to compare and discover candidates with similar views through the use of entertaining quizzes, activities/games, and access to an aggregation of unbiased information on each candidate.

Having a political "conversation" with your friends? Pull out your smartphone with the Vote4US app and dominate with all the facts you want at your fingertips! Have fun exploring the political landscape with your friends.

Unsure about which candidate is worthy of your vote? Use Vote4US to match up with candidates based on their position to key issues important to you, then compare side-by-side!

Like politics? Like games? Like to earn achievements? One of the stretch goals adds Vote4US games like our "You Pick 'em", where like the sports equivalents, you compete with your friends to pick the winners. Later versions will be very customizable to allow tuning of your "league".

A basic version of the app will be available for free, but a premium upgrade is available to add more cool stuff. Being a political app that is endeavoring to be as completely unbiased as possible, even the free app will be ad free. That's why I am turning to Kickstarter. Check out the features and the sketch-ups of the app on our sitehttp://vote4.us/

Versions

Version 1

  • Simple candidate information and comparison
  • Compare and contrast candidates, research candidate information, and even contact them.
  • Simple political quiz
  • Take a short 10 question quiz that lets you see where you lie on the political landscape and compare with your friends, if you choose.
  • Social Integration - Twitter, Facebook, Google+ Allows you to easily communicate your findings or broadcast your support/opposition to a candidate.
  • Daily Polls Entertaining way to see how your answer to the question of the day compares to national, state, city or just your friends.
Version 2
  • Candidate Matching Quickly find a short list of candidates that match your values. Dig in issue by issue to find the candidate most worthy of your valuable vote.
  • Add robust Candidate/Campaign profiles Allows candidates to add personalized information with expanded data on each candidate.
  • Add virtual debate to candidate profile The virtual debate feature allows candidates to expound upon their position on an issue. Then their opponents are each allowed one comment on that statement with the candidate allowed one short rebuttal on each opponent comment.
  • More robust user profile Add information with your views on the various issues to facilitate accurate candidate matching. 
Version 3
  • mechanism to become a “verified” account After an easy and safe verification process, your comments will be given more authority over unverified users. This will help eliminate anonymous trolls ruining your experience.
  • Add Achievement/Badges system Earn cool badges as you participate and interact with others on the app. Become an elite member and add unique features to your account.
  • Add volunteering Find a candidate that you really beleave in? Volunteer to help them either virtually or physically right from within the app.
  • Add donations Donate to the cause if the mood strikes you.
  • Lobby Group / Pac / Club Joining Mayor Daley once said, “We don’t want nobody nobody sent.” So if you want your voice heard, you will need to join together with other like-minded people. Hate potholes on your street? Form “Chicago citizens for the improvement of city streets” and join together with others to make your voice heard and action done!
  • Build forum Participate in forum discussions on issues or candidates.
  • Virtual rally/speeches Attend virtual rallies/speeches or just read about them afterward. 
Version 4
  • Add voting registration Register to vote from within the app, where allowed by law, or at least get information on where to go.
  • Add local voting location info, hours, map View information on your polling location including hours and a map with directions, if desired.
  • Ready to Vote report Mark candidates that you wish to vote for, preview ballots, when provided, and print a report so you can vote as you planned when you get to the polling location.

Stretch Goals

Goal: $65,000 - Version 2 unlocked  Will add another reward type for those who are candidates or want to run for office.

Goal: $100,000 - Version 3 unlocked  This also adds free verified user status to all supporters at level $25 or higher.

Goal: $125,000 - Version 4 unlocked

Rewards

This is a skimmer hat:

Pictures of the Vote4US campaign buttons coming soon

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please talk about this on social media and IRL.
  • Post on your Facebook page.
  • Tweet a message inviting followers to join us.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Shout it from your soap box.

Thanks! and...

Welcome to Democracy 2.0 !

story:
*Please keep in mind that all art is placeholder or WIP*

 

The Story so far:

The plane of Uurlathun is home to four deities. They created and rule over it from their thrones atop the spire, preferring to keep to themselves and allowing those below to flourish or fumble of their own accord. Allegiants serve their chosen deity, providing offerings and communing with them regularly. Peace has known the plane for decades since the banishment of Nephaestus to the continent of Alerion. But when the shadows loom over the mainland and those same deities go to war, the very fabric of reality will be torn asunder.

 

Who I am:

Greetings IndieGogo! I am Alex, a 23 year old Software Engineer. I've always been fascinated by video games, from the perspective of a player and a creator. I have been hard at work for the last year and a half learning and refining my game development skills. I've spent 6 months laying the groundwork for this project. As a solo developer I will be making the art, music and code myself, outsourcing only when absolutely necessary. I plan on tackling this project myself both as a way to cut my expenses, but also to get my hands on every aspect of the process so that I can move on to more ambitious projects in the future. If you'd like to contact me directly, or send more text than IndieGogo allows via the "Ask a question" button, please send me an email at: alexiworret@gmail.com.

 

What the project is:

Greenfather's Gift is a 2d pixel art action-stealth game with a deep, recursive storyline and an emphasis on player choice and consequences. The game will be developed in Unity, though I will be making all assets from scratch so you won't have to worry about this being an asset flip. The story will shed light on some of Uurlathun's mysteries as well as hint at some for future projects. This game will focus on the interaction between The Aspect of the Sun (Ambra Sol) and The Aspect of the Earth (The Greenfather), with some meddling from the other deities as well. I will give out enough information to keep the setting and gameplay coherent, but not enough to answer all the questions the player might have. Some answers will need to be searched for in the world or deciphered from cryptic responses the deities themselves give to the player. The gameplay loop will focus heavily on avoidance rather than combat, though the option will always be available. Choices made in gameplay (aggression, avoidance, etc...) will gradually change how other characters see you and even how you see yourself (though the changes made are a secret for now). There will be branching narrative paths with dialogue options, some of which will be hidden, locked behind certain prerequisite actions. I plan to have background music specific to each major character as well as musical cues when they speak. For example the Greenfather would have a woodwind background song and deep string section sounds for his voice.

 

Why the project is:

I see this project as the first step on our journey to create a vast interwoven narrative that spans multiple games and styles. The world I've created is large and rife with potential. I can think of no less than 4 completely unique gameplay styles that would fit perfectly and still maintain a connected narrative, ranging from a clicker style game to a fullblown RPG. That's before I receive any ideas from the community. I would love to completely flesh out all aspects of this universe. More than anything, I want to create a community that enjoys and heavily impacts the content created. Backing this project or joining the community will not only facilitate it's completion, but also pave the road for the journey ahead.

 

Where the project is: 

The world of Uurlathun was designed to be as much a character as the NPCs and player themselves. The fictitious universe the game is set in is one I have been working on for over four years. It features extensive world building lore and many over-arching plot twists and threads that I believe most people will not see coming. Creatures and plants, along with the races that inhabit the world, are simultaneously familiar and yet foreign. That being said, many of those elements are above the scope of this individual entry in what I hope to be a large series.

 

 

How/When the project is:

So far I've been steadily implementing features and working on the art and music for the game. Currently I would say it is between 10-15% complete. Estimating total time for completion based on the first six months and the fact that things should speed up gradually as I grow more familiar with the systems I'm creating, I am confident that I can deliver a finished product within 1.5-2 years. A good portion of the background systems have been at minimum first passed, with some being very near to completion.

These include:

  • Cutscene system (Needs improvement, but basic functionality is there and expandable)
  • Day/Night and miscellaneous lighting (first pass)
  • Passive/Wildlife creature AI (first pass)
  • Skill unlock system
  • Grimoire system (Needs art update and more features but mostly done)
  • Main menu -- The main menu will be part of the game itself, not just boxes you can click. I've completed a rough draft with placeholder art currently, but the logic and flow is good.
  • General Player movement (in a good spot right now, but might update as game matures)
  • Player "morality" system (First Pass) -- I wish to keep the actual stat a secret as it has story implications
  • Hud-less gameplay -- I plan to provide the player with information via character interactions rather than a HUD. For example, the player character's eyes will glow red in shadow so you can keep track and easily determine if you are hidden, while they will glow blue if you are within range to initiate an attack.

[Main Menu rough draft below]

[Enter the house to quit, use the sign post to resume or start a new game. Other objects will be added and location will change based on your story progression.]

 

The Important Stuff: ​

 

Why I need your support:

I have been refining and building this world for 4+ years, and am only now in a position where I can truly invest myself into its creation full time. My expenses and external commitments are minimal right now, as I quit my IT job about a year ago after saving up to pursue this project. This is the time for me to go all in, but I can't do it alone. With your help I believe that we can create a universe that people will revisit for years to come.

 

Incentives:

Once I am ready to release the game I plan on selling it for between 10-15 dollars depending on how many additional features I can add during the development timeframe. I realize that investing in a new developer is a risk, as such all backers at or above the $5 tier will receive at least one copy of the game.

**All submitted designs are subject to approval**

-$1 -- My eternal gratitude

-$5 -- Even more of my eternal gratitude + 1 copy of game

-$10 -- Name in credits + 1 copy of game

-$20 -- Name in credits, two copies of game, sprite compendium

-$40 -- Name in credits, two copies of game, digital OST and sprite compendium

-$60(30) -- All prior + design a save token & flavor text (game saves will run on an offering system, tokens will be small items that you offer at a save point)

-$100(20) -- All prior from sub $60 + design a bystander (non story relevant NPC, includes dialogue/appearance, will appear randomly in crowds/towns)

-$150(10) -- All prior from sub $60 + design side quest NPC (appearance, type of quest/dialogue, ramifications of quest, specific spawn points and conditions)

-$200(10) -- All prior from sub $60 + design a new wildlife creature and the ability you obtain from them (creature will appear randomly in the wild in its habitat area)

-$500(5) -- All prior + design a place of power and form of manifestation for the deity that resides there (these will be important story and side quest locations where the deities can attain corporeal form and communicate directly with their allegiants)

-$750(3) -- You will receive front and center recognition when the game boots and during the credits. In addition you will receive 4 copies of the game and the ability to develop double the content. You will be able to design 2 save tokens, 2 NPCs, 2 Sidequests/NPCs and 2 Wildlife Creatures.

*All designs will go through an iteration and approval process*

*Reward tier art is NOT indicative of final product art quality*

 

Why Support?

I believe that I can create a one of a kind story and that it will lead into many more down the line. I created the world of Uurlathun to be expandable as well as moldable, modular in a way. However, I can't possibly create all the stories that this world can offer alone. Together I believe we can make a universe that people will want to keep re-visiting over and over. You won't just be supporting this single game, you'll be joining a community that will create an unforgettable universe.

 

Full disclosure:

I have a Bachelors in Software Engineering, and some professional programming experience. While I don't have professional game development experience, I've known that this was my calling for as long as I can remember and have been slowly learning and engaging with the medium for over a decade. I know what makes a good game and I'm determined to have mine make the cut. I won't say that learning Unity for the first time was easy, but I'm at a position now where I am confident and excited to see where I can take this project. I've run into my fair share of hurdles, but there hasn't been a single problem I was unable to solve.

 

Complications:

Time is the largest hurdle as a solo developer. However, I am committed to delivering a finished, high quality product within the 2 year time frame. While I would prefer to work alone for the entire project, if something is taking too long for me to do on my own I am open to working with external artists and programmers.

 

Non-monetary Contributions:

 

Can't afford to back the project or don't feel comfortable doing so? No worries! I don't currently use social media, but you can contact me via my campaign email if you have questions or concerns. Also, please spread the word about this project if it interests you or you think it might interest a friend or family member. Word of mouth is incredibly powerful and even a small remark in passing can make a difference. Feel free to directly link people to the campaign if you'd like. That's all from me for now, thank you for your time!
