story:
You hold the power to start a revolution in your paws, and only you can bring justice to the mean streets of Hamsterdam! Will you be the hero your town needs? Will you become the Hamster-fu master you were born to be? Will you defeat the whisker twister in chief, the vile Chinchilla Marlo? You bet your bushy tail!

Join us for behind-the-scenes news! Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | Discord | YouTube Trailer

 

Available on iOS and Android devices

 

We’re Muse Games, you may know us from our teamwork-based Steampunk vehicular combat series Guns of Icarus, or from the magical phosphorescent forest of CreaVures.

We’d like to introduce you to our newest creation, Hamsterdam! The brawling hamster-fu beat-em up made for Nintendo Switch™, Android & iOS Devices, and of course PC & Mac!

 

Let the mob take over Hamsterdam? Not in this life! Your town is beset by the vile Vermin Gang and the scourge of MarloTonic™, just as the evil Marlo planned. The one thing he didn’t plan on? A Hamster-fu master with cheek pouches stuffed full of J U S T I C E. 

 

 


 

The once peaceful town of Hamsterdam is in danger! The vile chinchilla Marlo and his Vermin Gang are wreaking havoc and terrorizing the town. Enter our hamster hero, Pimm, who must harness his mightiest martial arts powers and kick tail through district after district, on a heart-pounding journey to take down the Vermin Gang, save his grandfather, and restore peace to Hamsterdam.

 

Hamsterdam. The once beautiful town Pimm calls home, now a degenerate den of crime and corruption.

This is the sauce of all the trouble in Hamsterdam. Using Marlo Tonic to control the population, the nefarious Marlo is sitting pretty at the top of the food chain, but he’s about to be cut down to size when the fur starts to fly!

Hamsterdam is a game where rhythm & precision meets some good old fashioned button mashing. With classic arcade brawling mechanics and tap and swipe martial arts combos, the power of Hamster-fu is in your paws!

 

 

Boss battles

Beating down the faceless goons of the Vermin Gang is one thing, but sooner or later Pimm will come toe to toe with fiendish boss battles that will really test your skills.

Scooter

Every street-smart superhero needs a ride that shows the bad guys they mean business. Take Pimm for a ride on his scooter, and maybe once Hamsterdam is safe, you’ll be riding off into the sunset.

 

Swing, tap and swipe, rhythm

We built Hamsterdam with the intuitive gesture controls of the Nintendo Switch and the touch controls of other mobile devices in mind. It is also playable with a keyboard and mouse on PC/Mac. Unleash your inner Hamster-fu master and swing, tap, or swipe your way to victory!

Nintendo Switch™

We'll support multiple ways to play on Nintendo Switch, including Joy-con, buttons, and touch

Mobile/Play It Anywhere

We'll support both Android and iOS devices, so you can play on the go!

 

 

Concept Art

 

 

Why Indiegogo?

Having the opportunity to be a part of the Indiegogo InDemand program would help us tremendously to continue funding for additional art and features that would make the game that much more rich and engaging. It would allow us to complete our narrative animatics, potentially add additional game modes, outfits, and social features for people to share their hamtastic experiences.

Perhaps more importantly for us is getting your help in testing different aspects of the game. We still need help tuning pacing, progression, and making sure all the combat and onboarding elements are easy to understand and play. For that, your support would be invaluable.

 

Influences

We started the project from a game jam idea - it would be interesting if we could take the classic beat’em up, brawler experiences (such as Streets of Rage, Fist of the North Star, Super Punch-Out!!, and Arkham Asylum) that we loved, and marry them with the controls of the Nintendo Switch and mobile devices, so that people can use gestures to bring action to life.

To craft the vision of Hamsterdam, we are continually inspired by 80’s kung-fu movies, the ground-breaking perspectives of The Wire, the satirical depiction of Amsterdam in the famed Pulp Fiction scene, and beautiful visuals and humor of Ratatouille.
story_txt: You hold the power to start a revolution in your paws, and only you can bring justice to the mean streets of Hamsterdam! Will you be the hero your town needs? Will you become the Hamster-fu master you were born to be? Will you defeat the whisker twister in chief, the vile Chinchilla Marlo? You bet your bushy tail!Join us for behind-the-scenes news! Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | Discord | YouTube Trailer Available on iOS and Android devices We’re Muse Games, you may know us from our teamwork-based Steampunk vehicular combat series Guns of Icarus, or from the magical phosphorescent forest of CreaVures.We’d like to introduce you to our newest creation, Hamsterdam! The brawling hamster-fu beat-em up made for Nintendo Switch™, Android & iOS Devices, and of course PC & Mac! Let the mob take over Hamsterdam? Not in this life! Your town is beset by the vile Vermin Gang and the scourge of MarloTonic™, just as the evil Marlo planned. The one thing he didn’t plan on? A Hamster-fu master with cheek pouches stuffed full of J U S T I C E.    The once peaceful town of Hamsterdam is in danger! The vile chinchilla Marlo and his Vermin Gang are wreaking havoc and terrorizing the town. Enter our hamster hero, Pimm, who must harness his mightiest martial arts powers and kick tail through district after district, on a heart-pounding journey to take down the Vermin Gang, save his grandfather, and restore peace to Hamsterdam. Hamsterdam. The once beautiful town Pimm calls home, now a degenerate den of crime and corruption.This is the sauce of all the trouble in Hamsterdam. Using Marlo Tonic to control the population, the nefarious Marlo is sitting pretty at the top of the food chain, but he’s about to be cut down to size when the fur starts to fly!Hamsterdam is a game where rhythm & precision meets some good old fashioned button mashing. With classic arcade brawling mechanics and tap and swipe martial arts combos, the power of Hamster-fu is in your paws!  Boss battlesBeating down the faceless goons of the Vermin Gang is one thing, but sooner or later Pimm will come toe to toe with fiendish boss battles that will really test your skills.ScooterEvery street-smart superhero needs a ride that shows the bad guys they mean business. story:
New Figure Sculpt Added to the Gallery

Our supporters choose this as one of the initial Investigator Miniatures to be produced. Now James Van Schaik has brought this RAFM Call of Cthulhu 7th Edition Miniature to life! Enjoy more photos in the Gallery and see the Updates for the Name the Miniature Contest.

 

New Stretch Goals Added!


For pictures of the newly sculpted miniatures click the link here http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/call-of-cthulhu-miniatures/x/582666?c=gallery
 
MASTER DEAL IS BACK!
It seemed that most of our customers wanted the Master Deal so we brought it back. Please add shipping to your pledge. If you want to upgrade with +$10 extra you can get a copy of the Common Piece of the Disk of R'yleh.
 
 
Here is a graphic for the basic deals (Monster Minion, Investigator Extraordinaire and Mythos Mastermind) and all the stretch goals that these Perks entail.

***All Miniatures are unpainted 32mm white metal***

 

***All Miniatures are unpainted 32mm white metal***

 


Update! Get a Deal!

We opened the $12,000 Stretch Goal and the $20,000 Stretch Goal now giving you eleven Investigators and four Monsters in your Monster Minion, Investigator Extraordinaire or Mythos Mastermind Perks. So get your friends to buy.

Opening these stretch goals means the value of the miniatures to $4.54 per investigator and $11 per monster. Plus you have access to all the Stretch Goals still to be opened. Those miniatures will retail for $6 and $16 or more each. The price gets even better if you take advantage of the Investigator Deal and Monster Deal or if more stretch goals open. You can also take the Flying Polyp Add On or the Insanity Add On to get more miniatures.

If you want both the Investigator Deal and the Monster Deal please pledge twice. Thanks and let's get this program over the $20,000 mark.

 

***All Miniatures are unpainted 32mm white metal***

If you take a Monster Deal or an Investigator Deal than you will get $40 retail worth of product from the existing line for only $10 more. This is the way to get that bang for your buck. With the Investigator Deal your price per miniature would drop to $3.13 per miniature, and one of those is the 120mm tall Nyarlathotep miniature. Wow! So invite your friends and buy now. How about including a Flying Polyp Add-on or and Insanity Add-on, then you get even more product at deep discount.

Short Summary

Rafm's Call of Cthulhu Indiegogo is a project to replace the models in the line and get you the game models you want now!

The RAFM Call of Cthulhu Miniatures line is award winning and iconic within the gaming industry. The line has existed since 1985 and still makes up an important part of our company sales. It is clear that rabid Call of Cthulhu fans want these miniatures to support their gaming. And why not? They're awesome miniatures at a terrific price!  Why wouldn't you like them?

However, we need to reconceive this line to appeal to a new era of gamers. As it turns out, miniatures are also really expensive to produce.  The sculpting and mold costs are enormous.  In order to reimagine this line, we can take our time by producing several new models over the next several years, or we can get support from the fans of Cthulhu mania and launch a bunch of new ones as soon as possible.

By the end of the year, we could possibly replace 8 figures in the Call of Cthulhu line. With this fundraising project we can remanufacture the entire line in one year's time: new character models, and new monsters, all at once.

We just need your support to make this campaign a success!

Indiegogo and Flexible Funding

Indiegogo was chosen as the funding vehicle for this project because we are a Canadian company and we do not currently qualify for funding on Kickstarter. You must be a citizen of the USA in order to qualify for that site. This is well documented on the internet. See our updates on our RAFM.com forums if you have a question about this.Some people have posted that we should use a proxy. This is both dangerous and has possible deep tax implications. We discussed this option and decided that we were a corporation in Canada and we would use the Indiegogo site.

Flexible funding was chosen to allow Paypal transactions as well as credit cards. This means that the funds you s

upport us with by using either your paypal account or your credit card will be withdrawn immediately from your account. It also means that we must supply you with the product whether we meet our minimum funded goal of $8000 or not. Therefore, anyone supporting this project will recieve the initial miniatures release proposed and then any stretch goals that are met depending upon their funding choice.The choice to use flexible funding has allowed us to get to work right away on these miniatures and add new sculptures and new artwork to the project in a timely manner, so thankyou to all that have already funded us.

Charges are applied when you decide to fund the project.
This is copied directly from the IndieGoGo terms page. http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20566503-F...

Please make sure you understand the terms before contributing. At this point we are committed to making 11 new Player characters, 4 new monsters and the Disk of R'lyeh for the line because we have received contributions.

 What We Need & What You Get

We realize that for a role playing game set in this genre you need models of characters and monsters that your players can interact with that won't cause those characters to go instantly insane or get immediately stomped. At this point five new investigator models and three new monsters will be completed regardless of whether or not our initial funding goal is met. Therefore, we have a number of opportunities available for our supporters.  

You can support our Player Character Miniatures and receive a number of new character miniatures based on the number of people who jump on board.

Or

You can support our Monsters Miniatures and receive a number of new monster miniatures based on the number of people who want to get new monsters for their collection.

OR

You can go all in for both deals, cost $100 and get new player characters and new monster miniatures based on the number of people that support us.

And the good news is that as the number of supporters rise, you will get more miniatures!

That's it, so support us now and go get your friends involved because it will mean more miniatures for you!

 The Impact

At the $9,000 USD mark new miniatures will be added to the program and continue being added as the campaign continues. By the $100,000 or approximately 1000 investors it is our plan to have 63 new models on their way to you for your initial investment of $100 USD. By the time we hit 2,000 investors most of the line should be remodeled. You can also select our add-on choices like the Cthulhu box set, Byatis and Dhole box set and the Miskatonic University Expedition sets which we will add throughout the program.

All miniatures are white metal and come unpainted. The scale is 32mm which is the industry accepted gaming standard. Some assembly may be required. Of course there will be variation from miniature to miniature depending on posing and sculpter. Also the monsters will be larger in size standing up to 100mm in some cases. These are high quality, hand sculpted metal miniatures worthy of any tabletop.

So here is your opportunity to support us in this great Call of Cthulhu adventure.

 

 **All Miniatures are unpainted white metal 32mm scale miniatures.

R'yleh Disk Shards are only available to sponsers through our Indiegogo Program. Add $10, $15 or $25 to the perk of your choice to get these limited edition miniature disk shards.

Concept Art

Concept artwork for Investigator Extraordinaire Stretch Goal #1. Let's get to $9000 and get the Captain on board!

See the Gallery for more concept art for our new miniatures.

 

Monster concept art in the gallery tab at the top as well.

 Who we Are

This great project actually started decades ago and there is a talented team driven by a shared dream behind it. Our story begins over 37 years ago, when RAFM Company Inc, began producing rules and then miniatures for the gaming industry in 1979. RAFM Call of Cthulhu miniatures has probably been our most successful line. Envisioned and sculpted by Bob Murch for the Call of Cthulhu RPG by Chaosium Inc. the figures have transcended the industry and been reissued by many companies. None compare with the lasting tradition of the line. 

This company, reborn in 1999 as Silver Fox Productions Inc., producing RAFM Miniatures, has a proven track record. Our miniatures have sold to thousands of people worldwide, and have received many awards  from the game industry. Other award winning lines include Siege Equipement, and WWII Vehicles. Our new lines include USX Modern Day Heroes, and the upcoming Airship Pirates Miniatures. The company has existed for several decades and will be around to support your gaming needs for years to come. All miniatures are produced for Chaosium's Call of Cthulhu Role-playing Game and continue to be an official licensed product for the Call of Cthulhu Role-playing Game TM.

Why is Shipping and Handling Internationally so High?

Eighty five white metal miniatures are very heavy for shipping purposes. They will mass about 2 Kilograms, we've checked international shipping and it costs over $25 to $30 to ship to Europe and abroad, not adding for shipping materials. This is hard to do. We are doing everything we can to get these products to Call of CthulhuTM players from around the world. We are grateful for your understanding.

For our European backers! After consulting with several logistics companies, we are happy to announce that we will be able to help you save money on import taxes. Because pledges are explicitly for the "funding of a project in a pre-retail environment," we can ship our products to you with a declared commercial value equal to the core manufacturing cost, rather than your full pledge amount. This should save a lot on any VAT taxes which may apply.

story:
Short Summary

Hello. I'm Robert Hohn and am the main designer and creator of Forgotten, a game that you can play right now for free at GameJolt.com:  http://gamejolt.com/games/other/forgotten/14188/


Forgotten is a horror game influenced heavily by the likes of Amnesia, Silent Hill, and Dark Souls. We're talking about a game that you will personally attach yourself to: you will be proud of how you play, of the progress you've made. You will be terrified when something stands in your way. You will be in awe at what you see and what you experience. You'll wake up, play this game, and then go to sleep with it in your dreams... or nightmares.

Forgotten applies advanced psychology to every moment in the game to make sure it has an incredible emotional impact on you. You'll appreciate it as a game, as an experience, and as a piece of art.

Sounds like the kind of game you'd like to play, right?


The Long Version

I'm 19 years old and have been interested in videogames for as long as I've been able to play them. From Zombies Ate My Neighbors on the SNES all the way up to my current favorite: Dark Souls II. My favorite kind of game is and always has been the kind that uses psychology and an incredible presentation to make the experience emotional, personal, and unforgettable.

About a year ago, I started on Forgotten, a game in the vain of those I love. I took a little bit of Amnesia, a bit of Dark Souls, a bit of Journey, a whole lot of Silent Hill, and miniscules amounts from pretty much every game and game designer that I've ever loved. I wrote down a design document that's since been revised some thousands of times and eventually made the first playable version of this game and put it on GameJolt. I did this as sort of a hobby thing.

When my game reached well over 10,000 plays and I started drowning in positive comments and reviews for it, I started developing it more seriously. I now work with a few freelance artists on Forgotten for at least a couple hours each day. I truly think this game has the potential to be big: to reach hundreds of thousands of people, and to be loved  by just as many.

I love Forgotten, but it can NOT be the way I envision it without some help.

If you can contribute even $1 to help us with the issues listed below, your contribution could make all the difference in the quality of Forgotten.

What We Need

Let me be clear: Forgotten is not a solo endeavor. I work with some very, very talented freelance artists who sacrifice their time and their sweat to create professional quality assets for Forgotten. The game would seriously not even be where it's at now without them. Here's two big issues related to this:

  • Even with the current team, we're not able to finish a game like Forgotten in a timely manner. We need more artists, and artists are NOT free. Plus, I'm sure you'd agree that the current team deserves compensation for their hard work, wouldn't you?
  • Software: Dynamic shadows, photo-realistic lighting, great performance on even low-end machines, and living, breathing enemies that will make you jump and squirm all sound nice, don't they? The tools to do all of this aren't free. In fact, the licenses are expensive and they simply will NOT happen without your contribution.

If you think about it, a total goal of $5000 is extremely reasonable. We aren't asking you to buy us computers (I use a $300 laptop and I can personally assure you it is MORE than fast enough to handle almost everything you throw at it) and we aren't asking you to  pay or marketing or anything unrelated to the production of this game. In fact, your contribution will pay for nothing more than our software licenses and resources. --and trust me, it will make ALL the difference.

Forgotten WILL be released regardless of funding. Here's what different levels of funding will do for Forgotten:

- $1500: If we can get at least $1500 in contributions, Forgotten will be able to feature enhanced graphics effects, like dynamic shadows, focal blur, and photo-realistic lighting.
- $2500: If we can get $2500 in contributions, Forgotten will feature SIGNIFICANTLY higher quality textures, voice-acting, and models.
- $5000: If we can reach $5000 in contributions, Forgotten will have even better production values, a much higher attention to detail, and will be finished as much as half a year sooner.
- $6000+: For every $1000 over the main goal, we can add in more and more levels to the game. The base game will be released with six levels, and the extra levels will be added via updates for free.

Of course, I don't expect you to help fund a project that doesn't directly benefit you. That just doesn't make sense. That's why contributing to Forgotten DOES benefit you.

    What You Get

    If 1/4th of everyone who's enjoyed my demo contributed even $1 right now, I would reach my $5000 goal in one minute. But I understand it's hard to give money to something in which you don't get some kind of tangible reward for, so to help entice you, here are the perks we've prepared:

    • $1 Doing What You Can: You don't have to contribute a lot to help make this game a reality. In fact, if just 1/4th of the people who played Forgotten contributed only $1, I would have everything I needed to finish it up and make it great.
    • $10 Early Purchaser: Contributing $10 or more means that once the game is released, you'll receive a digital copy of it! What makes this really great is that you'll also be helping make the game a reality, and you'll be getting a $10 discount off of it's total retail price, which will be $20!
    • $20 Forgotten Enabler: In contributing $20 or more, you've gone above and beyond the call of duty. On top of getting this game when it comes out, you're going to get a spot in the credits. Cool, huh?
    •  $50 Alpha Tester: If you really love Forgotten and you want to get to play this game before it's done, this is the perk for you. You'll get access to the game while it's in-development, a full copy of it once it's out, and your name in the credits!
    •  $100 A Part of the Team: This tier gives you not one, but two extra perks: On top of all the cool stuff above, you also get to be a part of the discussion boards where me and the freelance artists working on Forgotten plan things out. That's right,--you'll even get to comment on our ideas and pitch your own! You also get a very, very special place in the credits for your big contribution to this project.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    So, you like this game and you really, really want to help but don't have anything to invest?

    • Tell your friends about Forgotten. Link them here. Make a post about it on your blog or website.
    • Leave a positive comment or rate on the game's GameJolt page.
    • Keep Forgotten in mind. Maybe you can't contribute right now, but who says that won't be the cast a month from now?

    I'd like to finish this off by saying that I really ,deeply appreciate the time you've invested in just reading through this. I hope you contribute, and if you do, I promise you will be proud of this decision for the rest of your life.

    Oh, and the game's estimated release date is currently the end o 2015, but may be sooner depending on project success. if you have any questions about Forgotten or this crowdfunding program, don't hesitate to contact me at robert_hohn@live.com.
story_txt:
Short SummaryHello. I'm Robert Hohn and am the main designer and creator of 
Forgotten, a game that you can play right now for free at GameJolt.com: 
 http://gamejolt.com/games/other/forgotten/14188/
Forgotten is a horror game influenced heavily by the likes of Amnesia, Silent Hill, and Dark Souls. We're talking about a game that you will personally attach yourself to: you will be proud of how you play, of the progress you've made. You will be terrified when something stands in your way. You will be in awe at what you see and what you experience. You'll wake up, play this game, and then go to sleep with it in your dreams... or nightmares. Forgotten applies advanced psychology to every moment in the game to make sure it has an incredible emotional impact on you. You'll appreciate it as a game, as an experience, and as a piece of art.Sounds like the kind of game you'd like to play, right?
The Long Version
 I'm 19 years old and have been interested in videogames for as long as I've been able to play them. From Zombies Ate My Neighbors on the SNES all the way up to my current favorite: Dark Souls II. My favorite kind of game is and always has been the kind that uses psychology and an incredible presentation to make the experience emotional, personal, and unforgettable. About a year ago, I started on Forgotten, a game in the vain of those I love. I took a little bit of Amnesia, a bit of Dark Souls, a bit of Journey, a whole lot of Silent Hill, and miniscules amounts from pretty much every game and game designer that I've ever loved. I wrote down a design document that's since been revised some thousands of times and eventually made the first playable version of this game and put it on GameJolt. I did this as sort of a hobby thing. When my game reached well over 10,000 plays and I started drowning in positive comments and reviews for it, I started developing it more seriously. I now work with a few freelance artists on Forgotten for at least a couple hours each day. I truly think this game has the potential to be big: to reach hundreds of thousands of people, and to be loved  by just as many.
I love Forgotten, but it can NOT be the way I envision it without some help.
If you can contribute even $1 to help us with the issues listed below, your contribution could make all the difference in the quality of Forgotten.
  What We Need
 Let me be clear: Forgotten is not a solo endeavor. I work with some very, very talented freelance artists who sacrifice their time and their sweat to create professional quality assets for Forgotten. The game would seriously not even be where it's at now without them. Here's two big issues related to this: 
Even with the current team, we're not able to finish a game like Forgotten in a timely manner. We need more artists, and artists are NOT free. Plus, I'm sure you'd agree that the current team deserves compensation for their hard work, wouldn't you?
 Software: Dynamic shadows, photo-realistic lighting, great performance on even low-end machines, and living, breathing enemies that will make you jump and squirm all sound nice, don't they? The tools to do all of this aren't free. In fact, the licenses are expensive and they simply will NOT happen without your contribution.


If you think about it, a total goal of $5000 is extremely reasonable. We aren't asking you to buy us computers (I use a $300 laptop and I can personally assure you it is MORE than fast enough to handle almost everything you throw at it) and we aren't asking you to  pay or marketing or anything unrelated to the production of this game. In fact, your contribution will pay for nothing more than our software licenses and resources. --and trust me, it will make ALL the difference.Forgotten WILL be released regardless of funding. Here's what different levels of funding will do for Forgotten:- $1500: If we can get at least $1500 in contributions, Forgotten will be able to feature enhanced graphics effects, like dynamic shadows, focal blur, and photo-realistic lighting.- $2500: If we can get $2500 in contributions, Forgotten will feature SIGNIFICANTLY higher quality textures, voice-acting, and models.- $5000: If we can reach $5000 in contributions, Forgotten will have even better production values, a much higher attention to detail, and will be finished as much as half a year sooner.- $6000+: For every $1000 over the main goal, we can add in more and more levels to the game. The base game will be released with six levels, and the extra levels will be added via updates for free.Of course, I don't expect you to help fund a project that doesn't directly benefit you. That just doesn't make sense. That's why contributing to Forgotten DOES benefit you. 
  What You Get
If 1/4th of everyone who's enjoyed my demo contributed even $1 right now, I would reach my $5000 goal in one minute. But I understand it's hard to give money to something in which you don't get some kind of tangible reward for, so to help entice you, here are the perks we've prepared:
$1 Doing What You Can: You don't have to contribute a lot to help make this game a reality. In fact, if just 1/4th of the people who played Forgotten contributed only $1, I would have everything I needed to finish it up and make it great.


$10 Early Purchaser: Contributing $10 or more means that once the game is released, you'll receive a digital copy of it! What makes this really great is that you'll also be helping make the game a reality, and you'll be getting a $10 discount off of it's total retail price, which will be $20!

$20 Forgotten Enabler: In contributing $20 or more, you've gone above and beyond the call of duty. On top of getting this game when it comes out, you're going to get a spot in the credits. Cool, huh?

 $50 Alpha Tester: If you really love Forgotten and you want to get to play this game before it's done, this is the perk for you. You'll get access to the game while it's in-development, a full copy of it once it's out, and your name in the credits!

 $100 A Part of the Team: This tier gives you not one, but two extra perks: On top of all the cool stuff above, you also get to be a part of the discussion boards where me and the freelance artists working on Forgotten plan things out. That's right,--you'll even get to comment on our ideas and pitch your own! You also get a very, very special place in the credits for your big contribution to this project.

  Other Ways You Can Help So, you like this game and you really, really want to help but don't have anything to invest?  
Tell your friends about Forgotten. Link them here. Make a post about it on your blog or website. 
 Leave a positive comment or rate on the game's GameJolt page. 

Keep Forgotten in mind. Maybe you can't contribute right now, but who says that won't be the cast a month from now?
 
 I'd like to finish this off by saying that I really ,deeply appreciate the time you've invested in just reading through this. I hope you contribute, and if you do, I promise you will be proud of this decision for the rest of your life.Oh, and the game's estimated release date is currently the end o 2015, but may be sooner depending on project success. if you have any questions about Forgotten or this crowdfunding program, don't hesitate to contact me at robert_hohn@live.com.

story:
Click Magazine: "Paddy himself has previously spearheaded work on highly feted titles like Mad Blocker and Ninjamurai at Open Emotion Studios and looks set to make a big splash with his new endeavour."

UPDATE!

Twisted Feary Tales will now be coming to selected Android Tablet devices in early 2013 shortly after it's iOS release. More info on the Android release in the coming weeks!

Hi there, I'm Paddy Murphy, Lead designer at Time Machine Games.

I'm an award winning Irish games developer, who previously co-founded Open Emotion Studios and had a hand in creating Mad Blocker, Ninjamurai & Revoltin' Youth. I have set up Time Machine Games alongisde some of the most talented folks I've met in Irish Game Development circles and we're currently working away quite hard on our first title, Twiisted Feary Tales - RED.

The last/first time I set up a company I had the luxury of having savings to put into it at the beginning. I was able to get some equipment, some software and keep a roof over the team's head for about 2 months. In that time, we completed our first game Mad Blocker which would go on to receive over 3 million plays worldwide and spawn a PSP/PS3 sequel.

This time around things are a little different and to be able to create this beautiful and compelling game in the best possible way, we are looking to you, to give us a hand.

If you help us bring Twisted Feary Tales to fruition we believe we can craft one of the most beautiful, compelling puzzlers that the iPad has seen to date and set in place a platform to constantly deliver creative & fun new expansions on a quarterly basis.

 

Well, it's not like Limbo (watch the video) ... Although aesthetically it definitely borrows from that title. The game itself is an ongoing title which will deliver modern day retellings of classic fairy tales.

In traditional fairy tales the endings were not quite as pleasant as they have been portrayed by media such as Disney. We want to return these stories to their dark roots and look back to the very first versions to extract the core themes and messages which will shine through in our game.

In terms of gameplay, Twisted Feary Tales plays like a cross between Lemmings, Ghost Trick and Abes Oddysee. You must manipulate the environment to protect Red from enemies, the big bad wolf and various traps. There will be times where you will end up in a "finger twister" desperately scrambling to figure out what is the optimal hand shape to complete a section and gain that coveted 3 star rating.

Twisted Feary Tales is a long term commitment to us and we want to continue developing content for the game, for as long as players are interested.

 

So, why do we need $20,000 dollars. We have a bunch of equipment, software and licenses to purchase to complete the game. We can plug away on development as things are but by the end of our dev cycle we will need:

  • iPads for testing during the development (Minimum of 3 needed, 6 would be ideal)
  • We need a full license for Unity Pro & iOS which will set us back about $3,000
  • We will need an Apple developer license which is a paltry $99, but still worth noting.
  • We will need to keep the roof over our heads for the next 2/3 months to complete development of this title as well as pay the staff involved enough to keep them on this project full time.

 

 

We feel that there is a niche for games that exploit Apples Multi-Touch input and that Twisted Feary Tales could be the game that brings this to the fore. Help us make this game and you could be part of changing the way game design is considered on multi-touch devices. Forever.

Between everyone involved we have created over a dozen successful games across PC, iOS, PS3/PSP and Xbox Indie Games. We know we can deliver on our promise of making a kick-ass puzzler which gives a new lease of life to your iPad.

 

Even if you can't directly contribute, you'd be doing us an amazing service even by sharing, tweeting or generally talking about our campaign!

Thanks for your time and stay tuned for more updates as the game develops, such as stretch goals, more platforms and loads of other exciting bits of news!!!

We hope you join us on this journey and thank you for taking the time to check Twisted Feary Tales out.

All the best,

Paddy Murphy, Lee Cullen, Pierce McKenna, James Sharkey & all the staff here at Time Machine Games.

story:
Visual novel 

A visual novel is an interactive fiction game with diverging storylines, in which the player selects a direction to take the story.

What is Joilly?

Joilly is a website where you can play visual novels online, for free.

On joilly:

  • You can have your own personal library.
  • Save in-game bookmarks.
  • Play visual novels FOR FREE!!! 

BUT before we can launch beta...

We need help funding our next series "Skights" in order to launch our private beta-site.

We need $2000 minimum for:

  • Illustrator for CG art
  • OST (original soundtrack) for Skights
  • Paying for server & bandwidth costs to keep the website running!

Goodies you can get:

  • Invitation to our Private Beta!
  • Free episode of Skights
  • Limited offer of 4 or 5 rents per week for a lifetime. We are NEVER offering this special limited offer again, never ever EVER!

 

If you liked Cafe Rouge and want more visuals novels just like that, please support Joilly today!

story:
Try the alpha

Head over to the Unearth website to download the latest alpha version for free. Please let us know if you have any feedback, as this is always appreciated. But please be gentle! This is our baby remember.

Our Story

You, Cpt. Marvin Diggs have been stationed on Gravelia, a desolate planet in the Delta Pavonis solar system. Your commander informs you that Emperor Zorg III has demanded from you, 1000 tonnes of valuable matter before the next planetary orbit. You must use all of your skill and resources to provide the next shipment. However, you are not alone...


Unearth is an RPG/strategy video game for PC and Android (used by phones and tablets). The objective of the game is to use your skill to build a mining colony on Gravelia while delivering regular shipments to Emperor Zorg III, and fighting off the local inhabitants. You win the game by finishing a series of levels, each protected by a mastermind creature.


The Impact

We're trying to release our first video game, and we need your help. I've had a string of hobby games that I've made just for fun, but if this project succeeds, it will be our first milestone as game developers, and will enable us to self-fund our next game.


What We Need & What You Get

The most expensive resource for us is artwork, as we're programmers -- as you can see from the screenshot, we're not that great with art. Good artwork is the key to a successful game. Funding raised will also help us get the word out about our game once we've finished it. Without this funding, all our efforts will most likely go unseen by the majority of people.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to fund us, that's ok -- there's other ways you can help. Tell your friends to download the beta version from our website (unearthgame.com). You can also help by letting us know what you think of the game, and how you think it can be improved.

story:
English  Español


So will be the damnbarbie team after this campaign

Jajajajajajaja.... its a joke, i hope :P

We have been forced to remove the perks of the campaign for a simple reason, we dont want to mislead anyone. At the moment, we haven´t made any delivered commitments and we don´t want to fail in our promises.

The results aren´t satisfying and, without money we can´t accomplish the objetives within a reasonable time.

We've spent a lot of time and effort on this campaign, the objective was to cover accommodation costs and basic overheads and fully dedicate our time to the project development. But, without funds... we need to spend our time on more effective tasks.

The project goes ahead, but the pace of development is uncertain. I press, we need to eat!

If you are interested in the game, you can follow its developmental at http://www.damnbarbie.com, also you can contact us at damnvix@damnbarbie.com or perales@damnbarbie.com.

Anyway, we will here until the end of campaign and any economic contribution will be a great help to us. Of course, we give a reward to all non anonymous contributors when we have a stable beta version. ;)

Please feel free to ask us anything you want!
Thanks to all!


It was known as “the great famine”, and it was the fault of the governments and their greedy policies. But by the time it reached its peak, any kind of order had already been swept away from the face of the earth. Then, a series of cannibal wars exploded and changed the rules of evolution forever, turning the biggest part of humanity to hordes of hungry zombies.
 But even the zombies were proven harmless against a new race of proud warriors emerged from all that chaos. Raised in a small archipelago from the ashes of civilization, they rose and created a brotherhood of road knights, based on the ancient feudal law but riding huge hot rods instead of war horses and fighting with deadly machine-guns instead of swords and axes. Thousands of miles of abandoned highways are now their kingdom, and zombies are on the brink of extinction, to the point that their cut-off ears are valuable and used as common currency.
 But trouble didn’t finish there. All across this world of fast cars and frantic action, dark, fanatic cults began to grow, hidden in the abandoned residential areas,recruiting soldiers from the starving population and giving them weapons and vehicles to create a lethal army of desperados.
Being someone here, where life is worth less than a zombie ear, will depend on your guts, on the killings you manage to mark on the butt of your gun and on your skill at the wheel.




-Battle vehicles mmrpg.

-8 types of battle vehicles with 3 different classes per type.

-5 game modes.

-Balanced game system, giving priority to skills over levels.

-Play from your browser, no installation, no long downloads.

-New political system.

-Hundreds of weapons and items.

-Extensive customization of your vehicle.

-Continuous terrain maps.



Damn cars! is a massive multiplayer online RPG. Set in a dystopian future  world full of zombies. This game is based in the real-time races and battles

Take your place in a car with a super charged engine and weapons everywhere, face races, battles and achieve your goals. Driving to Glory!

The game has 5 game modes, all in real-time multiplayer:

Races: classic races, you can shoot, spin, explode, pinch ... and run as fast as you can to victory.

Arena: clashes, where the only thing matters is to survive and destroy all your contenders, including "capturing the flag", team battles and many other excuses to destroy your enemies.

Conquer: invade or defend fortified territories for the glory of your tribe ... or just for money.

Pillage: break into "The Instances"and try to loot and survive to tell the tale.

Instance: the perfect combination between a classic RPG dungeon and car-battle game. Take on these challenges together with your friends.



Damn Cars! has huge scenarios full of game play elements, automatic weapons, switches, different kinds of doors,ramps, bonuses ... besides objects and weapons to collect and trade. 

Adjust the difficulty of the scenes in relation to the level of the contents. The priority is the ability rather than the level.

Originally we had eight different vehicles and three classes for each. The cars are different from each other with their own weapons and skills.

-"Yellow jacket": Super fast car specialized in infiltration.

-"Trashhopper": The king of cross country, always looking for you in the sight  of  his mortar.

-"Saber": Fast, easy driving and extreme fire-power, "Battle Gran Turismo".

-"Tarasca": A battering ram fed on fuel and human bones.

-"Mule": Repairs specialist of the Armageddon.

-"Salamander": This modern and technological car will make the others think you're a wizard.

-"Boar":a piece of mobile artillery designed to hunt humans.

-"Kamazu": Big, strong and armored , tanks would be perfect if they were not so slow.

As a multiplayer game, Damn Cars! apart from the classic options like create tribe and trade with them, you can choose to survive on your own as a mercenary or join any of the different sects of the game, they will give you power in exchange for your services and pay them bills.





-Webgl under threejs framework.

-No client installation required.

-Light downloads to play.

-Open source client.

-HUD API



We are a development team of two guys with  programming experience and we decided to create a game with new ideas and technologies.

Our first project, Damn Cars! (we hope the first of many) we decided to choose the WEBGL/GSGL instead of the conventional engine just because it's  easy accessibility and integration of the different platforms for all our users.

We want this project to be the first of a long list of tool games and libraries created for it.



Right now we're dedicating our time completely to the project and need your support to:

-Amplification and contracting new servers.

-Renewing equipment in order to accelerate  the design process and  3D rendering process.

-Software licenses.

-Accommodation and cost for the team.

-Fees and taxes.




The end of August we're launching a mini/demo version of Damn Cars! In which you can try out for your self part of the characteristics of this project .Stay alert for updates.



Please feel free to ask us anything you want!



 English  Español


Así estaremos el equipo de Damnbarbie al finalizar esta campaña.

Jajajajajaja...es broma, o eso espero :P

Nos hemos visto obligados a retirar las recompensas de la campaña por una razón muy sencilla, no queremos engañar a nadie. En este momento no tenemos comprometida ninguna recompensa y no queremos fallar a nadie.

Los resultados obtenidos no son satisfactorios y sin dinero nosotros no podemos cumplir los objetivos en un plazo razonable.

Hemos dedicado mucho tiempo y esfuerzo a esta campaña, el objetivo era cubrir gastos de alojamiento y manutención básicos para poder dedicar nuestro tiempo plenamente al desarrollo del proyecto. Pero, sin recaudación... tenemos que dedicar nuestro tiempo a tareas más efectivas.

El proyecto sigue adelante, pero el ritmo de desarrollo es incierto, insisto, tenemos que comer!

Si estas interesado en el juego puedes seguir su estado de desarrollo en
www.damnbarbie.com y tambien puedes ponerte en contacto con nosotros en las direcciones de e-mail damnvix@damnbarbie.com y perales@damnbarbie.com.

De todas formas, nosotros seguiremos aquí hasta el final de la campaña y cualquier aportación será de gran ayuda para nosotros. Por supuesto, gratificaremos con una recompensa a todos los contribuyentes no-anónimos cuando tengamos una beta estable en funcionamiento ;)

Gracias a todos!


Tras la última gran crisis mundial, provocada por las políticas económicas de los principales gobiernos y por su avaricia, llegó la gran hambruna. Después, una secuencia de guerras caníbales redujo a la mayor parte de la humanidad a hordas de zombis hambrientos. Pero incluso los zombis resultaron inofensivos enfrentados a una nueva raza de orgullosos guerreros que emergieron de todo aquel caos.
Criados en un pequeño archipiélago, surgidos de las cenizas de la civilización, crecieron y crearon una hermandad de caballeros de la carretera basada en la antigua ley feudal pero que cabalgaba sobre grandes coches trucados en lugar de caballos de batalla y luchaba con ametralladoras en lugar de espadas y hachas.
Miles de kilómetros de peligrosas carreteras abandonadas son ahora su reino, y los zombis están al borde de la extinción, hasta tal punto que sus orejas cortadas son valiosas y se usan como moneda de cambio.
Pero los problemas no terminaron ahí: a lo largo y ancho de este mundo de coches veloces y acción frenética, comenzaron a crecer cultos oscuros y fanáticos, atrincherados en las áreas residenciales arrasadas donde ahora reclutan a sus soldados entre la población hambrienta, dándoles vehículos y armas para construir letales ejércitos de saqueadores.
Ser alguien aquí, donde la vida vale menos que una oreja de zombi, dependerá de tus cojones, de las muertes que consigas marcar en la culata de tu arma y de tu pericia al volante.





-Un mmorpg de combates y carreras entre vehículos.

 -8 tipos de vehículos armados, 3 clases diferenciadas por tipo.

-5 modos de juego.

-Equilibrado sistema de juego, primando la habilidad sobre el nivel.

-Juega desde tu navegador, sin instalación, ni largas descargas.

-Novedoso sistema político.

-Cientos de armas y objetos.

-Mapa de terreno continuo.




Damn cars! es un juego de rol multijugador masivo en linea en un distopico futuro repleto de zombies basado en combates y carreras en tiempo real,  sube a bordo bordo de un bólido de cientos de caballos con armas de fuego por todas partes, con el que enfrentarte a carreras, batallas y retos,conduciendo directo hacia el poder y la gloria .

El juego se desarrolla en 5 modos de juego todos ellos multijugador en tiempo real :

-Carrera: clásicas carreras en las que disparar, derrapar, explotar, pellizcar... y  correr lo mas rápido posible sera el camino a la victoria.

-Arena: Enfrentamientos en los que lo importante es sobrevivir y destruir a todos tus contendientes, incluyendo capturas a la bandera,  luchas por equipos y otras muchas escusas para destruir a tus enemigos.

-Conquista: Invade o defiende territorios fortificados para gloria de tu tribu... o simplemente por dinero.

-Pillaje: Entra en las "estancias" sin permiso e intenta saquear sin que te destruyan las defensas.

-Estancia: La combinación perfecta entre una mazmorra clásica de un rpg y el combate de vehiculos. Enfrentate a estos retos acompañado de tus amigos.




Los escenarios de gran tamaño están llenos de elementos jugables, armas automáticas, interruptores, puertas de diferentes tipos, rampas, bonus... ademas de cientos de objetos y armas para recoger y comerciar.

Ajuste de la dificultad del escenario en relación al nivel de los contendientes del mismo, escenarios en los que primara la habilidad frente al nivel.

Tenemos originalmente 8 tipos de vehículos y 3 clases para cada uno de ellos. Cada uno de los cuales con sus propias armas y skills:

-Yello Jacket: Un rapidísimo bólido de carreras especialista en infliltracion.

-Trashhopper: El rey del campo a través, siempre buscándote en la mira de su mortero.

-Saber: Veloz manejable y de fuego potente, el Gran Turismo de Batalla.

-Tarasca: Un ariete alimentado de combustible y huesos humanos .

-Mule: El especialista en reparaciones del armagedon.

-Salamander: Un vehículo tan moderno y tecnológico que los demás pensaran que eres un mago.

-Boar: Una pieza artilleria movil especialista en cazar humanos.

-Kamazu: Grande, fuerte, blindado y artillado, los tanques serian perfectos si no fueran tan lentos.

Como juego de rol multijugador, ademas de las opciones habituales de creación de tribus y opciones de comercio clásicas tendremos también opciones para poder sobrevivir por tu cuenta como mercenario al mejor postor o bien uniéndote a una de las diferentes "sectas" del juego, las cuales te darán poder a cambio de disponer de tus servicios y pagar su factura.  





-Webgl under threejs framework.

 -No client installation required.

 -Light downloads to play.

-Open source client.

-HUD API

Damn Barbie somos un equipo de desarrollo de dos personas, que decidimos desarrollar juegos utilizando nuevas ideas y tecnologias.
En  nuestro primer proyecto conjunto , Damn Cars! (de otros muchos confiamos ;)) decidimos desarrollar en WebGL/GSGL en vez de utilizar un motor convencional por la sencilla accesibilidad al juego por parte de sus usuarios y por su rapida integracion en diferentes plataformas.
Queremos que este sea el primero de una lista de juegos a desarrollar con las herramientas y librerias creadas para este.


Ahora mismo nos estamos dedicando a tiempo completo al proyecto y necesitaríamos presupuesto para:


-Ampliación y contratación de nuevos servidores.

-Renovación de equipos para agilizar el trabajo de diseño y renderizado 3D.

-Licencias de software.

-Alojamiento y manutención

-Tarifas de Indiegogo e impuestos.



A finales de Agosto lanzaremos una versión mini/DEMO de Damn Cars! en el que podáis probar en vuestras manos parte de las características de este proyecto, manteneos atentos a las actualizaciones.
story_txt:
English  EspañolSo will be the damnbarbie team after this campaignJajajajajajaja.... its a joke, i hope :PWe have been forced to remove the perks of the campaign for a simple reason, we dont want to mislead anyone. At the moment, we haven´t made any delivered commitments and we don´t want to fail in our promises.The results aren´t satisfying and, without money we can´t accomplish the objetives within a reasonable time.We've spent a lot of time and effort on this campaign, the objective was to cover accommodation costs and basic overheads and fully dedicate our time to the project development. But, without funds... we need to spend our time on more effective tasks.The project goes ahead, but the pace of development is uncertain. I press, we need to eat!If you are interested in the game, you can follow its developmental at http://www.damnbarbie.com, also you can contact us at damnvix@damnbarbie.com or perales@damnbarbie.com.Anyway, we will here until the end of campaign and any economic contribution will be a great help to us. Of course, we give a reward to all non anonymous contributors when we have a stable beta version. ;)Please feel free to ask us anything you want!Thanks to all!It was known as “the great famine”, and it was the fault of the 
governments and their greedy policies. But by the time it reached its 
peak, any kind of order had already been swept away from the face of the
 earth. Then, a series of cannibal wars exploded and changed the rules 
of evolution forever, turning the biggest part of humanity to hordes of 
hungry zombies. But even the zombies were proven harmless against a new 
race of proud warriors emerged from all that chaos. Raised in a small 
archipelago from the ashes of civilization, they rose and created a 
brotherhood of road knights, based on the ancient feudal law but riding 
huge hot rods instead of war horses and fighting with deadly 
machine-guns instead of swords and axes. Thousands of miles of abandoned
 highways are now their kingdom, and zombies are on the brink of 
extinction, to the point that their cut-off ears are valuable and used 
as common currency. But trouble didn’t finish there. All across this 
world of fast cars and frantic action, dark, fanatic cults began to 
grow, hidden in the abandoned residential areas,recruiting soldiers 
from the starving population and giving them weapons and vehicles to 
create a lethal army of desperados. Being someone here, where life is 
worth less than a zombie ear, will depend on your guts, on the killings 
you manage to mark on the butt of your gun and on your skill at the 
wheel.-Battle vehicles mmrpg.-8 types of battle vehicles with 3 different classes per type.-5 game modes.-Balanced game system, giving priority to skills over levels.-Play from your browser, no installation, no long downloads.-New political system.-Hundreds of weapons and items.-Extensive customization of your vehicle.-Continuous terrain maps.
Damn cars! is a massive multiplayer online RPG. Set in a dystopian future  world full of zombies. This game is
based in the real-time races and battles
Take your place in a car with a super charged engine and weapons everywhere, face races, battles and achieve your
goals. Driving to Glory!The game has 5 game modes, all in real-time
multiplayer:
Races: classic races, you can shoot, spin,
explode, pinch ... and run as fast as you can to victory.
Arena: clashes, where the only thing matters is to survive and destroy all your contenders, including "capturing the flag",
team battles and many other excuses to destroy your enemies.
Conquer: invade or defend fortified territories
for the glory of your tribe ... or just for money.
Pillage: break into "The Instances"and try to
loot and survive to tell the tale.
Instance: the perfect combination between a
classic RPG dungeon and car-battle game. Take on these challenges
together with your friends.Damn Cars! has huge scenarios full of game play
elements, automatic weapons, switches, different kinds of doors,ramps, bonuses ... besides objects and weapons to collect and trade. Adjust the difficulty of the scenes in relation to the level of the contents. The priority is the ability rather than the level.
Originally we had eight different vehicles
and three classes for each. The cars are different from each other with
their own weapons and skills.
-"Yellow jacket": Super fast car specialized in
infiltration.
-"Trashhopper": The king of cross country, always
looking for you in the
sight  of  his mortar.
-"Saber": Fast, easy driving and extreme fire-power, "Battle Gran Turismo".
-"Tarasca": A battering ram fed on fuel and human
bones.
-"Mule": Repairs specialist of the Armageddon.
-"Salamander": This modern and technological car will make the others think you're a wizard.-"Boar":a piece of mobile artillery designed to hunt humans.-"Kamazu": Big, strong and armored , tanks would be perfect if they were not so slow.As a multiplayer game, Damn Cars! apart from the classic options like create tribe and trade with them, you can choose to survive on your own as a mercenary or join any of the different sects
of the game, they will give you power in exchange for your services
and pay them bills.
-Webgl under threejs framework.
 	-No client installation required.
 	-Light downloads to play.
	-Open source client.
	-HUD API
We are a development team of two guys with  programming experience and we decided to create a game with new ideas and technologies.Our first project, Damn Cars! (we hope the
first of many) we decided to choose the  WEBGL/GSGL
instead of the conventional engine  just because it's  easy
accessibility and integration of the different platforms for all our
users.
We want this project to be the first of a long
list of tool games and libraries created for it.
Right now we're dedicating our time completely to the project and need your support to:-Amplification and contracting new servers.-Renewing equipment in order to accelerate  the design process and  3D rendering process.-Software licenses.-Accommodation and cost for the team.-Fees and taxes.The end of August we're launching a mini/demo version of Damn Cars! In which you can try out for your self part of the characteristics of this project .Stay alert for updates.
Please feel free to ask us anything you want!
English  Español
Así estaremos el equipo de Damnbarbie al finalizar esta campaña.Jajajajajaja...es broma, o eso espero :PNos
 hemos visto obligados a retirar las recompensas de la campaña por una 
razón muy sencilla, no queremos engañar a nadie. En este momento no 
tenemos comprometida ninguna recompensa y no queremos fallar a nadie. Los resultados obtenidos no son satisfactorios y sin dinero nosotros no podemos cumplir los objetivos en un plazo razonable.Hemos dedicado mucho tiempo y esfuerzo a esta campaña, el objetivo era cubrir gastos de alojamiento y manutención básicos para poder dedicar nuestro tiempo plenamente al desarrollo del proyecto. Pero, sin recaudación... tenemos que dedicar nuestro tiempo a tareas más efectivas.El proyecto sigue adelante, pero el ritmo de desarrollo es incierto, insisto, tenemos que comer!Si estas interesado en el juego puedes seguir su estado de desarrollo enwww.damnbarbie.com y tambien puedes ponerte en contacto con nosotros en las direcciones de 
e-mail damnvix@damnbarbie.com y perales@damnbarbie.com.De todas 
formas, nosotros seguiremos aquí hasta el final de la campaña y 
cualquier aportación será de gran ayuda para nosotros. Por supuesto, 
gratificaremos con una recompensa a todos los contribuyentes no-anónimos
 cuando tengamos una beta estable en funcionamiento ;)Gracias a todos!Tras la última gran crisis mundial, provocada por las políticas económicas de los principales gobiernos y por su avaricia, llegó la gran hambruna. Después, una secuencia de guerras caníbales redujo a la mayor parte de la humanidad a hordas de zombis hambrientos. Pero incluso los zombis resultaron inofensivos enfrentados a una nueva raza de orgullosos guerreros que emergieron de todo aquel caos.Criados en un pequeño archipiélago, surgidos de las cenizas de la civilización, crecieron y crearon una hermandad de caballeros de la carretera basada en la antigua ley feudal pero que cabalgaba sobre grandes coches trucados en lugar de caballos de batalla y luchaba con ametralladoras en lugar de espadas y hachas. Miles de kilómetros de peligrosas carreteras abandonadas son ahora su reino, y los zombis están al borde de la extinción, hasta tal punto que sus orejas cortadas son valiosas y se usan como moneda de cambio.Pero los problemas no terminaron ahí: a lo largo y ancho de este mundo de coches veloces y acción frenética, comenzaron a crecer cultos oscuros y fanáticos, atrincherados en las áreas residenciales arrasadas donde ahora reclutan a sus soldados entre la población hambrienta, dándoles vehículos y armas para construir letales ejércitos de saqueadores. Ser alguien aquí, donde la vida vale menos que una oreja de zombi, dependerá de tus cojones, de las muertes que consigas marcar en la culata de tu arma y de tu pericia al volante.-Un mmorpg de combates y carreras entre vehículos. -8 tipos de vehículos armados, 3 clases diferenciadas por tipo. -5 modos de juego. -Equilibrado sistema de juego, primando la habilidad sobre el nivel. -Juega desde tu navegador, sin instalación, ni largas descargas. -Novedoso sistema político. -Cientos de armas y objetos. -Mapa de terreno continuo.Damn cars! es un juego de rol multijugador masivo en linea en un distopico futuro repleto de zombies basado en combates y carreras en tiempo real,  sube a bordo bordo de un bólido de cientos de caballos con armas de fuego por todas partes, con el que enfrentarte a carreras, batallas y retos,conduciendo directo hacia el poder y la gloria .El juego se desarrolla en 5 modos de juego todos ellos multijugador en tiempo real :-Carrera: clásicas carreras en las que disparar, derrapar, explotar, pellizcar... y  correr lo mas rápido posible sera el camino a la victoria.-Arena: Enfrentamientos en los que lo importante es sobrevivir y destruir a todos tus contendientes, incluyendo capturas a la bandera,  luchas por equipos y otras muchas escusas para destruir a tus enemigos.-Conquista: Invade o defiende territorios fortificados para gloria de tu tribu... o simplemente por dinero.-Pillaje: Entra en las "estancias" sin permiso e intenta saquear sin que te destruyan las defensas.-Estancia: La combinación perfecta entre una mazmorra clásica de un rpg y el combate de vehiculos.
